loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, es una mujer muy responsable y puntual, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 63 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la administración de su bodega y al alquiler de cuartos, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente. Juana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Damas del Oriente”, desde hace tres años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita 800 soles, que será invertido en más productos comestibles para implementar su negocio. La meta de Juana es hacer crecer más su negocio y tener más cuartos para alquilar.
texts.en:
Juana is a responsible and punctual woman who lives in the District of Manantay, Ucayali Region. She is 63 years old and the mother of three adult children. Juana operates a grocery store and also offers rooms for rent. She manages both businesses from home and has the support of her husband, who is self-employed. Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Damas del Oriente” (Women of the East) for three years.

The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy products for her grocery store. She now needs a loan of 800 soles so that she can acquire more food items to keep her business running. Juana’s goal is to continue growing her business and provide more rooms for rent.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos en la casa heredada de sus padres. Desde hace 7 años, junto a su esposo, su principal actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, y para ello alquilan un auto, pues no cuentan con uno propio.
Cada día, su esposo recorre los diferentes puntos de su ciudad ofreciendo este servicio, mientras que Evelyn se encarga de la correcta administración de los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Adicionalmente, tiene un establo que acondicionó en su casa para la crianza de vacas y toro. Con ambas actividades, logra suplir los estudios y alimentación de sus pequeños hijos.
El mayor deseo de Evelyn es tener su propio carro, para que sus ganancias sean mejor aprovechadas. 

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo de permanencia (casi 5 años) en su banco comunal ha demostrado ser responsable en la devolución de los créditos. En esta ocasión, seguirá demostrando su responsabilidad en el pago a tiempo de sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de repuestos para la reparación y mantenimiento del carro que vienen utilizando.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 26 and lives with her husband and 2 small children in the house she inherited from her parents. For 7 years, along with her husband, she has had a business offering a taxi service. They rent a car for this because they don't have one of their own. Every day, her husband frequents different places in the city to offer this service, and Evelyn is in charge of administering the income to cover their family's economic needs. Additionally, she has a stable at her home in which she raises cows and a bull. With both of these activities, she manages to pay for the education and food costs of her small children. Her biggest wish is to have her own car, so she can make the most of her earnings. This is her ninth opportunity to have a credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and during this time (almost 5 years) in her communal bank, she has proven herself to be responsible with repaying her credits. On this occasion, she will keep demonstrating her responsibility and making her payments on time. The money that she is requesting will go towards the purchase of parts and maintenance of the car that they are using.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and maintain the car with that she uses for her work

loans.name: Mercedes Natividad

texts.es:
Nuestra socia NATIVIDAD, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, la socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, pero radica más de un año en Pisac, situado en la provincia de Calca, Pisac es lugar obligado para parar si uno está camino al valle sagrado de los incas, este sitio tiene unos hermosos mausoleos inkas, y todos los días hay una feria típica en el centro del pueblo dónde venden todas las artesanías que los pobladores fabrican. 

Nuestra socia tienen 47 años y alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, la socia es madre soltera ella tiene 3 hijos de (25, 20, 12) años de edad, la socia trabaja en el mercado central junto a la feria artesanal vendiendo frutas y verduras, en el poblado de Pisac, nuestra socia me comento que ella deseaba vender artesanía aquí a los turistas que visitan el complejo arqueológico de Pisac, pero el gremio de artesanos no la dejaba unirse a ellos, ella no encontró mejor cosa que vender sino frutas y verduras junto a los artesanos, esto fue una idea muy buena porque los turistas y artesanos eran un gran mercado para ella, ella se dio cuenta de que podía vender esto a ellos de lo contrario nadie lo haría, así que vió que este negocio era nuevo y trajo poco a poco a más mujeres con diversas variedades de productos a la zona, es así que hoy en día este poblado se hizo y hace cada vez más grande y diverso. 

Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar más productos de frutas y verduras al por mayor y venderlos en la gran feria de Pisac. 

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad de que ella pueda seguir reinvirtiendo en su negocio y de este modo seguir apoyando a sus menores hijos
texts.en:
Our member Natividad belongs to the community bank “INTIWATANA”. She is a native of the city of Cusco but has been living for more than a year in Pisac, located in the province of Calca. Pisac is an obligatory stop if one is on his way to the sacred valley of the Incas; this site has some beautiful Inca mausoleums and every day there is a traditional fair in the town center where handicrafts made by locals are sold. Natividad is 47 years old and alternates her household responsibilities with business; she is a single mother of three (25, 20 and 12 years old) and she works in the central market, next to the crafts fair in Pisac, selling fruits and vegetables. She shared with us that she wanted to sell handicrafts here to the tourists visiting the archeological complex of Pisac, but the craftsman union would not allow her to join them; she found no better way than selling fruits and vegetables next to the craftsmen. This was a good idea because the tourists and craftsmen were a big market for her; she realized she could sell these items to them since nobody else would; she noticed this was a new market and little by little it attracted more women with diverse products to the area; nowadays the area is growing and becoming more diverse. Natividad is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk and then sell them in the big fair of Pisac. She is grateful and values the opportunity to continue investing in her business and be able to support her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia tiene 65 años de edad es casada  tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cuando ella empezó a vender fue por la razón de que su esposo estuvo con problemas de salud, por lo que tomo la iniciativa de vender ropa porque no tenía el ingreso suficiente para proporcionarle a su familia la ayuda necesaria, pero ella inicio ahorrando muy pocas cantidades de ganancias por lo que fue así que aumentando su inventario, ella recorría muchos lugares en busca de obtener nuevos clientes, por lo que aprendió a obtener experiencia para interactuar con sus clientes. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mercadería ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos. Su meta es continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para tener una fuente ingresos fija.
texts.en:
Adilia is 65 years old, married, and has 2 children in her care. She sells clothing. She started the business because her husband was having health problems, so she took the initiative to sell clothing because she did not have enough income to support her family. She started saving very small amounts of her earnings, and in this way she increased her inventory. She went to many places in search of new customers; through this experience she learned how to interact with her customers. Her loan will be used to purchase merchandise, since she currently has many orders. Her goal is to continue investing in her business in order to have a regular source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to buy clothing)

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Estrellas Solitarias” desD. hace 5 años atrás, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 09 hijos. Ella no estudió, se dedica a la compra y venta D. flores.

Domitila nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar más diversidad D. flores para incrementar su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es mantener y agrandar su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que dan las promotoras sobre como mejorar los negocios D. cada una D. las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Domitila has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellas Solitarias” (The Lone Stars) for the past five years. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 58 years old, married, and has nine children. Domitila did not attend school, yet she manages a business buying and selling flowers.

She tells us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to increase her operating capital. At the moment, she is requesting a new loan for 2500 soles in order to buy a wider variety of flowers to increase her sales.

Domitila says her dream for the future is to maintain and expand her business. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the training seminars provided by the loan officers. They are a great help in improving the businesses of each of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flowers to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos en su casa propia.
Lleva 25 años desarrollando las diversas actividades del campo, paralelo a ello, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda. Pero el trabajo que más le gusta a Julia es la agricultura, debido a que tiene disponibles los productos de sus cosechas en cada temporada para la venta; los producto que ella siembra son la papa y el maíz. A su vez tiene vacas y ovejas que cuida en el establo que implementó en su misma casa.
Julia cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo, y para el futuro desea incrementar sus cultivos con la adquisición de otros terrenos.

Esta es la oportunidad número 13 en que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa (alimento de sus animales).
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 7 children in their own house. For 25 years she has been doing diverse farm activities; in parallel, she has a grocery store in her house. But the work she enjoys the most is agriculture since she has the products of her harvests available to sell every season; she plants potato and corn. At the same time, she has cows and sheep that she cares for in the stable she built in her house. Julia has the support of her children and her husband, and in the future, her wish is to increase her crops by acquiring more plots of land. This is the 13th opportunity of a loan with MFP; she is very happy to belong to her community bank and she commits herself, one more time, to make her payments on time. The money she is now requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer to plant alfalfa (feed for her animals).

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 54 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
DesD. hace 10 años tiene una tienda D. comestibles, y con este negocio logró mejorar sus actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. Luisa trabaja todos los días en la atención D. su bodega, con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería para tener su tienda surtida D. los productos D. mayor demanda.
Con el paso D. los años, este negocio le ha permitido crecer en su economía, por lo que piensa a futuro seguir desarrollando esta actividad hasta tener una tienda más granD. y mejor implementada. 

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP, ella tiene varios años D. experiencia en el trabajo solidario como parte D. un banco comunal, el cual considera que ha hecho parte D. su vida. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para su tienda, además D. sacos D. abono para sembrar pastizales, principal alimento D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Luisa is 54 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own house. For 10 years she has had a grocery store and with this business she managed to improve her agricultural and cattle activities. Luisa works everyday tending her store with the help of her children. Every week she stocks up with new merchandise to keep her store supplied with the high demand products. After many years, this business has allowed her to grow her income, and in the future she plans to continue this activity until she has a bigger and better developed store. This is loan number 12 with MFP; she has many years of experience of solidarity work as party of a community bank which she considers now a part her life. The money that she is requesting now will be invested in buying merchandise for her store, plus sacks of fertilizer to plant pasture fields for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, es una socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de agua en sachet y a la venta de plátanos, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a lo mismo. Yolanda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Ucayali”.
Con este crédito de 200 soles comprará plátanos al por mayor. El anhelo de Yolanda es comprarse una máquina de coser y poner un taller de costura ya que le gusta esta actividad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a new member who lives in the District of Manantay, Ucayali Region. She is 29 years old and the mother of two dependent children. She sells sachet water and bananas out of her home. She has the support of her husband who also helps with the business. Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Ucayali” (The Breezes of Ucayali).

With this loan of 200 soles, she will buy bananas in bulk. Yolanda dreams of obtaining a sewing machine so that she can open her own sewing workshop since she enjoys this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Santos Trinidad

texts.es:
la sra. S. Trinidad F. se dedica a la venta de refrescos y frijoles congelados, tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad, S. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en Laure Abajo, San Lorenzo. 
los frijoles son bien vendidos en esta zona, este tipo de alimento se come en el desayuno y en la cena en muchas casas de esta zona.
vende los refrescos diariamente pero a veces se queda sin producto y los carros repartidores pasan solo una vez a la semana y esto le complica ya que se queda sin vender y sin tener ganancias.
necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos y frijoles y asi tener un buen inventario para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. Trinidad F. sells refreshments and frozen beans. She has little time in this business; S. is 49 years old and lives in Laure Abajo, San Lorenzo.

The beans are sold very well in the area; this type of food is eaten for breakfast and dinner in many houses in the area.

S. sells refreshments daily but sometimes she does not have the products and the delivery trucks are only around once a week and that is a problem for her since she has nothing to sell and is not able to have any profits.

She needs the loan to buy more refreshments and beans so that she can have a good inventory to cover all the necessities of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshments and frozen beans.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
La señora Demetria es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 13 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudio primaria completa,  ella se dedica a la compra y venta de combustible.

Demetria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo comprar mas mercadería.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar kerosén, gasolina.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su grifo en Mazocruz.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Demetria has been a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank for the past 13 years. She is from the district of Santa Rosa in El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married and has 2 children.She completed her primary school studies and works in the purchase and sale of fuel. Demetria says that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 new soles, she was able to buy more supplies. She is asking for another loan of 1,500 new soles with which she will buy kerosene and gasoline. Her dream for the future is to have her own gas station in Mazocruz. What she likes most about her communal bank is being able to save.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kerosene and gasoline

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 10 años, vive en el distrito de Santa Rosa , provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de combustible.

Gabriela nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar gasolina, kerosén, petróleo.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar  su mercadería  y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la organización de las socias y la facilidad de préstamo.
texts.en:
Gabriela has been a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank for 10 years. She lives in the district of Santa Rosa, in the province of El Collao and department of Puno. She is 33 years old, has a common-law marriage and 3 children. She completed her secondary school education and works in the purchase and sale of fuel. Gabriela says that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 new soles, she was able to increase her working capital. She is now asking for a loan of 2,500 new soles with which she will be able to buy gasoline, kerosene and petroleum. Her dream for the future is to increase her merchandise so that she and her family can get ahead. What she likes most about her communal bank is the organization of members and the access to loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gasoline, kerosene and petroleum

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia GREGORIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, la socia  radica en el poblado de Pisac, provincia de Calca departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tienen 48 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 21, 16 años; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia compra y vende artesanía, la socia compra materia prima para elaborar la arcilla y fabricar diferentes trabajos, muchas veces compra productos ya hechos y los vende al por mayor o al por menor, ella tiene su stand en la feria principal del pueblo que esta ubicado en la plaza principal de Pisac a unos metros del conjunto arqueológico de Pisac en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas. Nuestra socia trabaja junto a sus hijos mayores con artesanía, en está temporada suelen llevar los productos a los países vecino aprovechando el verano y los venden en las playas y si no están ahí viajando están siempre en Pisac, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos y materia prima para elaborar y vender artesanía.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y les envía a sus colaboradores en este sueño un fuerte abrazo y un sincero agradecimiento a la distancia.
texts.en:
Our member, Gregoria, belongs to the communal bank “INTIWATANA,” she lives in the town of Pisac, province of Calca, department of Cusco.

Our member is 48 years old and is married; she has 4 children of 28, 26, 21, and 16 years of age. Gregoria varies her activities in her home and commerce, she buys and sells crafts. She buys raw materials to make the clay and make different pieces of work; many times she buys products already made and sells them wholesale or retail. She has her stall in the main market of the main square of Pisac, which is a few meters near the archeological site of Pisac in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas. Gregoria works with her eldest children with the crafts. In this season, they tend to take the products to neighboring countries taking advantage summer months and sell them in the beaches, if they’re not traveling they are always in Pisac. Gregoria needs a loan to buy goods and raw materials and to make and sell her crafts.

The member is grateful and wants to show her satisfaction in being able to keep growing with her own business and she sends those who help her with her dreams a great hug and a sincere long distance thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make her products from clay.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
la sra. Deysi M. V. tiene 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de sandalias y utensilios de plastico para el hogar, como ser picheles, quita tela arañas, coladores,limpiadores de servicios etc.
tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, en este momento necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia ya que esta vendiendo bastante en estos ultimos dias.
se siente muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo. 
vende sus productos de manera ambulante en diferentes empresas privadas y estatales de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. 
Deysi necesita el credito para salir adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deysi M. V. is 42 years old, and she sells sandals and plastic utensils for the home, like pitchers, items to remove spider webs, strainers, cleaners for the bathroom etc.

Deysi has some years of experience in this business and she needs the loan to buy more merchandize since she is selling a lot these days.

She is very happy because her business is growing.

Deysi sells her products as a roving salesperson to different private and state businesses of the city of San Lorenzo.

Deysi needs the loan to get ahead in life with her family and business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals and plastic utensils.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 39 años, vive con sus padres y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 12 años tiene un establo que acondicionó en su vivienda donde cría vacas y toros. Pero también tiene una tienda de comestibles y tiene algunos terrenos de cultivo, por lo que Martina se debe dar tiempo de atender sus negocios y a sus menores hijos.
Por tal motivo, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, quienes le ayudan con la atención de la tienda y con el cuidado de sus animales.
Martina considera que sus mejores ganancias son cuando logra vender a sus animales después de varios meses de crianza y engorde, pues considera que no invierte mucho en ello, pues los alimenta con la alfalfa que ella misma cultiva.

Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP y se siente muy satisfecha de ser parte de un banco comunal, pues éste le ha traído experiencias muy gratas junto con sus compañeros de grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita será destinado a la compra de medicinas para su ganado, así como sacos de abono para sembrar más extensiones de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Martina is 39 years old and lives with her parents and 3 children in her own home.

Since 12 years ago, she owns a stable that she set up in her home and she breeds cows and bulls. But she also has a grocery store and has some land for crops. Martina needs time to take care of her business and her small children.

It is because of this that she has the support of her parents, who help her with the store and to take care of her animals.

Martina believes that her greatest profits are when she is able to sell her animals after a few months of raising and fattening them up and she considers that she does not invest too much in it as she feeds them alfalfa that she herself cultivates.

This is her 12th loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner), and she is very happy to be a part of a communal bank since it has given her many pleasant experiences with the people in the group. The money that she needs will be used to buy medicine for her livestock, as well as sacks of fertilizer to plant more alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and medicines for her animals.

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Verónica De Los Ángeles es una mujer muy responsable y luchadora, este no es el primer financiamiento que ella tiene con Fundación León 2000 su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida, todavía realiza la venta de comida pero solamente los fines de semana porque el resto de la semana se dedica a ofrecer sus productos por lo que sus 5 hijos son su mayor obligación, a pesar de los problemas que le ha tocado enfrentar ha salido delante de la mejor manera posible. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, zapatos, vestidos y además en ropa interior. Su deseo es mantener ambos negocios que son lo más importante para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Verónica De Los Ángeles is a very responsible and hardworking woman. This is not her first loan that she gets with Fundación León 2000 (Kiva’s field partner). Her economic activity is to sell general merchandize in the weekdays, before she used to sell food and she still does it but only on the weekends. Her 5 children are her greatest responsibility; despite the problems that she has had to face she has been able to get ahead in the best way possible. She needs this loan for her work capital that will be used to buy pants, shirts, shoes, dresses and underwear. Her wish is to have both businesses since they are important to take care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es: La señora Maribell J. F., tiene 45 años de edad y habita con sus hijos en el Barrio Laureles Sur es madre soltera, de dos hijos de las edades de 17 y 22 años, la menor estudia la escuela secundaria y el mayor esta en la universidad estudiando Abogacia, la señora F. ha podido con su fuerte trabajo, financiarle a su hijo su carrera univesitaria, el mayor anhelo de la señora sería el tener las posibiilidades de ofrecerle a sus hijos la preparación univercitaria para que sean ciudadadanos de provecho, con este prestamo ella podra construir un cuarto en el patío de su casa para brindarles a ellos mejores comodidades de vida y mejor privacidad a ella.
texts.en:
Ms. Maribell J. F. is 45 years old. She lives with her children in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is a single mother of two children, aged 17 and 22 years old. The youngest studies at high school and the oldest is in college studying law. Ms. F. has been able, with her hard work, to finance her son in his college major. Her biggest wish is to be able to offer her children a university education so that they can be good citizens. With this loan she will be able to build a room in the patio of her home to make their lives more comfortable and give her more privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in the back part of her house

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is a 36-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother to six children who are all minors. She is married to Aldwin, a construction worker (laborer). The salary of her husband is insufficient for their daily needs.

As a woman of dreams, in 2003, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started selling dry goods and it really helped them to meet their needs. Now on her ninth loan, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos to pay for a variety of dry goods.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business and pay for the needs of her six children in school.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of dry goods

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio AURELIO, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, El socio vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 46 años de edad, el es casado y tiene dos hijos de 18, 11 años de edad; el socio se dedica a la exportación de cerámicas al por mayor, el realiza fichas de ajedrez en arcilla hace fichas de un bando con las características de los inkas, sus llamas, sus chaskis, sus fortalezas de piedra y el otro bando de los españoles, nuestro socio trabaja junto a su esposa elaborando cada pieza al detalle y las cajitas que harán de base para la batalla. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en sus trabajos y así seguir enviando al mundo su trabajo.

Nuestro socio  valora y agradece el préstamo y  la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, AURELIO, belongs to the “INTIWATANA” cooperative bank. He lives in Pisac, which is situated 40 minutes from the city of Cusco, in the Calca province. It is a small town that has inherited some beautiful Incan constructions, and is an obligatory visit for tourists who travel to see Cusco. Aurelio is 46 years old, married, and has two children ages 18 and 11. He dedicates himself to exporting ceramics at wholesale. He makes clay chess pieces that feature traditional Inca symbols such as their llamas, Chaski runners and stone works on one side, and Spaniards on the other side. He works alongside his wife making each detailed piece, as well as the boxes that serve as the base for the game. Our member requests a loan to reinvest into his business, so he can continue sending his work out into the world. He values and appreciates the loan, and the opportunities presented him via this medium. Likewise, he commits to making his payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue making his clay chess pieces to export to different parts of the world.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Nuestro socio JULIO CESAR, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, El socio vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 40 años de edad, el es casado y tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años de edad; el socio se dedica al comercio minorista, el trabaja junto a su esposa en la realización de artesanía, ellos tiene una tienda en la plaza principal del pueblo de Pisac y venden cerámicas, piedras cuarzos, huacos, desde hace 15 años, ellos solicitan el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio como capital de trabajo. Ellos necesitan compras piedras en diferentes colores para que los otros artesanos que se dedican a la realización de joyas compren las piedras para elaborar pendientes, collares, anillos y otros trabajos en plata y alpaca.

Nuestro socio  valora y agradece el préstamo y  la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, JULIO CESAR, belongs to the “INTIWATANA” cooperative bank. He lives in Pisac, which is situated 40 minutes from the city of Cusco, in the Calca province. It is a small town that has inherited some beautiful Incan constructions, and is an obligatory visit for tourists who travel to see Cusco. Julio is 40 years old, married, and has three children ages 13, 11 and 6. He dedicates himself to retail sales, working together with his wife to sell handicrafts. They have a store located in the main plaza of the town of Pisac, where they have been selling ceramics, quartz stones, and clay pottery for the past 15 years. They are requesting a loan to reinvest into their business as working capital. They need to buy various colors of stones to sell to other craftspeople that dedicate themselves to making jewelry, and need the stones to make pendants, necklaces, rings and other works in silver and alpaca. Our member values and appreciates access to credit via this means, and likewise commits to pay the loan back within the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, stones and quartz, to make jewelry.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
La persona que sale en la foto es la esposa Claudia Ortiz Urbano.
Jacinto quiere apoyar a su esposa para invertir mas mercancía en el negocio denominado “Miscelánea Claudia” este ya tiene 4 años ubicado en su casa, donde venden refrescos, botanas, dulces, comida enlatada, agua y más.
Ellos son una familia estable en el que tienen 2 hijos; a los cuales tienen que darles una mejor calidad de vida y un buen patrimonio, es por ello que Jacinto trabaja en la maquiladora para obtener más ingresos y su esposa en la tienda para que este al pendiente del hogar.
texts.en:
The person pictured in the photo is Jacinto´s wife, Claudia Ortiz Urbano. Jacinto wants to help his wife invest in more merchandise for her business, "Miscelánea Claudia", which for the past 4 years has been set up in their house and is where they sell soft drinks, snacks, candy, canned food, water and more. They are from a solid family with 2 children, to whom they have to give a better standard of living and a good patrimony. This is the reason why Jacinto works in an in-bond factory to earn more income and his wife works at the store so she can take care of the household.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for their store

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Iris del Carmen A. T., Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
 De Managua, ella tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y dos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento, Hierro y para terminar de  construir una pared por lo que este se encontraba en mal estado (antes estaba construida de zinc).
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iris del Carmen A. T. works as a custodian at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute. Originally from Managua, she has three children in her care and has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. Over this period of time, she has invested three loans into making improvements to her home. Thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL, she is an excellent client. The loan requested would be invested into purchasing construction materials such as: sand, cement, iron, and items to finish building a wall that was in disrepair (it was previously built out of zinc). Her goal is to provide greater security and a higher standard of living for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to, and expand, her house.

loans.name: Ramon Daniel

texts.es:
El Señor Ramón Daniel D., Labora como Mercado logó en el Dpto. de Capacitación del Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, el tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado un créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 1 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y para terminar de  construir un baño por lo que este se encontraba en mal estado.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Daniel D. works as a market specialist in the Training Department of the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He has one school-aged child in his care, is married, and has worked with CEPRODEL for one year. Over this period of time, he has invested 1 loan into making improvements to the house where he lives. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he is an excellent client. The loan requested would be invested into purchasing construction materials such as: cement, iron, and items to finish building a bathroom to replace an existing one that is in a state of disrepair. His goal is to provide greater security and a higher standard of living for his child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to, and to expand, his house.

loans.name: Rosa Herminia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Herminia C. García, Labora como  Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua, ella tiene un  hijos a su cargo, y  este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: perlines y zinc, para el techo de su casa de habitación por lo que el anterior se encontraba en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Herminia C. García works as a custodian at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She has one school-aged child in her care, is married, and has worked with CEPRODEL for one year. Over this period of time, she has invested the loan into making improvements to the house where she lives. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, she is an excellent client. The loan requested would be invested into purchasing construction materials such as: beams and zinc for the roof of her house, which is in a state of disrepair. Her goal is to provide greater security and a higher standard of living for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to, and expand, her house.

loans.name: Blanca Lilia

texts.es: Blanca Lilia M. y su esposo tienen 2 combis en el que las utiliza para transportar niños y jóvenes a su escuela. En este momento están trabajando muy bien solo que quieren tramitar el permiso federal de una de ellas, que el año pasado la compro con un préstamo que se le otorgo de esta institución. En el crédito que tuvieron realizaron sus pagos puntuales en que están agradecidos por el apoyo ya que pudieron obtener un nuevo transporte para su beneficio económico
texts.en:
Blanca Lilia M. and her husband have two combis which they use to transport children and young people to school. At the moment the vehicles are working very well, but Blanca wants to obtain the documentation for one of them, like she bought last year with a loan from this institution. The couple made their repayments punctually, and they are grateful for the financial support which enabled them to obtain a new vehicle and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: federal permit

loans.name: Audelia Clarisa

texts.es:
La Señora Audelia Clarisa Salmerón Dávila, Labora como Metodóloga en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  ella es una cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y Hierro, para la construcción de una pared en la parte trasera del patio, ya que anteriormente estaba cerrado con  alambre de púa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Audelia Clarisa Salmerón Dávila works as a methodology specialist at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She has two school-age children in her care and is married. She has worked with CEPRODEL [a Kiva field partner] for three years. During this time she has taken four loans for improvements to her home, all financed by CEPRODEL. She is an excellent borrower. This loan is for an investment in construction materials such as sand, cement and iron, for the construction of a wall on the far end of her patio. This area was previously closed off with barbed wire. The wall will provide the family with more security and will give her children better living conditions

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
En la imagen aparece la esposa  Yoana Díaz Miranda.
Carlos Cárdenas López es una persona trabajadora que esta preocupado por el bienestar y seguridad de la familia. Es por ello que quiere comprar una protección para la puerta para que este mas segura al momento de el irse a trabajar. Como apenas esta familia tiene poco de haber adquirido su vivienda quieren ir poco a poco haciéndoles mejoras para que sus hijos vivan lo mas comido que se pueda.
texts.en:
In the photo above we see the borrower's wife, Yoana Díaz Miranda. Carlos Cárdenas López is a hard-working individual who is concerned about the well-being and security of his family. For this reason, he wants to buy protection for the door of his home so that it will be more secure when he leaves for work. Because this family has not had the house for long, they want to make improvements little by little so that their children can live as comfortably as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Protection for the door of the home

loans.name: Alberto Ronaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Alberto Ronaldo T. López, Labora como Vigilante en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 El tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y mano de obra, para embaldosar el porche de su casa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alberto Ronaldo T. López works as a security guard at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He has two school-age children and is married. He has worked with CEPRODEL [a Kiva field partner] for two years. During this time he has used two loans to invest in home improvements, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent borrower. The current loan is for the purchase of construction materials such as sand and cement, and to pay workers, to place tile on the porch of his house. His goal is to offer better security and quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Claudia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  Señora Claudia del Socorro M. C., Labora como Inspector en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y mano de obra, para construcción de una pared de su casa de habitación ya que esta estaba construida de tabla.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia del Socorro M. C. works as an inspector for the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She is raising two school-age children. She is married, and she has worked with loans from Ceprodel for three years. During this period of time she has invested three loans in improving her house, which she has done thanks to the loans from Ceprodel. The loan she is requesting is to pay for construction materials like sand, cement, and labor costs to build a wall in her house because it was built from wood. Her objective is to give her children greater security and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to her home

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La  Señora Maribel R. B., Labora técnica en recursos laborales del Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de perlines, ya que piensa reemplazar los cuartones de madera de su techo.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel R. B. works as a technician in labor resources for the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute of Managua. She is raising two school-age children. She is married, and she has worked with loans from Ceprodel for one year. During that time period, thanks to Ceprodel, she has invested the loan in making improvements to her house. The loan she is requesting is to buy beams because she plans to replace the wood on her roof. Her objective is to give her children greater security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to her home

loans.name: Arcelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Arcelyn D. R. is from Lilo-an, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She operates a dressmaking business and her husband is a security guard earning a meager income. Arcelyn has been in business for eight years and approximately earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Arcelyn joined PMPC to improve her living conditions and her business as well. She repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase textiles for her dressmaking business. Now, she is applying for a loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. It is her fourth loan and will be used to support her dressmaking business.

loans.use: To purchase textiles for dressmaking

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 37, is married and lives with her seven children in Dangkao district, Cambodia. N. is engaged in a business of preparing fabrics at home and she is able to earn an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2001. Her husband is a construction foreman in the city, earning an income of $3 per day. 

N. and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, N. is requesting a loan of $200 from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. She wants to use the expected loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. With the remainder, she wants to buy more fabrics to expand her business. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike and more fabric

loans.name: Mariabel

texts.en:
Mariabel P. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mariabel and her husband work hard making Nipa roof (thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm) and selling it to the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month.

In 2000, Mariabel joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php 14,900.00 from PMPC. Mariabel is requesting the amount of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business of Nipa roof making. This will be the 15th loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Acquiring additional materials for making Nipa roof (thatched roof made from the leaves of the Nipa palm)

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S., 28, is married and lives with her two children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. S. raises pigs at home and she is able to earn US $3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2003. Her husband is employed at the Siem Reap International Airport earning US $5 per day. 

S. and her husband work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more piglets to raise. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun K., 47, is married and lives with her three school-aged children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia.

K. grows crops such as rice and corn and she is able to earn an income of US$3 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2007. Her husband always helps her with her business and is able to earn an income of US$3 per day.

Kimheang and her husband try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well.

As a result, Kimheang is requesting a loan of US$700 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a water pump, seeds, and fertilizer to expand her farming output. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a water pump, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung S., 46, is a widow and lives with her two children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. S. sells desserts at a local market in the province and she is able to earn US $8.50 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2000. Her daughter also runs a dessert stand at the market earning US $7 per day to help support the family as well. 

S. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. S. is requesting a loan of US $800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase rice from the local farmers in her village to stock for resale in the most profitable season. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen K., 23, is married and lives with her only child in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. K. is a housewife, while her husband is a recycler who travels everywhere in the province to collect and buy recycling materials. He has been in this business since 2006. K. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family, and they are seeking a loan to improve their business. 
   
K. is requesting a loan of US $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike and more recycling materials. When asked, K. said that the motorbike will help her husband transport his materials to sell at a factory so he can generate more income for his family. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy a motorbike and recycling materials

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek P., 26, is married and lives with her two young children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. Since 2003, P. has been raising pigs at home in her village, and she is able to earn an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is employed at a non-government organization for his village, where he earns USD 5 per day. P. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family, and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, P. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike and more piglets to raise for sale. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy a motorbike and piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna F. is from the village of Owaon. She is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. Two of them are adults while the youngest is a student.  To make a living, Paterna raises crops. Planting, harvesting, and selling  a variety of root crops and vegetables, while not the only means for generating revenue, is the business's main source of income. Paterna has been raising crops for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month, on average.

In 2009, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, fertilizers, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 3rd loan Paterna has taken out by from PMPC, and this is her second loan from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise and fertilizers

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun S., 45, is married and lives with her eight children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. S. is in the business of weaving traditional baskets and she is able to earn an income of  $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been with this business since 2007. Her husband helps his wife with this business and is able to earn the same amount of income as his wife, $3 per day. 

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to purchase more materials to produce baskets for her existing and new customers. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy more material to produce traditional baskets

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 34, is married and lives with her six children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. Leng S. grows vegetables and also goes fishing. She is able to earn an income of US$1.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in these businesses since 2000. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of US$5.50 per day.

Leng S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US$1,200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more farmland to grow more produce for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more farmland to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn T., 34, is a widow who lives with her two school-aged children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. T. has a business of weaving traditional baskets and mats for sale. She is able to earn an income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2006. 

T. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, T. is requesting a loan of $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more materials to produce more baskets for her customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: Buy more materials to produce baskets and mats for sale

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa lives with her husband and three children in Tosontsengel in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her husband herds cattle in the wintertime and works for a private construction company in the summertime. Her two older children, 16 and 11, attend a local secondary school and the youngest child, 3, stays at home with her mother.

Tsevelmaa is planning to start a business with her sister selling dairy products. Her sister has five years of experience in this type of retail business so Tsevelmaa is confident that the business will be successful and that she will be able to learn valuable skills. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to buy milk and dairy products at wholesale prices for her start-up business.

Tsevelmaa is very hardworking and open-minded and her dream is to one day start her own business and sell a variety of dairy products to local residents.

loans.use: To buy milk and dairy products to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is from the village of Galas. She is 39 years old. Lorena is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of farm products in the local community. Lorena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Lorena joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos from PMPC. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Lorena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Dovchin

texts.en:
Dovchin O. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter in Tosontsengel in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia.

Dovchin works with his brother in a carpentry business which is located in his brother's khashaa, or yard. Dovchin also works as a security guard for the Khosiin gol LLC and earns 100,000 MNT per month.

With his brother Dovchin produces mongolian gers which are built with 4,5 or 6 walls and also smaller gers for the herders in the province. Gers, or traditional nomadic tents, are the main style of home in Mongolia.

The brothers also make a variety of traditional wooden furniture for the gers which they sell to their customers. This furniture follows traditionally prescribed dimensions and sizes in order to fit into the gers.

Dovchin is a very hardworking and responsible young man who hopes to have his own carpentry shop, khashaa, and land in the future so that he can make his family's living conditions more comfortable.

Dovchin is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood for his carpentry business so that he and his brother can grow their business and provide quality gers and furniture for their customers.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Kom

texts.en:
Kom K., 51, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompongcham Province, Cambodia. K. has a business of selling various kinds of groceries. She is able to earn an income of $15 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been in this business since 2005. Her husband is a veterinarian in their village. He always provides regular health care to animals in the village and he is able to earn an income of $8 per day to assist his family.  

K. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, K. is requesting a loan of $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase piglets to raise for sale when they are sufficiently big enough. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Melva

texts.en: Melva T. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the village of Catarman, Camiguin province. Melva is just starting this business. Melva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Melva is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en: Phebe D.'s main source of income comes from selling sugar, coffee, salt, canned goods (sardines) and candies in her community. She is a 27-year-old single woman from the village of Tabuan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Phebe has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Phebe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Phebe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en: Enhbayar B. is 26 years old and lives with his 60-year-old mother in Tosontsengel province in Mongolia. Enhbayar started his carpentry business in 2004 and makes mongolian "gers", or traditional nomadic tents, and a variety of ger furniture. He has gained much experience in ger making and furniture construction since he started his carpentry business. With his profits, he purchased his own land and fence in 2007, which has provided him and his mother with a higher quality, more comfortable life. Enkhbayar is very open-minded and hard-working. In the future, Enhbayar hopes to expand his business to produce all sorts of furniture for local customers. He is requesting a loan to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia D. is from the village of Caputol. She is 36 years old. Nelia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a snack vending business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Josesa

texts.en:
Josesa A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Josesa is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Josesa owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cellphone accessories, like cellphone cases and more, in the local community. Josesa has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Josesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josesa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aubrey

texts.en: "A brave single mother" best describes Aubrey V., a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is blessed with one child who is now one year old. She is able to support her child through her business, which is a sari-sari store. For two years, she has been able to maintain this business even in times of economic crisis. At this time she is earning an average net income of PHP 2,000 a month from sales. She is also receiving monthly support from her brother who is now working abroad. Aubrey is requesting another loan from Paglaum MPC. This will be her second loan to be funded by Kiva. She hopes to receive the loan to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store. She wants to see her child be able to finish studying through the support of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo Paolo de 7 años en la casa que le heredó su madre, aun en vida. 
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ella nunca pierde la oportunidad de ofrecer su mercadería a sus amistades y otras personas que recién conozca. Pues Mónica es profesora, y sus colegas son sus principales clientes. Para este negocio no tiene competencia, pues se provee de zapatos provenientes de la ciudad de Trujillo, zona muy famosa por la calidad y variedad de calzado.
Esta actividad no le lleva mucho tiempo, ni esfuerzo, pero sí necesita de gran habilidad de comerciante, para persuadir y convencer a sus clientes. Al mes, Mónica llega a vender entre 12 y 30 zapatos, es por ello que le gusta mucho su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable. 
Para el futuro, como buena emprendedora, piensa implementar una tienda de zapatos trujillanos, ya que por este tipo de calzado ya tiene una clientela ganada.

Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y asegura ser puntual en sus pagos, como hasta hoy lo ha sido. También dice estar muy contenta con su banco comunal, ya que todos son responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más zapatos, porque ya se está quedando sin stock.
texts.en:
Mónica is 40, and she lives with her husband and her seven year old son, Paolo. They live in a house she inherited from her mother, who is still alive. Mónica has been selling shoes for six years. She never loses the opportunity to offer her merchandise to her friends and other people she has recently met. Mónica is a teacher, and her colleagues are her main customers. She does not have competition in this business. She gets her shoes from the city of Trujillo, an area very famous for the quality and variety of footwear. She has not been doing this for a long time or put in a lot of effort yet, but you do need to have skills of a merchant to persuade and convince customers. Mónica sells between 12 and 30 pairs of shoes a month. That is why she likes her business so much; it is very profitable for her. In the future, as a good entrepreneur, she plans to set up a store of shoes from Trujillo. She has already won customers for this type of shoe. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She guarantees that she will be punctual with her payments, as she always has been. She also says that she is very happy in her communal bank because everyone is responsible. She will use the money she is requesting to buy more shoes because she is running out of inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine es una mujer muy laboriosa, tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y su hija Carol de 4 años, en la casa de su suegra, en un ambiente que le cedió muy amablemente.  
Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas. A inicios de su negocio se ubicaba al costado de su casa en un kiosco muy precario hechos de esteras. Se levantaba muy temprano para ayudar a su madre en la cocina para después atender su kiosco, sin dejarlo solo por temor a los ladrones. Ahora ya cuenta con unas vitrinas donde puede exhibir sus productos.
A Catherine le gusta su negocio porque conversa y conoce mucha gente, clientes y vecinos, y gracias a las buenas ventas ahora logra ayudar con los gastos de su casa y para terminar de construirla. Ella está muy agradecida con sus padres, por ello desde progresar con su pareja y velar por el futuro de sus padres.
En adelante, planea estudiar corte confección e implementar su propio taller costura en su casa, además de seguir con la venta de los dulces.

Este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, ella asegura seguir siendo puntual en cada uno de sus cuotas, ya que está muy agradecida con los integrantes de este banco que le han dado la oportunidad de contar con un préstamo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de galletas, gaseosas y demás mercadería acorde a su negocio.
texts.en:
Catherine is a very hard working woman. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and their daughter, Carol, who is 4, in her mother-in-law's house which she lives in happily.

For 6 years she has been selling sweets. At the start she ran her business from a kiosk by the side of her house made, a little precariously, of rush mats. She got up very early to help her mother in the kitchen so that she could serve in the kiosk afterwards as she did not want to leave it unattended as she feared it may be broken into by thieves. Her kiosk now has some windows to display her products.

Catherine likes her business because it allows her to talk to and get to know many people - both clients and neighbours - and thanks to good sales she is now able to help out with her household's expenses and with the finances to help finish their house's construction. She is very grateful to her parents and will stay on with her partner and watch over her parents' future.

In the future she plans to study dressmaking and set up her own workshop at home, as well as keeping on selling sweets.

This is her eighth credit with MFP and she affirms that she will carry on being punctual with the repayments, as she is very grateful to the members of this bank who have given her the opportunity to get loans. The money that she is asking for at the moment is to buy biscuits, soft drinks and some other merchandise for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 60 años, su esposo falleció, y actualmente vive con dos (mujeres) de sus 4 hijos. Su casa es propia y de material noble de un solo nivel.
Sus deseos de progresar la estimularon a incursionar en el negocio de la venta de productos comestibles. Se inició como vendedora ambulante, frente a su casa, con su carreta de muy pocos productos, con el correr de los años, poco a poco pudo incrementar su mercaderías, lo que le permitió acumular mayores ganancias, las cuales invertía en la educación de sus hijos y en la construcción de su casa, allí acondicionó un espacio apropiado para su bodega.
De los 15 años que lleva en este negocio, reconoce que lo que más disfruta es atender a sus clientes, pues está muy agradecida por la preferencia, por lo que siempre los recibe con gran amabilidad.

Este es su décimo cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo tanto sabe que debe trabajar duramente para no defraudar a sus compañeros de grupo, quienes depositaron su confianza en ella. Con los 600 soles solicitados comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para mantener surtida y atractiva su bodega.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 60, and her husband died. She currently lives with two (daughters) of her four children. Her house is her own, and it is one level made from solid material. Her desire to progress motivated her to set up a business selling food products. She started as a street vendor in front of her house with her cart and very few products. As time went by she was able to increase her inventory little by little. This allowed her to accumulate greater income, which she invested in her children’s education and building her house. She set up an appropriate space in her house for her convenience store. She has been in this business for 15 years. What she likes the most is waiting on her customers. She is very grateful for their business, and she always greets them in a very friendly way. This is her 14th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She knows that she needs to work hard in order to not cause problems for her colleagues in the group. They have put their faith in her. She will use the 600 PEN she is requesting to buy more merchandise to keep her convenience store well stocked and attractive.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en: Erdenetsogt L. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in Tosontsengel, in the Zavhan province of Mongolia.
