Erdenetsogt makes different varieties of wooden products and Mongolian "gers", or traditional living tents. In the past, he has made Mongolian gers and sold them to ADRA, an international non-profit organization. In addition to gers, Erdenetsogt also makes wooden tools and souvenirs. With his business profits, he has been able to purchase his own land and house which has increased his family's quality of life and comfort. In the future, he hopes to increase his income and expand his business. Erdenetsogt is a very hard-working, quiet and thoughtful person who hopes to further improve his family's living conditions. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a car in order to start a taxi service for locals and also to deliver his products to his buyers.

loans.use: To purchase a car to provide taxi service and transport his products

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel tiene 38 años, vive con su hijo Jordan de 17 años, en la casa de sus padres, que es un inmueble que falta terminar de construir.
Ante la irresponsabilidad del padre de su hijo, Ysabel aprendió a no tenerle miedo a los retos, incursionó en diversos negocios, entre ellos la venta de juguetes, cerámicas y actualmente  cuadros. Al principio caminaba arduamente recorriendo los diversos mercados de la ciudad y sentía que no obtenía ganancias. Pero la perseverancia fue más que el cansancio y desde hace dos años administra su próspero negocio; pues tiene muchos clientes en todos los mercados de su localidad, cuenta con el apoyo de su padre, quien es el encargado específicamente de la distribución. 
Paralelamente, Ysabel trabaja como costurera en un taller textil, ya que desde niña le gustó tal oficio, ahora está cosiendo sabanas y edredones en sus horas libres, y en adelante planea comprarse máquinas industriales para implementar su propio taller en su vivienda. Por lo que su negocio de venta de cuadros se lo dejaría a su padre. 

Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y ratifica su compromiso de seguir siendo responsable en sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de telas para confeccionar más sabanas y cubre camas.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 38 years old. She lives with her son, Jordan, 17, in her parents’ house. It is a property constantly under construction. After dealing with the irresponsibility of Jordan’s father, Ysabel learned not to be afraid of challenges. She launched several businesses, including toy sales, ceramics, and now, pictures. At first, she sold on foot at all the markets of the city, and felt that she was not making much money. But her perseverance paid off and now she has operated her own prosperous business for two years. She has clients in all the markets and she counts on the support of her father, who is in charge of distribution. At the same time, Ysabel works as a seamstress in a textile workshop. This is a skill she has enjoyed from an early age. She sews sheets and quilts in her spare time, and plans to buy industrial sewing machines to set up her own workshop in her home. At that point, she would leave the picture business to her father. This is Ysabel’s tenth loan with MFP and she agrees to continue being responsible in her payments. With this money, she will buy material to make more sheets and bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy laboriosa de 50 años, vive con su esposo y padre de sus 2 hijos; Carlos de 24 y Melady de 17 años, en su casa de material noble, de dos pisos.
Desde hace 2 años empezó a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, a inicios su bodega era muy precaria; no tenía mostradores ni vitrinas, por ello decidieron unir los ingresos de su esposo y más las ganancias de la bodega con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida. Es así como fueron invirtiendo poco a poco, hasta conseguir las ganancias que les permitieron terminar de construir su casa, además de comprar vitrinas para su tienda. 
Ahora, paralelo a su negocio, también alquila dos mini departamentos en su casa y un local para  negocio en el primer piso. A Julia le gusta dedicarse al comercio, y asimismo velar por la limpieza de su casa, ya que el alquiler de ésta es muy rentable. 
Lo que Julia anhela en la vida es que sus hijos sean profesionales, por ello trabajará arduamente hasta lograrlo.

Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y será muy responsable como siempre, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas comprometidas. Con el dinero que solicita se abastecerá de mayor cantidad de productos para que de ese modo su negocio siempre esté muy atractivo.
texts.en:
Julia is a very hardworking woman of 50 years of age. She lives with her husband, the father of her children Carlos, 24, and Melady, 17. They live in a two-story house made of good materials. Two years ago, Julia began her grocery business. In the beginning, the store was very humble; it did not have counters or display cases. Because of this, she decided to put her earnings together with those of her husband with the goal of improving their quality of life. They invested little by little until they managed to finish construction of their house and buy display cases for the store. At the same time, Julia rents out two small apartments in her house and a commercial space on the first floor. She looks after the housecleaning herself, as the rentals are very profitable. What Julia desires most in life is that her children become professionals. That is the reason for all her hard work. This is Julia’s tenth loan with MFP, and she will be responsible, as always. She also will work with her communal bank, as they are very committed people. With the money from this loan, Julia will buy a quantity of products for her store, so that it will always be very attractive.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for store

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer que le sonríe a la vida a pesar de las dificultades, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo en una humilde casa. Sus 4 hijos ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias.
Desde que se casó empezó a vender salchipapas (platillo que trae papas y salchichas fritas, acompañadas de diversas cremas). Pero por motivos de salud, tuvo que dejar de lado este negocio, aunque le era muy rentable. Desde entonces, hace 2 años, implementó una tienda de dulces, gaseosas y cervezas, siendo los fines de semana cuando tiene mayores ventas.
En adelante, Luz desea comprar un aparador para poder exhibir mejor sus productos, asimismo planea instalar una puerta interior para evitar el ingreso de sus nietos, quienes suelen comerse los dulces cuando ella está en el mercado.

Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y hace compromisos de seguir siendo muy puntual, como hasta ahora lo ha sido. Además menciona estar contenta con su banco comunal, puesto que todos son muy responsables y trabajadores. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los productos de su tienda para tener mayores ventas en los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman who always smiles at life no matter the difficulties. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband in their small home. Their children are grown up now and have their own families. From the time she married, Luz began to sell a local snack called salchipapas - potatoes and fried sausages, along with different sauces. Two years ago, she also set up a small shop to sell sweets, sodas and beers, especially for the weekends when sales are better. Going forward, Luz would like to buy a glass display case to better show the merchandise. She would also like to install an extra door, so her grandchildren don't come in to eat the sweets while she is at the market. This is the 12th loan she has had with MFP, and she has always made her payments on time. She says she is happy with the communal bank because everybody is very responsible and hardworking. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase more merchandise for her store so that she can increase sales in the coming months.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small store, so that she can increase sales in the coming months.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, a sus 58 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos. Actualmente vive con su esposo, una de sus hijas que es madre soltera y su adorado nieto.
María es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos nutricionales. También vende cosméticos de reconocidas marcas, y con ambos productos está muy satisfecha, aunque termine muy cansada el final del día.
El problema de María es que necesita ser operada de las válvulas cardíacas, y para ello necesita tener donantes de sangre, pero lamentablemente ni su esposo, ni sus hijos tienen el mismo tipo, por lo que uno de sus objetivos diarios es conseguir personas que deseen donarle sangre para que pueda ser operada con prontitud.
Ella está muy segura de afrontar satisfactoriamente su operación, y ya encontró dos donantes, pero además debe trabajar para afrontar los gastos de la cirugía.

Este es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y aunque ella es la titular del crédito, su pareja también se compromete con el grupo en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de más productos de los que vende, además de solventar algunos gastos médicos concernientes a su estado de salud.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old, lives with her husband and has 5 children. One of their daughters, who is a single mom, lives with them along with their grandson. Maria is very dedicated to her work. For four years she has sold nutritional products, as well as cosmetics from well known brands. Maria is very satisfied with both products, even though she is quite tired at the end of each day. The problem is that she requires a valve operation on her heart, and for this she will need blood donors. Unfortunately, neither her husband, nor her children have the right blood type, so one of her daily objectives is to find people willing to donate blood so that she can have this operation as soon as possible. Maria feels confident she will get through the operation, and she has since found two donors, but she still needs to work to be able to deal with the costs of this surgery. This is the 10th loan with MFP, and even though it is her name on the loan, her husband also participates with the group to make the payments on time. The money from this loan will be used to purchase more products that Maria can sell, as well as cover some of the medical costs she will incur.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more nutritional products and cosmetics to sell, as well as cover some of the medical costs she is incurring.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia V. is from the village of Miputak. She is 47 years old. Rosalia is widowed and has an adult child. To make a living, Rosalia operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and repacked spices in the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Rosalia joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Rosalia from PMPC and this is her second time with Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa es una mujer de 40 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos: Luis de 19 y Melody  de 12 años.
Hace 6 años ella y su esposo decidieron dedicarse a la venta de tubos, pinturas y demás accesorios de ferretería. Para ello se ubicaron en un lugar céntrico y muy concurrido de la ciudad, ya que la visión de esta pareja era prosperar. A inicios sufrieron mucho, pues no les alcanzaba ni para el alquiler mensual del local, entonces su esposo empezó a ofrecer y revender a otras ferreterías sus productos a una mínima ganancia, jamás imaginó que esta modalidad los llevaría a la cúspide. 
Ahora Marisa ya no atiende su establecimiento, pues está más evocada a la facturación y al orden de los pedidos, inclusive a veces no se abastece, por ello cuentan con la ayuda de uno de sus sobrinos, preferentemente por las tardes cuando hay más clientes.
Para el futuro, Marisa anhela implementar otra sucursal porque este negocio es muy rentable, y de ese modo brindarles seguridad a sus hijos. 

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable como hasta ahora, además comenta su conformidad y comodidad en su banco comunal, ya que se lleva muy bien con todas sus compañeras. El dinero que ahora solicita es para incrementar con más productos a su ferretería, asegurándose tener reservas en su almacén.
texts.en:
Marisa is 40 years old and lives with her husband. They have two children, Luis, 19, and Melody, 12. Six years ago Marisa and her husband decided to start a hardware business. They located their shop in a central area of the city which is always busy. In the beginning they suffered a lot, not earning enough to even pay their rent. Marisa's husband began to offer and resell their products to other hardware stores for a minimal profit, never imagining that this model would actually be so successful. Now, Marisa doesn't work in the shop, as she is busy handling the billing and processing of the orders they receive. Sometimes it's so busy she counts on the help of one of her nephews, usually in the afternoons when there are more customers. For the future, Marisa would like to set up another location. Their model works well and she would like to build the business and help bring more financial security to her children. This is the 9th loan she has received from MFP and she's always made her payments on time. She also likes the comfort and sense of community she gets from the communal bank, and she gets along well with other members. The money from this loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for their hardware business, making sure they have enough inventory in their shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her hardware business, making sure there is enough inventory in the store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy en una mujer muy trabajadora de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos: Jeycel de 7 años y Yamile de pocos días de nacida. Tiene una casa propia, pero que aún falta terminar de construir, ubicada en un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Ella es una comerciante minorista ambulante, vende verduras desde hace 5 años en el mercado de su distrito. Para empezar con este negocio tuvo que buscar un espacio donde ubicarse, al principio todos le tenían mucha envidia, ya que se había posicionado dentro del mercado sin tener un puesto, generando el celo de los demás vendedores, pero Nancy tuvo mucha paciencia y perseverancia. Cada día, al terminar su jornada, dejaba muy limpio su espacio, ganándose así la confianza y el cariño de los dirigentes del mercado, y posteriormente consiguiendo su propio espacio.
Su rutina empieza a las 3 de la mañana, hora en que se levanta para ir de compras al mercado mayorista de verduras de la ciudad, pues a las 7 de la mañana ya debe estar acomodando sus productos frescos en el mercado.
A Nancy le gusta mucho tu trabajo y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo pronto podrá terminar de construir su casa, y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. 

Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, asegura seguir siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir contando con posteriores créditos por ser herramientas muy útiles para su negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de sus productos, asimismo va renovar las tablas de madera que usa para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very hardworking 32 years old woman. She lives with her life partner and her two children: Jeycel, 7 years old, and Yamile, a few days old. She has a house of her own, still not fully built, located in a populated neighbourhood south of Lima. She is an ambulant retailer. She has been selling vegetables for 5 years in her district's market. When she first started she had to find a place to locate her stall. At first everybody was very envious because she had found a place inside the market with actually owning a stall, which aroused the jealousy of other sellers, but Nancy was patient and persistent. Every day, after her work was over, she left her space very clean, thus winning the trust and affection of the market managers, and later she got her own space. Her daily routine begins at 3 am, when she wakes up to go to the wholesale vegetables market, because by 7 am she has to be already placing her fresh wares in the market. Nancy likes her job very much and she knows that with a lot of hard work she can finish building her home and improve her children's quality of life. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She is sure she will continue to meet her repayment terms punctually, as she wants to be able to depend on future loans because they are very useful tools for her trade. She means to invest the money she asks for in increasing her inventory, as well as renovating the wooden boards she uses to showcase her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory and improvements in the stall

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer C. is from the village of Cawa-cawa. She is 32 years old. Jenefer is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jenefer operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling motorcycle spare parts in the local community. Jenefer has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Jenefer joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenefer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jenefer is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jenefer from PMPC and her second time with Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma A. is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old and married with two children. To make living, she operates a sari-sari (general) store but it does not serve as their main source of income because her husband also provides support. She has been engaged in this business for almost four years and upon starting it, she only sold banana cue (a fried-banana dish). Her sari-sari store earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month.

Norma joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to access financial support and to improve her living situation. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her sari-sari store and to buy additional inventory. She wants to save for their future and to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Ibrokhim

texts.ru: Кулаев Иброхим проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Кулаев Иброхим работает в области торговли более чем 5 лет. Он имеет среднее образование. Кулаев Иброхим покупает продукты и продает. Кредит берет для закупа продуктовых товаров, т.е. для товараоборота.
texts.en:
K. Ibrokhim lives in the Yavan region. He's thirty-one years old, married, has three children and a high school education. He buys and sells foodstuffs: an enterprise he has been working at for more than five years. He is asking for a loan to buy new products and increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new products

loans.name: Dolores Mirian

texts.es: Dolores Mirian H. D. E. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en el pueblo D. Quezaltepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo el cual se dedica a estudiar. La señora Dolores posee una venta D. verduras la cual esta ubicado en el Mercado D. Quezaltepeque, lugar muy concurrido el cual a toda hora cuenta con gran afluencia D. personas. DesD. hace 10 años ella cuenta con su negocio propio, y cuenta con la dicha D. ser muy conocida por ser una persona muy trabajadora y alegra, quien siempre esta dispuesta a esforzarse por obtener mayores ganancias que sean D. beneficio para su hogar. Dolores, solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para adquirir mayor cantidad D. productos los cuales los compra al mayoreo con el fin D. obtener algún precio especial y así D. esta manera ella pueD. dar más  baratas las verduras y vender mucho más.
texts.en:
Dolores Mirian H. D. E., 53 years old, lives in Quezaltepeque village, in the La Libertad department, She lives with her husband and son, who is currently studying. Ms. Dolores owns a grocery stall in the Quezaltepeque market, a very busy place where there is a great flow of people at all hours. Since 10 years ago she owns her business and she is happy to be very well known for being very hardworking and cheerful, always willing to make an effort to obtain bigger profits with which to benefit her home. Dolores asks for a loan through which she can obtain the money she needs to purchase a greater quantity of products, which she buys wholesale, and pay a special price for her purchase so she can in turn sell her vegetables cheaper and make more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Mrs. Ester R. is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store in their Barangay of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married to Apolinario R., and blessed with 3 children, all now at adult ages. They earn their living from farming. This family had been experiencing hardships, in terms of financial matters. To help her husband, Ester decided to open up a little sari-sari store and for 30 years she was able to manage this business. This time she is earning an average net income of PHP 4,000.00 from sales of the business.  She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year because she is very much interested with our products and services. PAGLAUM MPC, being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and awarded for being Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. As a newly recognized member, Ester was given a privilege to avail an amount of 6,000.00 as her 1st loan. She will use these funds to add to her capital for the existing sari-sari store business. Her plan in life is to improve her business and to be able to support her family and to help her grandchildren.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing Sari-sari Store.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel S. A. de 62 años de edad, reside en el Barrio de San Jacinto, en el departamento de San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposa, y sus tres hijos de 18, 17 y 9 años de edad. Manuel posee su propio negocio en el cual se encarga de comercializar  focos, lámparas y otros accesorios eléctricos, como cables, baterías entre otros más. Su negocio esta ubicado en la calle Rubén Darío, ubicado en el centro de San Salvar, lugar que cuenta con una gran afluencia de personas, por ser una de las zonas más céntricas del país. Esto es de mucho beneficio para Manuel debido a que sus ventas son diarias, las cuales en gran manera dependen de la cantidad de productos que posea. Es por esta razón que Manuel solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder comprar más productos eléctricos, debido a que en muchas ocasiones él no cuenta con el producto solicitado, lo que le genera menor cantidad de ganancias, así mismo dentro de sus metas esta la de surtir su negocio con otro tipo de herramientas como serruchos, martios, y otros productos más los cuales son muy necesarios en el hogar.  Manuel es una persona muy trabajadora quien siempre esta buscando la manera de contar con el dinero necesario para llevar el sustento diario a su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel S. A., age 62, resides in the Barrio de San Jacinto in the department of San Salvador. His family is composed of his wife and their three children, ages 18, 17, and 9.

Manuel has his own business in which he sells light bulbs, lamps, and other electric accessories such as electric cable and batteries, among other things. His business is located in Rubén Darío Street in the center of San Salvar, a place which attracts a lot of people because it is one of the most central areas of the country. This is of great benefit to Manuel because his daily sales depend in large part on the quantity of inventory he has on hand.

Manuel is applying for a loan in order to buy more electric products because on many occasions he does not have the products asked for by customers, which means that he generates a smaller quantity of earnings. Also, among his goals is the stocking of his business with other types of tools such as handsaws, hammers, and other products that are very necessary in the home. Manuel is a very hardworking man who is always looking for ways to earn the money necessary in order to maintain the daily needs of his household.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of tools in order to stock his business.

location.town: Barrio de San Jacinto, departamento de San Salvado

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane T. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 32 years old, married, and mother of 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns and operates a business that provides motorcycle-for-hire services to local community members. She and her husband own 2 motorcycles. They decided to rent out the second motorcycle for PHP 300.00 per day. She has been engaged in this kind of business for about 8 years and earns an income of PHP 10,000 a month.

In 2007, Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials and accessories need for her motorcycle to improve the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Towards purchasing materials and accessories for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline D. is from the city of Maloro Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline operates a family member's service-based business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide esthetic services.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Холиков Рустам проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Холиков Рустам имеет высшее образование по специальности "Зоотехник". В области животноводства работает более чем 15 лет. Холиков Рустам откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
K. Rustam lives in the Yavan region. He's forty-five years old, married and has five children. He has a university degree in animal husbandry and has worked in the field for more than fifteen years, fattening and selling cattle. He's asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarah R. is from Lower Sto. Nino Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old, married and has 5 children. Sarah operates a sari-sari store while her husband supports the family as a driver. Her business earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.


Sarah has applied as a full pledge member to PMPC for access to financial support. She has maintained to successfully repay her previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC. Her purpose was to expand her store so that she could accommodate more customers. Now, she has a new loan of 10000 PHP, taken from PMPC. The proceeds from this loan will be used to purchase new items to sell. Her additional income serves their daily needs.

loans.use: Towards additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. R. is from Bacolod Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Gloria operates a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gloria has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor H. is from the city of P-3 Manabay Ozamiz City. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Amor owns and operates a general store, selling toothpaste, shampoo, juice packs, biscuits, soap, sugar and other products in the local community. Amor has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Amor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amor is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to resell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amor from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gregorio Jr.

texts.en:
Gregorio Jr. M. is from the village of Poblacion 1 Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gregorio Jr. owns and operates a transportation services business. Gregorio Jr. has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Gregorio Jr. joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gregorio Jr. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicles for better service. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Gregorio Jr. from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing transport vehicles

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna B. is 43 years old and married with 2 children, living in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Lorna's husband is a laborer and at the same time manages their farm, which is their main source of income (approximately 5000 a month).

Lorna was prompted to join Paglaum MPC in order to access financial services and other benefits, especially insurances. Lorna maintains a good record with PMPC as she has religiously repaid her previous loan. Lorna is now asking for a new loan of 7000 which will be used to plant more corn, helping them to save for their future and prepare for old age.

loans.use: fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: José Alejandro Ramírez C. de 36 años de edad, reside en Olocuilta, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada. José posee una venta de accesorios eléctricos, como extensiones y cables, así mismo comercializa controles, antenas y cables para televisores, y otros productos varios como pegamento, baterías y desarmadores. También posee un taller de reparación de radios y televisores, ambos negocios están ubicados en el centro de San Salvador, lugar muy estratégico en el cual transita una gran cantidad de personas, lo que resulta ser  de mucho beneficio para José, puesto que cuenta con muchos clientes. José solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar mayor cantidad de herramientas, así también comprar repuestos para los electrodomésticos que repara. Él es una persona muy visionaria quien anhela seguir adelante y mejorar su negocio, invirtiendo más en el y obteniendo nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
José Alejandro Ramírez C. is 36 years old and lives in Olocuilta, located in the department of La Paz. He lives with his life partner, who works for private company. Jose has a business selling electronic accessories, such as extension cords and cables. He also sells remote controls, antennas and television cables, and a variety of other products such as adhesives, batteries and screwdrivers. In addition he has a workshop where he repairs radios and television sets. Both businesses are located in the center of San Salvador, a strategic location since a large quantity of people transit through the area. This is a big benefit for Jose, since he is able to have a lot of customers. Jose requests a loan so that he can buy a greater quantity of tools. He will also use the loan to buy spare parts for the electronic devices that he repairs. He is a person who is very visionary and who desires to continue to advance and improve his business by investing more in it and getting additional customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for electronic devices

location.town: Olocuilta en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Sok Ny's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of five people, is located in Angk Roveay village in the Takeo province. They all will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sok Ny K. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She is a silk weaver and her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Hun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which to cultivate rice to support their living. For weaving, she has a problem because she has too little silk to weave; furthermore, this family does not have enough money to buy silk for weaving. Thus, Mrs.Sok Ny K. decided to ask for a loan to buy some silk to weave to increase their income. 

She is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in primary school while the other one is too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy some silk

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myna A. is from Upper Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old and married with three children. Myrna operates a little sari-sari (general) store and earns a meager income of 5,000 Philippine pesos a month.

Myrna joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to reach for her financial goals. Myrna also wanted to improve her living conditions, and her business as well, through the help of Paglaum MPC. She preserves a member-in-good-standing label with the cooperative. Myrna plans to save for their future and hopes to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional inventory for her sari-sari (general) store business

loans.name: Sakin

texts.en: Miss Sakin E. is 51 years old. She lives in Preak Svay Village of the Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land, which she uses to cultivate rice to support her family. She leads her family of five. One of her family members sells desserts, while the other four are farmers as well. Miss Sakin E. has a problem in her rice field because her field has infertile soil, and she does not have money to purchase fertilizer. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer in order to increase her rice yield this year.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jesila

texts.en: Jesila B. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 22 years old. Jesila is engaged and has two children, one school-aged and one infant. To make a living, Jesila raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables and root crops for sale. Jesila is just starting this business. In 2009, Jesila joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jesila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for the crops and as start-up capital for raising pigs. This will be the second loan taken out by Jesila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and as start-up capital for raising pigs

loans.name: Nheth's Group

texts.en:
This village-bank loan, which consists of four people, is located in Angk village in the Kandal province. They all will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Nheth E. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares of land for cultivating rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bros Chhuon, is a fisherman. In this rice field, Mrs. Nheth E. faces a problem because the field has infertile soil. She does not have money to purchase fertilizers. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her rice field and increase the yield of rice in this current yE.. 

She is the mother of four children: One is an employee in a garment factory, two are fishermen and the other one is a student in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Alamurod

texts.ru: Холиков Аламурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Холиков Аламурод имеет среднее Техническое образование по специональности "Бухгалтер". Он работает в области животноводства более чем 6 лет. Холиков Аламурод разводит и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Alamurod H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 58 years old, married and has 5 children. Alamurod has a secondary technical education in the accounting field. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for over 6 years. Alamurod raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Mrs. Margie M., 30, is a married resident of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. They were blessed with one child. Her husband, Camilo M., is a motorcycle driver for hire with an average net income of not less than 150 Philippine pesos a day. To help her husband in raising their child, she decided to engage in a business and opened up a little sari-sari (general) store in their barangay (neighborhood). For three years, she has been able to maintain the business and purchase inventories needed for her store. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than 1,500 PHP a month. This amount is so helpful to their family.  

Margie applied to become a full-pledge member of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, two years back and enjoys the benefits, especially the insurance. She accessed her financial needs to Paglaum, whom she trusted for years. She trusts that all her effort in managing her business will be successful.

loans.use: Addtional capital for her sari-sari (general) store business

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental, Minda

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Oscar S., a carpenter, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Together, they have been selling wood furniture for many years.

Teresita has been a regular member of Kiva's partner Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 13 times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy more wood and lumber.   Her business lets her earn a profit of 8,500 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like a PHP 22,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for buying more wood and lumber for her expanding furniture business.

She prays that they will have earn enough resources to fix their house and that their children will have a better life in the future. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and lumber for her furniture business

loans.name: Hikoyathon

texts.ru: Раджабова Хикоятхон проживает в городе Курган- Тюбе. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Раджабова Хикоятхон работает в области торговли 3 года. Она продает детские велосипеды и калыбели. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. закупа детских колыбелок.
texts.en:
Hikoyathon R. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 51 years old, married and has 2 children. Hikoyathon has been working in the retail sales field for 3 years. She sells kids' bicycles and cribs. She is obtaining this loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. purchase children's cribs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Alice Kageha

texts.en:
Alice Kageha, 33, is from Majengo in the Vihiga district. She is married to James Orova and they have three children, with the eldest being 12 years old.  She is currently running a butcher shop located in a village shopping center. Her clients mainly consist of neighboring hotel owners and local school tenders.

Alice is not new to Kadet; she has managed to service two previous loans well and has a good credit history. She hopes to get lenders to fund her third loan through Kadet Ltd., a Kiva partner. This will enable her to purchase two bulls for slaughter and thus add to her stock in the butchery and expand the business. 

Her future dream is to own and open more butcheries in the adjacent shopping centers and to be able to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: Buy two bulls for slaughter to add to her stock

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A., 38, is a hardworking single parent of two children. She makes sure that she earns so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own water business and is also into the direct selling of ready-to-wear garments.

Dionesia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 13 times in CCT’s Cooperative, a Kiva partner. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy equipment and containers needed for her water-station business. Her two businesses let her earn a profit of 4,000 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional containers and additional clothes for her direct-selling business.

She dreams that she can have her own variety store someday and prays that she and her children will have a brighter future. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Buying additional containers and additional clothes for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es: Maura Estela S. R. de 25 años de edad, reside en Rosario de Mora, vive junto a su único hijo de 5 años, el cual asiste al kinder. Maura es una madre joven la cual se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar mucho más que otras madres, debido a que ella no cuenta con la ayuda y apoyo de un esposo, debido a que es madre soltera. Maura posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el Mercado Central, este es uno de los mercados más grandes de la ciudad de San Salvador y es uno de los lugares que cuenta con más clientes, debido a que se comercializa a menor precio que en otros mercados. Maura solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras. Para ella es de mucha importancia obtener este préstamo, debido a que Maura compra todos los productos al contado, y a pesar que sus ventas son diarias, no cuenta con la capacidad económica de poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Maura Estela S. R. is 25 years old and lives in Rosario de Mora. She lives with her only son who is 5 years old and who attends kindergarten. Because Maura is a single mother she has had to work more than other mothers, since she cannot count on the help and support of a husband. Maura has a business selling fruits and vegetables that is located in the Central Market, which is one of the biggest markets in the city of San Salvador. This market has an abundance of customers, since goods here are sold at lower prices than in other markets. Maura requests a loan through which she will buy a large quantity of fruits and vegetables. For her this loan is very important, because Maura buys all of her products with cash, and since she has daily sales she does not have the economic capacity to be able to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits that are in season

location.town: Rosario de Mora, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk S., 53, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompongcham Province, Cambodia. S. is working within the agriculture sector, raising pigs. She also sells ice-filled sweet syrup, earning an income of $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been with this business since 2008. Her husband is an officer for a tax-collection department in the province, earning an income of $9 per day to help assist his family. 

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of $600 from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. She wants to use the loan to hire people to help her grow banana trees on a 5-hectare plot of farmland. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To hire people to help her family grow bananas trees

loans.name: Thouch

texts.en: Thouch S., 46, is a widow and lives with her relatives in Kompongchnang Province, Cambodia. S. sells groceries at her home in the village. She is able to earn an income of USD $2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been doing this business since 2002.  S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well to help with the daily necessary expenses. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $600 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more groceries to stock her store. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn H., 36, is married and lives with her five school-aged children in Kompongchnang Province, Cambodia. H. is a teacher for a public secondary school in her province. She also sells porridge in her village every morning to earn extra income. Both jobs make it possible for her to earn an income of US $4.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been doing these businesses since 1987. Her husband is a village chief, earning an income of US $2.30 per day to help assist the family. H. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses to provide for the daily necessary expenses. As a result, H. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase groceries to start another business at home. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start another business

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita P. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. She is 55 years old. Nelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nelita owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Nelita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. Nelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phuk

texts.en: Phuk S., 52, is married and lives with his six children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. S. sells sugar cane juice everywhere, especially at the markets, and is able to earn an income of US $3.30 per day to help cover the family expenses. He has been doing this business since 2005. His son is a motorbike taxi driver who provides his service at local markets in the province, earning an income of US $2.50 per day to help assist the family. S. and his family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses to cover the daily necessary expenses. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $400 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike with a cart attached to sell sugar cane juice. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a cart

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mrs. Vin S. lives in Check village in Kandal province. She is 34 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field for growing rice and crops to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ny Kak, is a fisherman. This family has a problem because it is the season to grow crops but they don't have enough money to support their rice field. Thus, Mrs. Vin S. decided to ask a loan to buy rice seeds, fuel, and fertilizer to increase the rice yield for this year. She is a mother of four children. One of her children is a construction laborer and the other three are students in local public school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fuel, and fertilizer

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris M. is a 31-year-old married lady. She is married to Timothy Sonje, a carpenter. Dorris owns a retail kiosk in Vipingo, Kilifi, which she opened a year ago to supplement the household income. 

Dorris joined KADET recently and this loan marks her first borrowing to boost her business. Her shop is under stocked and she hopes that with this loan she will be able to purchase new stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil. She will use part of the money to renovate the shelves in her kiosk. Dorris believes that she will be able to generate some profit to repay the loan as well as meet her daily expenses. She mainly serves the Vipingo stage residents in Kilifi.

She hopes and dreams of having a fully stocked retail shop soon and opening a food kiosk in the area.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela A., 59, is doing everything she can to help her children establish their own families. Married to Rodrigo A., a painter, they are blessed with six children, some of whom have their own children as well. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that they can help their children have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store selling basic goods to their neighbors.

Tarcela has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 13 times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy additional stock for her store. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 4,000 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 14,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying assorted snacks, beverages and ice cream for her store.

She dreams that her business will garner more loyal clients so that she can continue to support her expanding family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted snacks, beverages and ice cream for her store.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Luciana is widowed and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Luciana owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya C. is a villager in Svay Chour village in Kandal province. She is 60 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops to support her family. She is a widow who has a child who is also a farmer. In their fields, the family has some obstacles because this season is a growing season, yet they did not have enough money to invest in their fields. Thus Mrs. Ya C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva V. S., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Jose S. Jr., a driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling newspapers for many years.

Nieva has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for several years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 12 times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy more stock of different newspapers for her business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 14,000 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 38,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more newspapers to sell.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can help her children achieve their ambitions in life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers to sell.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Phy S., 27, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompongchnang Province, Cambodia. S. is employed in a local garment factory, and she is able to earn an income of USD 2 per day to help cover her family's expenses. She has been with this business since 2008. Her husband is a merchant who sells silk products, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help assist the family. S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to meet daily necessary expenses. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $500 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to purchase more silk products for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy silk products to sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha K. is 37 years old. She lives in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Bonna Chhum, are noodle sellers. Though the family tries to work hard with their business, they earn little money to support their family. So, Mrs. Chantha K. decided to start another business in pig breeding. However, the family does not have enough money to support the new business. Thus, Mrs. Chantha K. asked for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. She is a mother of five children; three are enrolled in primary school while the other two are too young to go to school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana G., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Joseph Hipolito, a taxi driver, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling ice cream and other snacks as her business.

Ana has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow four times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy more stock of ice cream and assorted snacks for her store. Her business earns a profit of PHP 5,200 per month.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business to buy more flavors of ice cream and snacks for her store.

She dreams that her business could be moved to a school someday, where lot of students could purchase her products.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more flavors of ice cream and snacks for her store.

loans.name: Mealea

texts.en: Mrs. Mealea M. is 37 years old. She lives in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Vuty Say, are farmers who own 1 hectara of land to cultivate rice and crops. In the field, the family has some problems because their crops have been damaged by insects.  Moreover, the field has infertile soil, but the family does not have sufficient money to buy supplies to change this. Thus, Mrs. Mealea M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She is the mother of three children who are studying in a local public school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Shirendev

texts.en: Shirendev T. is 53 years old and lives with his wife and 2 adult sons, aged 24 and 21. His oldest son, Ulziibayar, helps operate the family business and his younger son, Sandagdorj, is a student at the Economics Institute. Shirendev has an underground well in his soum (county) and provides 50% of the soum residents with clean water. Shirendev started his business in 2002 and since then has continually earned more customers because his well is known for its pure, clean water. He is a very hard-working person and his dream is to renovate the well and build a bathhouse for the soum residents in order to increase his family's income and help the soum residents improve their sanitary conditions and health. He is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase a water pump that will enable him to increase the water output amount from the well.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Dugenia

texts.en:
Dugenia N. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Dugenia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Dugenia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dugenia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Dugenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dugenia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dugenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna V., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Marcelino V., a technician, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for more than a year now.

Myrna has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy assorted products for her store. Her business earns a profit of PHP 4,500 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her to expand her business by buying more stock of assorted snacks and beverages for her variety store.

She dreams that someday she will have her own grocery store and be able to help her children to finish college.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of assorted snacks and beverages for her variety store.

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị (20206030045) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N..  T. is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 1 nhóm 06 (6).

T. is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing food services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Lưu Thị Quả  (20206030046) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Kiều Thị C. (20206030047) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3.  Nguyễn V. H. (20206030048) is a 46-year-old male who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support his business in the food sector making and selling food.

4.  Tô Thị N. (20206030049) is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Lê Thị T. (20206030050) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  Kiều V. L. (20206030051) is a 34-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

7.  Kiều Thị H. (20206030052) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Trần Thị (20206030045) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc N..  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu 1 nhóm 06 (6).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Lưu Thị Quả  (20206030046) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Kiều Thị C. (20206030047) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3.  Nguyễn V. H. (20206030048) là 46 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4.  Tô Thị N. (20206030049) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  Lê Thị T. (20206030050) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH..  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6.  Kiều V. L. (20206030051) là 34 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

7.  Kiều Thị H. (20206030052) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en: Zorigbaatar S. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Tosontsengel soum in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. The family lives in a "ger", or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, 6, attends a local primary school while his wife stays at home with the youngest daughter, 2. Zorigbaatar is an extremely busy young man who currently operates three businesses.
