texts.en: Mohamad Saleh is a 27-year-old single man. He learned hairdressing 18 years ago. In 2000, after good experience in this occupation, he decided to open his own salon. Today, Mohamad Saleh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to improve the decor of his salon and buy specially designed barber chairs.

loans.use: to improve the decor of his salon and buy specially designed barber chairs

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah K. W. is forty-five years old, married, and has four children. His wife sells clothes and their children are still in school.  They hope to give their children quality education. His business is located at Serem-a busy market in Kakamega. He engages in selling meat to the local people, something he loves doing and has engaged in for the last seventeen years. In addition to his butchery business, he also sells maize. Jeremiah has a major challenge of high prices of livestock and that's why he is using his loan to buy more livestock for slaughter. In 5 years, he sees himself opening three butcheries and buying a lorry (truck) to transport maize to his customers. He has a dream to acquire more wealth and improve his living standards. He is very interested in improving himself and is a polite man.

loans.use: Livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: K. Martine est née le 07 Avril 1973 à Agonlin, dans le département du Mono au Bénin. Martine est mariée à AKOGBETO Nicéphore, un imprimeur. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Martine vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne l’entretien et l’éducation des enfants, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Martine a été à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire, et a appris ensuite la couture. C’est cette activité que Martine mène depuis 17 ans environs. A côté de cela, Martine vend également divers produits (conserves, pâtes alimentaires, sucre, savons, petit pois, liqueurs) et des produits de mercerie dans son atelier situé à Sènadé à Cotonou. Martine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Martine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Martine désire renforcer son capital et diversifier davantage son activité. Cependant, Martine ne dispose pas suffisamment de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire le grand nombre de clients et de se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C’est donc pour rendre plus attrayant son atelier et satisfaire plus sa clientèle que Martine sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Martine K. was born on 7th April 1973 in Agonlin, in the department (or administrative region) of Mono in Bénin. Martine is married to Nicéphore AKOGBETO, a printer. The couple has three children who are all at school. All the children live with their parents in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Martine is able to help her husband with the upkeep and education of the children, thanks to the income she gets from her business. Martine attended school up until secondary level and afterwards learnt to sew. She has been carrying out this activity for around 17 years. Aside from this, Martine sells various products (canned foods, pasta, sugar, soaps, peas, liqueurs) as well as haberdashery products in her workshop which is in Sènade in Cotonou. Martine stocks up in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Martine is an old client of ALIDé and repays her loans without any problem. Martine wants to strengthen her capital and diversify her business further. However, Martine does not have sufficient funds at her disposal to satisfy the large number of clients she has and to make more money to cover her various expenses. She is thus asking for a loan in order to make her workshop more attractive and to be able to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of haberdashery and other products (pasta, canned foods, sugar, soaps)

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en:
"B. Nguyễn Thị (10102140032) is a 44 year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  B. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Mạch Tràng (8).

B. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  B. operates a family member's butcher shop.  The main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling pork in the local community.  B. has been involved in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.876.000 VND from SEDA, which was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a 6th loan, for 5.014.000 VND, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà (10102140035) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her butcher shop.

2.  Lại Thị Bảy (10102140034) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 654.000 VND loan to support her recycling business.

3.  Cao Thị L. (10102140012) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4.  Trần Thị L. (10102140033) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


B. Nguyễn Thị (10102140032) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  B. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Mạch Tràng (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2006, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  B. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.876.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà (10102140035) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa H.ng thịt.


2.  Lại Thị Bảy (10102140034) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 654.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


3.  Cao Thị L. (10102140012) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Trần Thị L. (10102140033) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*L. ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Am's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Am I. is the village bank president who was selected by the members, who will use the loan for different purposes. The village bank loan, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Thlok Damnak Luong village in Takeo province.

Mr. Am I. is 61 years old. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a livI.. His wife, Mrs. Oem Mom, owns a small restaurant in the local market. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their livI. conditions, Mr. Am I. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start a new breedI. business. He is the father of three children, two of whom are waiters while the youngest one attends the local school. All the members are shown in the photo but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Houda

texts.en: Houda has worked as a home-based tailor for the past 10 years. Over the years, thanks to her business income, she was able to cooperate with her husband to provide for her family's needs and pay for her 2 children's schooling. Today, Houda is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to help her present a variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Aris

texts.en: Aris was born in 1953. He is married and has four children. He lives in the Absheron region with his family. He has transported loads for seven years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manat to buy spare parts for his truck to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Faustine

texts.fr: M. Faustine est née le 21 Février 1972 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Faustine vit à Suru Léré à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 32 ans. Mariée à DJIVO Gaspard un cuisinier, Faustine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Faustine vit actuellement seule avec ses enfants, son mari étant en voyage. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Faustine n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Depuis environs 15 ans, Faustine vend des produits de beauté et également des chaussures par le système de distribution, ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses besoins. Faustine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité, Faustine ne dispose pas suffisamment de fonds pouvant lui permettre de mener à bien son activité et de se faire plus de revenus. Pour cette raison, Faustine sollicite un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son activité afin de faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges, et d’autre part, de se faire une épargne. Faustine ambitionne plus tard acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
M. Faustine was born on February 21, 1972 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. Faustine has been living in Suru Léré in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, for 32 years. Married to DJIVO Gaspard, who is a cook, Faustine is the mother of 4 children, all enrolled in school. Faustine is presently living alone with her children, since her husband is traveling. The couple share in supporting the family.

Faustine only attended primary school. For 15 years, Faustine has been selling cosmetics and shoes through a distribution system, which allows her to support herself. She buys her wares in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. She has been a client of ALIDé for a long time, having already received four loans that she correctly reimbursed. Despite her enthusiasm for her business, Faustine does not have enough money to run her business well and make more out of it. For this reason, she is requesting a fifth loan to bolster her business so as to manage her various expenses and also be able to put aside some savings. Her ambition is to be able to buy a plot of land in future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah has worked as a truck mechanic since 1998. A father of 2 young children, he works hard to provide better life conditions for the family. Over the years, he has been able to have a growing number of customers. Today, Salah is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new mechanic’s tools because he is planning to enlarge his business by taking on more projects.

loans.use: To buy new mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar has owned a car repair shop since 2002. He has been involved in this field for the past 12 years. He's 23 years old, single, and living with his 3 brothers and mother. He cooperates with his brothers in the household since the death of their father. Today, Jaafar is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy the tools needed for his business in order to repair all types of cars.

loans.use: To buy tools needed for his business in order to repair all types of cars.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan has worked as a taxi driver since 1989. He provides his transportation services for his town and its surrounding area. He is well known in the whole region. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance on this car and to change the vehicle’s wheels to continue his work in a secure way.

loans.use: To perform maintenance for this car and to change his vehicle's wheels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and wheat flour in bulk.

loans.name: Twekambe Christine Kyarimpa Group

texts.en: Christine K. is the group representative of Twekambe group in Masindi district. She is thirty-nine years old, married and has three children, all in schooling. She is provides a food items business. She sells food at the school canteen, especially snacks like chips and so on. She has stayed in her business for over a year. She is using this loan to purchase Irish potatoes, cassava, wheat flour, cooking oil, and so forth for food (snacks) for sale.  The loan is adding to her capital, hence improving her lifestyle too. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to develop her business further.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes, cassava, wheat flour, cooking oil, and so forth for foodstuffs (snacks) for sale.

loans.name: Twekambe Candiru Alice Group

texts.en: C. Alice is twenty-five years old and representing her small group. She is a single business lady blessed with three children, of whom one is in schooling. She is carrying out an art and craft business making different types of mats for sale. She has stayed in her business for a year now. She is using the loan to purchase materials (sisals, colors, bamboo leaves, and so forth) for making mats. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to prosper and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase materials (sisals, colors, bamboo leaves, and so forth) for making mats.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: L. Jeanne vit à Suru-Léré à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 6 ans. C’est une veuve, ayant à sa charge cinq enfants, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Jeanne vit seule avec ses enfants à Suru-Léré. Seule Jeanne assure les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Jeanne n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a sept ans environs que Jeanne mène comme activité, la vente de vivres (riz, haricot, farine de maïs). Jeanne vend également des détergents et des savons, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. Jeanne vend ses produits au marché d’Avotrou à Cotonou, et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. La clientèle de Jeanne s’accroît au jour le jour; mais Jeanne n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. Jeanne sollicite pour cette raison un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
L. Jeanne has been living at Suru-Léré in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, for six years. She is a widow raising 5 children, of whom 4 are her own children. All the children are enrolled in school. Jeanne lives by herself with her children in Suru-Léré. Jeanne is the only breadwinner for her family, using the income she earns from her business.

Jeanne was only able to go to primary school. She has been working at her business for about 7 years, selling cereals (rice, beans, maize meal). She also sells detergents and soaps, which allows her to add to her earning capacity. She sells these products at the Avotrou market in Cotonou and buys her goods in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has been a client of ALIDé for a long time, having already received from this institution 4 loans, which she reimbursed correctly. Jeanne's clientele is continually growing, but she is not able to satisfy their needs since she does not have much working capital. For this reason she is requesting a fifth loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize, rice, and beans, and soap for resale

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Ахунова Мадина проживает в районе Турсунзеде. Возраст, 22 года. Замужем, детей не имеет. Ахунова Мадина имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Фармацевт". В этой области работает 2 года. Она занимается купле- продажей лекарственных средств. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Madina A. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 22 years old, married and has no children. Madina has a secondary technical education and is a pharmacist by trade. She has been working in this field for 2 years. She is involved in buying and selling medications. Madina is obtaining this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Twekambe Naburime Byabasaija Group

texts.en: N. Byabasaija is the representative for her group. She is forty years old and married, with six children all in schooling. She also has two dependents in schooling too. She is carrying out a motorcycle transportation business. She has experienced two years in this type of business. She is using this loan to top up for the purchase of another motorcycle for her transport business. This will raise her income and her standard of living. She is an innovative businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To top up for the purchase of another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Mohamed S.

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Mohamed S. K. has been selling drugs in Makeni city for 10 years now. This father of 2 primary school-going children is seeking a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to expand his business by buying medicines to add to his pharmacy. He would like to invest this loan in such fast-selling medicines as Panadol, ORS, Ibrufen, Septrin, Sudrex, and so on. With the loan, he will travel to the capital city Freetown and buy these medicines wholesale. 

Mohamed was born in Makeni and he is married to a petty businesswoman. They have two children who are in classes III and V respectively.

loans.use: Buy medicines like Panadol, ORS, Ibrufen, Septrin, Sudrex and so on, wholesale

loans.name: Nazile

texts.en: Nazile A. Is married and has 5 children. She is 55 years old. Abushov's family lives in the Khachmaz region. She has three years of experience in the tailoring business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials for tailoring to improving her business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Afde Group No.13

texts.en:
L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by twenty entrepenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and to organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar.  

Ms. Rokhayatou D. is the young president of her group, Afde No. 13.  She had studied hotel and restaurant management, but found it difficult to find a job, and hence began her current activity of selling clothing.  She buys fabrics, which a tailor then makes into clothes. In turn she then sells the clothes to her clients.  Ms. D. has one child, aged 5.  Ms. Aissatou Fatim N. is the group's treasurer.  Her main activity is selling juices, which she prepares from bissap flowers and monkey bread (baobab fruit).  Each group member will receive a loan of 100,000 FCFA for their business.  The other three members are Ramata Touré, Khady F. and Fatou Binetou N..

loans.use: Reinforce each member's small business.

loans.name: Kwegondeza Namukasa Jalia Group

texts.en:
N. Jalia is thirty-five years old, single, and blessed with five children who are all in school.

She owns a retail shop that she has been running for two years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, soap, salt, and drinks like soda, safi, splash, and so forth. She sells the essentials.

She is an entrepreneurial business woman whose dream is to increase her capital to obtain a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, soap, salt, and drinks

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Хамидов Бахтиёр проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Хамидов Бахтиёр имеет среднее Техническое образование. Работает в этой отрасли более чем 15 лет. Хамидов Бахтиёр покупает товар и продает в торговой точке. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor H. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Bahtiyor has a secondary technical education. He has been working in this field for over 15 years. Bahtiyor buys merchandise and sells it at a retail outlet. He is obtaining this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kwegondeza Asimwe Rehema Group

texts.en:
A. Rehema is thirty years old and represents her group (pictured in front). She is a single business woman, blessed with three children who all go to school, and she also looks after her mother.

She owns a restaurant that she has been running for four years. She is using the loan to purchase chairs for her restaurant and a variety of foods to meet the demands of her customers.

She is an entrepreneurial business woman whose dream is to purchase a motorcycle to start a transport business so that she can earn income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Bigando C Doreen Kalisa Group

texts.en:
Doreen K. is thirty-eight years old and married with five children who all go to school.

She owns a grocery store that she has been running for over eleven years, although there were some ups and downs in her business due to lack of capital. She is using the loan to input more capital into her business by purchasing and stocking grocery items for sale such as cassava flour, tomatoes, beans, maize, and so forth.

She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Bigando C Christine Bubiromubi Group

texts.en: Christine B., who is this loan group's leader, is 50 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the last five years, she has made a living running a poultry business. The main problems she faces are an outbreak of disease in her flock and lack of feed. That is why she will use this loan to buy more food, chicks and drugs, each of which will allow her to produce high-quality poultry. Christine is a hard worker and dreams of expanding her business and increasing her profits.

loans.use: To buy feed, chicks and drugs need to maintain a high-quality flock

loans.name: Tushike Mukono Florence Tokewiny Group

texts.en: Florence T. is 43 years old, married and has seven children, five of whom are in school. For the last seven years, she has made a living selling various kinds of food. She has applied for a loan to to buy products such as maize, cassava flour and other items to sell. She is a dedicated and hard-working businesswoman who is committed to improve her life and the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy maize, cassava flour and other items for sale.

loans.name: Bukasa Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: The leader of this loan group, Teddy N., is 37 years old and a single mother of three children ages 10, 15 and 19. All of her children are in school, and Teddy also cares for her parents. For the last four years, she has made a living running a canteen in Bukasa where she sells fresh greens and other produce, sugar, bread, salt, cooking oil and other items that her customers need. This is the second loan Teddy has applied for from Pearl Microfinance, and she will use it to restock her canteen with more goods.

loans.use: To restock canteen with items such as fresh greens.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en: Houssein is 51 years old and lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Since 2008, he has worked as a taxi driver. He went into this line of work after deciding that he wanted to be independent rather than work for someone else. When he first started his business, he didn’t have much cash since he paid a lot for his taxi license and also had many car expenses. A previous loan from our group helped him improve his financial situation and pay for his taxi. Houssein is now applying for a second loan from Al Majmoua to do some maintenance work on his car and improve his house. He has always paid his loans on time, and is known for great customer service and his attention to punctuality. His clients include anyone living in his area.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car and work on his house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia C., 46, lives in Barangay Pipindan, Binangonan, Rizal Philippines. She has been blessed with three children, two of whom are still in school. Her oldest child is employed. Virginia believes that education is very important, and she and her husband work hard to make sure their children get as much schooling as possible. She gets up early every morning to open her variety store and ensure that she has something to feed her family. 

Like many of her friends, relatives and neighbors, she is well versed in the challenges that come with being poor. To secure capital for her business, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2007. She has made good use of three loans to expand her business, and is applying for a fourth loan for PHP 20,000 to buy 10 sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, several cases of beers and groceries and to pay for the cost of transporting them to her store.

Some day, she hopes to open a mini-grocery store with refreshments located near her home, with a branch in the town of Binangonan to provide employment to others. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI help her achieve these goals.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, beer and groceries and to pay for transportation expenses.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is a 44-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon. He lives with his wife and their four children. Jawad has been working in construction for a few years now. He actually owns an excavator that he uses for his work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fuel for his excavator. Jawad has been a microcredit client for eight years now, and he has always paid on time.

Jawad's clients are mainly construction workers. When Jawad first started his work, he wasn't really known by the people in his region. He decided on doing his own business, because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for his excavator

loans.name: Twefeeko Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 24 years old. She is married with two children, a 4-year-old and a 2-year-old. She is a hardworking businesswoman. She has a canteen in Ngandu that she has been managing for one year. From the canteen, she is able to profit 70,000 UGX per week. In her canteen, Lydia sells fresh produce like tomatoes, onions, and Irish potatoes. She also sells sugar, bread, salt, cooking oil, and other items according to customer demand. This is the second time that Lydia has sought a loan from Pearl Microfinance, and she hopes to restock her canteen with more goods.

(Lydia N. appears in the photo, although her face did not come out well. There are 10 members in the group, but one member is not pictured).

loans.use: To restock her canteen with more goods like sugar, bread, salt, cooking oil, tomatoes, and other produce

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Ahmad has owned and operated a coffee shop since 1999. He also offers narguileh (also known as shisha in Egypt), which is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. This tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop, like a billiard to attract younger customers and make his coffee shop a nice place to hang out and have a good time. This is his fourth loan cycle, and he has always paid on time.

Ahmad's previous loans helped him start a new business selling scrap metal. This second business is a way to improve his income. Ahmad is an active man who does his best to improve his family's financial situation, and he even said that if he had more time, he would consider starting a third job.

Ahmad is special in his work, because his clients feel comfortable coming to his shop and enjoying a nice coffee or drink with their narguileh. His clients are his friends, neighbors, passersby, and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the necessary merchandise for his shop. He decided on doing his business, because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to continue improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 33-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Simon has been working as a taxi driver since 1993. Simon is an active man who does his best to improve his family’s income. Therefore, he requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car and also, with the remaining amount, to do some décor changes in his house, because he plans to get married in a year or so. This is his second loan cycle, and he has always paid on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passersby. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing a school van.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane K. A. is thirty-six years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a lab technician.

Jane’s business is located at Serem, a marketplace at Kakamega where she engages in selling eggs and chickens. She supplies her products to local restaurants and shopkeepers.

The major challenge that Jane has is there so many people doing the same business as hers and so customers are spoilt by choice. She also incurs high expenses in feeding her chickens and that's why she is using her loan not only to buy more chicks but also to buy seeds to plant vegetables for the chickens to feed on.

Jane has a dream of giving her children a quality education and also of buying a vehicle to enable her to transport her produce. She wants to be the major supplier of eggs within Serem and outside. She is a very generous and social lady.

loans.use: To buy chicks and seeds for planting chicken food

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 53-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. He lives with his wife and their three children. Mhammad has owned a pastry shop for over thirty years. He sells Baqlawa, Knefeh, Ma'amoul (holiday cookies available all year), and many more delicious Lebanese sweets. Baqlawa is made of many layers of paper-thin dough with a filling of crushed nuts and sugar between layers. Among the different kinds of Baqlawa are Kul wa Ishkur (eat and praise), Zind es Sit (the lady's wrist), and Znood es Sit (the lady's wrists). Knefeh is a decadently rich, creamy, cheesy, crunchy, sweet, and savory desert—very popular during Ramadan. Ma'amoul is a traditionA. rich cookie dusted with powdered sugar and filled with a mixture of sugar, nuts and flavorings.

Mhammad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase the raw materials necessary to make his pastries. This is his third loan cycle, and he has always paid on time.

Mhammad is speciA. in his work, because he is known for his good and tasty pastries. His clients are family members, friends, neighbors, tourists, and passersby. When he first started his business, he didn't have a lot of cash. Mhammad decided on doing his business, because he himself has a sweet tooth, as well as he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Cristela

texts.en:
Cristela C. is a woman with big dreams and the bravery to fight challenges in order to achieve her dreams. She is 29 years old and married to Hector, 31, who is a fisherman. She is a loving mother to two children who are both minors. She lives in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province, in the Philippines.

In 2004, Cristela joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-financial institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with an opportunity of obtaining start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loans in ASHI, she carefully invested in her fishing business and it gave her a reasonable income.

Now on her third loan, Cristela requests 15,000 PHP for the revival of her fish-raising business. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase a fishing net, rope, bamboo, fingerlings (young fish) and labor expenses. This loan will help to reconstruct her fish cage, which was destroyed by the huge typhoon ”Ondoy”.

As a mother, Cristela dreams of sending her children to school and on to completing college degrees and finding jobs for a better living. She also enjoys seeing how the loan from ASHI will change their lives and accommodate her family's needs. Through the support of ASHI, Kiva’s partner, she will, step-by-step, realize her dreams. She also dreams that soon she will have a larger space to store her fishing materials.

loans.use: To reconstruct her fish cage, which was destroyed by typhoon ”Ondoy”

loans.name: Hayfaa

texts.en:
Hayfaa is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Hayfaa has owned a grocery store since 1980. She also sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products etc…She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Hayfaa has been a micro credit client for 10 years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work by diversifying her merchandise and offering more products. 
Hayfaa is speciA. in her work because she opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and passers-by. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulty since she always had her family’s support. Hayfaa decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income and she always wanted to work for herself. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has owned and operated a coffee shop for eight years already. He also serves narguileh (also known as 'shisha' in Egypt), which is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. This tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Ahmad is special in his work because his clients feel comfortable coming to his shop. His clients can be anyone from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business and maybe enlarging his shop so that he can welcome more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El señor Bernardino T. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tupac Amaru, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz. actualmente con uno de sus hijos ya que su esposa falleció.  
El señor Bernardino trabaja como albañil en construcciones particulares de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para el techado con calamina de dos habitaciones en su vivienda.
Esta es la sexta vez que solicita présT. y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Bernardino T. lives in his own house in the Tunpac Amaru zone, which is an area outlying the city of La Paz. He currently lives with one of his children because his wife died. Bernardino works as a bricklayer for private constructions in the city. He supports himself with this income. The loan he is requesting is for a corrugated metal roof for two rooms in his house. This is the sixth time he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corrugated metal to cover the roof of the rooms of his house

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali was been working as a contractor for the past 30 years. Working on a freelance basis, he manages projects in his town and the neighboring villages. He's 46 years old and married with five children. Four of his children are still unemployed so he works hard to take care of his family. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy wood to assure the quality of the construction of his projects.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Johana tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza con Fundación León 2000 ya que han sido de gran ayuda. Tiene aproximadamente 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella tiene una tienda en la cual oferta todos sus productos, está ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace ocho años como vendedora ambulante, después con el paso del tiempo, con las ganancias obtenidas del negocio y con los préstamos obtenidos ha logrado comprar vitrinas, estantes y poco a poco puso su tienda. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa y zapatos, ya que actualmente tiene pedidos que debe cumplir. Su mayor anhelo en el futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Johann, 38, is single and has a six year old child. This is not the first loan she has had with the León 2000 Foundation. They have been a big help. She has been selling general merchandise for approximately eight years. She offers all of her products in her store, which is located in her house. She started this business eight years ago as a street vendor. Later, with the earnings she got from the business and with the loans she received, she was able to buy showcases and shelves. Little by little she set up her store. The loan will be used to buy clothes and shoes because she currently has orders she needs to fill. Her greatest desire for the future is to improve conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 43-year-old single woman living with her only brother. In 2005, she opened a clothing shop to earn a good income and satisfy her needs in life. She is now known throughout the whole region for the beautiful clothes offered to the customer, and she always tries to present a new collection in her shop, she says. Leila is requesting $1,200 for the purchase of additionA. clothing to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua L. A. is fifty-five years old, is married, and has seven children. He and his wife have the dream of giving their children a quality education.

Joshua’s business is located at Serem, a market place in Kakamega where he sells maize. His wife also engages in selling maize. This is a business that he has been doing for the last three years and he has worked very hard, despite too many people in his area of operation doing the same kind of business as his.

At times, the maize market fluctuates depending on the harvest. Joshua is using his loan to buy more maize to expand his maize business. He also sells timber and has a big big dream of being a consultant on matters related to development. He also wants to be a great grain seller within Serem. He is very hardworking and development-conscious.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Bajjo Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Alice is the leader of her lending group in Mukono and a widow with three children, two of whom are still in school. She has owned a retail shop in Bajjo for 13 years; it is from this shop that she earns her children’s school fees. She also has a restaurant in the same area that prepares local foods of all kinds.  It is the profits from her shop, and with the help of loans, that helped her start her restaurant business. 

Alice needs a loan to reinvest in her businesses, as well as to pay fees for her children's education at the beginning of this school term.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop, buying more food, and paying her children's school fees

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra D. est une dame de 73 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de divers produits. Son objectif est de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diarra D. is a 73-year-old lady, married and the mother of 6 children. She has a small business selling various goods. Her goal is to be able to help support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling various products

loans.name: Diamante Group

texts.es: “Diamante”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Exaltación”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de víveres, edredones, atención de tienda de barrio, venta de muebles, juguetes, verdura y taller de mecánica. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan cada una.
texts.en:
“Diamante” (diamond) is a group of seven women and one man who attend the meetings at the Centro Focal Exaltación. They met there recently to get a loan since all of them need to increase their working capital. They have various businesses such as selling provisions, comforters, running neighbourhood shops, selling furniture, toys, vegetables, or running a mechanics shop. All of them need a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials depending on what kind of business they have.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme  de 34 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de jus de fruits locaux qu’elle prépare elle même. Les revenus générés lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a woman of 34 who sells fruit juice made out of local fruit that she prepares herself. Her income allows her to participate in improving living conditions for her family, as well as seeing to their health concerns and school expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of local fruit juice

loans.name: Kisowera Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Christine is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a hard-working and devoted lady with a butcher shop in Kisowera. Christine sells raw pork meat by the kilogram, as well as roasted pork, to her customers especially in the afternoons and evenings. She is able to make 100,000/ UGX per week. 

For five years, her business has been running smoothly but lacked enough capital, and loans have helped this. Christine now needs a loan to buy two pigs that will be sold for meat at her shop.

loans.use: Buying two pigs for meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Ngoné Nar

texts.fr: Ngoné Nar T. est une femme mariée de 59 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de mil, maïs, sorgho et oseille. Son objectif est de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ngoné Nar T. is a married woman of 59, the mother of 5 children. She sells millet, maize, sorghum, and sorrel. Her goal is to be able to contribute to improving living conditions, as well as the health concerns and school expenses, of her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling various products: millet, maize, sorghum, and sorrel

loans.name: Agip Women Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Harriet is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a hardworking and devoted lady with a salon business in Seeta that has been operational for eight years. From her business, she is able to make 80,000/= as profits every week.

Harriet’s business is mostly seasonal, booming during weekends and festive seasons, but all the same, she manages to attract her customers hence being able to make some savings.

Harriet has a dream of expanding her shop to also sell more cosmetics and if possible introduce bridal services at the salon. She needs a loan to be able to buy hair treatment, hair oil and chemicals and also to pay school fees for her children. She is such a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy more hair treatment, hair oils and chemicals and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mbathio

texts.fr: Mbathio T. est mariée, 35 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus. Avec les revenus générés par  cet activité, elle pourra prendre en charge sa famille en santé et en scolarité.
texts.en:
Mbathio T. is married, 35 years old, and the mother of 3 children. She sells cloth for a living. With the income earned in this business, she will be able to better care for her family's health and pay school expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling cloth

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein owns a van which he has used as a taxi since 2006. He’s married with two unemployed children so he works hard to provide the schooling fees and better life conditions.

Hussein provides both trips and private transportation. Today, he is requesting $1,000 to perform maintenance on his van and to change the vehicle’s wheels and renovate the interior in order to present a good service to his customers.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van, change the wheels and renovate the interior

loans.name: Luceritos De La Noche Group

texts.es: “Luceritos de la noche”  es un grupo de 8 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Exaltación”,  se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de mantas, ropa, dulces, productos medicinales, tejido de chompa y costura de prendas de vestir en tela polar. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan cada una.
texts.en:
“Luceritos de la noche” is a group of 8 women and 1 man who attend meetings in the “Exaltación” Focal Center. They met recently in order to discuss access to the loan, since all of the members need to increase their work capital. All have different businesses, such as selling sheets, clothes, sweets, medicinal products, sweaters and fleece garments. All need the loan to buy merchandise and raw materials, as required by each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Gissel Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Gissel del Carmen,  tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y posee un hijo de once años de edad. Ella tiene aproximadamente 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa variada y productos de belleza. Tiene Sus ventas generalmente las realiza de manera ambulante, sin embargo en su casa oferta también sus productos. Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, después fue agrandando el negocio con inversión y con los préstamos otorgados por la fundación, hasta que ahora tiene un negocio establecido con una clientela que la reconocen. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de mercancías. Por lo sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gissel del Carmen is 29, single, and has an eleven year old child. She has been selling different types of clothing and beauty products for six years. She generally sells by walking the streets. However, she also sells her products in her home. She started with a small business selling used clothes. Later, the business was getting larger with investments and with the loans from the foundation. She now has an established business with customers who know her. The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise. She dreams of improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bapupalabo Group

texts.en:
Cecelia N. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Bapupalabo. She is 39 years old and is married with five children. Her children range in age from 3 to 17 and their educational levels are from kindergarten to 7th grade. She also cares for a nephew.

Cecelia lives and sells in West Point, a congested and crowded community close to downtown Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. She was only able to complete 10th grade due to a lack of money to pay her school fees. 

Cecelia’s business is the sale of dried fish. She buys fresh fish from fishermen and dries the fish to sell it. She has been running this business for 14 years and hopes to sell fish to a bigger standard. Cecelia started her business with 2000.00 Liberian dollars that her husband gave her. She dries her fish in a perfect way to encourage more customers to buy her goods. She needs this loan to purchase more fish to improve her business.

Cecelia dreams of educating her children and building a house for her family someday.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale to improve her business

loans.name: Jenipher Achieng

texts.en:
Jenipher Achieng O. is 28 years old and is married to Joanes Ouma. They have three children, the eldest being nine years old.

Jenipher owns a posho mill business (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour) on the outskirts of Kisumu in Nyanza province. She has been running her business for the last fourteen years.

Jenipher hopes to obtain a loan through KADET to enable her buy a new grinding mill and more sacks of maize to meet the demands of her clients. Her posho mill is the only one available in her area and this means that she has a huge clientele.

Jenipher’s dream is to diversify into a sugarcane plantation business.

loans.use: To buy another grinding machine and more sacks of maize

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim has owned a coffee shop in his town since 2008. He’s 27 years old and is married with one child. His café is a well-known place where the villagers come to rest and enjoy their time with a good coffee taste and speciA. Lebanese tobacco.

Ibrahim is very thankful for his business because it allows the villagers to meet together. At the same time, it provides better life conditions for his family. Today, Ibrahim is requesting $1,000 to buy a new espresso machine.

loans.use: To buy a new espresso machine

loans.name: Hellen Nashorua

texts.en:
Hellen is married and has one child, Sammy, who is three years old. 

Hellen has been in the business of rearing livestock for eight years. She rears the livestock on her farm and sells them in an open-air market which has many customers.

Hellen was introduced to KADET through existing clients and has no loan from other micro-finance institutions. She is servicing her first loan at KADET and intends to use the loan to purchase more livestock like goats, sheep and cows. With the extra profits, she will buy improved livestock breeds. 

Hellen hopes to be self-reliant and expand her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aida es una mujer muy trabajadora, y esforzada, tiene 55 años de edad, procreo cuatro hijos  los cuales trabajan, ella es maestra y lleva muchos años laborando en la educación a muchos jóvenes para que aprendan a forjar un mejor futuro. Ahora también vende productos de cosméticos como: shampoo, cremas, vanidades, perfúmense, tonificador, talcos y body. Vende por encargo a sus clientes, por que trabaja con catálogos, pero mantiene también productos para ofertar y vender siempre ya que son otros ingresos que vienen a mejorar la manera de vivir. Ya que su salario es mínimo y tiene que cubrir muchos gastos. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de cosmético como: crema, perfumenes, body, vanidades, pinturas y ropa interior para dama y caballero para mejorar las ventas. Contenta por el financiamiento ya que es una fuente para incrementar el negocio y poder mantener sus ventas.
texts.en:
Aida is a very hard working and diligent woman. She is 55 years old and has four kids who all work. She is a teacher and she has been working with young people in the field of education for many years so that they can learn to create a better future. She also now sells cosmetic products such as shampoos, cremes, beauty products, perfumes, toners, talcs and body lotions. She sells depending on her clients' demands as she works from catalogues, but she always has some products to offer and sell as this means more income which will improve her quality of life. She needs this as her salary is low and she has to cover many costs. With this loan she will invest in buying cosmetics such as cremes, perfumes, body lotions, beauty products, nail varnishes and women's and men's underwear to improve sales. She is very happy with this financing as it is a way for her to expand her business and maintain sales.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as cremes, body lotions, beauty products, nail varnishes and underwear/Comprar cosmeticos como: crema, body, vanidades pintura y ropa interior

loans.name: Strong Women Put Together Group

texts.en:
Cecelia S. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called “Strong Women Put Together”. Cecelia is 39 years old and a widow, with five children aged between 2 and 18 years old with educational levels of 1st through 3rd grade. She and her family live and work on Benson Street, a crowded street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Cecelia’s business is the sale of roasted plantain. She buys plantain from farmers and sells to residents of Benson Street. She has been running this business for twelve years and hopes to own a store in the near future. She talks to her customers with a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Cecelia started by selling cassava and her capital at that time was LRD 100 from savings. She needs this loan to purchase used clothes for her daughter to start selling.

Cecelia dreams of giving her children a better education so that they are able to have a good future. She was never able to go to school herself due to lack of financial support from her parents.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes for her daughter to start selling

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es: Doña Johana tiene 43 años de edad,  casada, y con cuatro hijos que procreo, junto a su esposo han forjado una casa para su familia aunque a un  falta mucho por reparar ya que una parte de su casa aun es de madera y insegura, hay que repellar las paredes que están  y poner piso ya que es de suelo.  Su negocio es la venta de ropa que durantes años se ha dedicado a la ventas, el cual inicio con apoyo de su esposo, producto de su trabajo, de conductor, el cual gana poco pero han sobresalido, sus venta de ropa las da al contado y al crédito por gracias Adios tiene muchos clientes y la variedad que ha venido vendiendo ha mejorado sus ventas. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en uniforme, calcetas, camisolines, zapatos. Ya que comienza el año escolar y muchos padre no tienen para comprar en efectivo el cual se les da para pago de de quincena, el cual espera obtener buenas venta y poder ahorrar para hacer las mejoras a su pequeña vivienda. Agradece a la institución por hacer posible su venta y la mejoría de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Johana is 43 years old. She is married and has four kids. Together, her and her husband have made a house for their family, although there is a lot of repair work to do as one part of it is still made of wood and is very unstable; they have to reinforce the walls that are already there and put flooring down on the ground. Her business is selling clothes and she has been in sales for a long time. She started this business with the support of her husband as through his work as a driver he does not earn very much. Her clothes' sales give them cash and credit as, thankfully, she has a lot of clients and the variety of clients has meant that her sales have improved. With this loan she wants to invest in uniforms, knitted socks, camisoles and shoes as the school year is starting and many parents do not have enough money to buy in cash so she will sell to them and charge every fortnight. She hopes this will bring her good sales and allow her to save in order to make some home improvements. She is very grateful to the bank for making her sales and house improvements possible.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy uniforms, socks, shirts and shoes to take advantage of the time of year as schools are going back/Comprar ropa de uniformes, calcetas, camisolines y zapatos para aprovechar la temporada de regreso a clase.

loans.name: Mary Ayako

texts.en:
Mary Ayako W. is 48 years old and is from the Majengo area in Vihiga town. She is married to Charles Amutabi who is a veterinary doctor and they have four children, the eldest being 26 years old.

Mary owns a number of dairy cows which she uses to obtain milk to sell to her clients. Her clients mostly consist of the local hotels, shops and families in her neighborhood.

Mary has been in KADET for a while now and has a good credit history. She hopes to obtain a loan to enable her to buy more cows due to the high demand for milk. She also hopes to buy a milk cooler for storing the milk as she transports it to her clients. 

Mary’s desire is to use the profits made to educate her children and improve her family’s living standards. She longs for the day when she will open a milk factory.

loans.use: To add more stock by purchasing two Friesian cows

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 39-year-old widower with two children. He supports his two children after the passing of their mother and he manages his time and work to be always by their side.

Mohamad has been working as a fisherman for the past twenty years. Today, he is requesting $1,000 to change his boat motor and perform maintenance on it.

loans.use: To change his boat motor and perform maintenance on it

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz H. is 44 years old. He is married and has six children! He is a hard-working man who has fought to educate his children and provide for his family.

Eyvaz has much experience in raising calves because he observed it from a young age. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance in the form of investment in his business to allow him to buy more cattle. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow.

Eyvaz applied for a loan to buy calves. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you will provide them by helping him continue his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Husniyya

texts.en:
Husniyya M. is the devoted mother of three sons and she struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.

Fifteen years ago, Husniyya got the idea of starting to raise cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available for this business on their land. She is engaged in this business together with her husband.

Slowly the number of cows increased and with them, Husniyya’s clients started asking for more and more. For this reason she is requesting a 1,600 AZN loan. Be an important part of the growth of Husniyya’s business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Sébastienne

texts.fr: A. Sébastienne est née en 1966 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Il y a environs 40 ans que Sébastienne vit au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AGOSSOU Emmanuel un chauffeur, Sébastienne est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Sébastienne a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Sébastienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Sébastienne vend des céréales (maïs, riz) à son domicile. C'est depuis 35 ans que Sébastienne mène cette activité. Sébastienne vend également de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs), ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. C’est au marché Houègbo, au Bénin que Sébastienne s’approvisionne. Sébastienne a déjà obtenu deux fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Sébastienne ambitionne agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante et constituer aussi une épargne consistante. C’est pourquoi Sébastienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Sébastienne was born in 1966 in Abomey, a historic city in Bénin. For about 40 years, Sébastienne has been living in the Zogbo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to AGOSSOU Emmanuel, a chauffeur, Sébastienne is the mother of 5 children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She is raising another child as well. She lives with her children and her husband. The couple work together to support the family.

Never having been to school, Sébastienne sells cereals (maize and rice) out of her home. She has been in this business for 35 years. She also sells a local dish called "akassa" (made out of cornstarch) which allows her to add to her earning power. She buys her goods in the Houègbo market in Bénin. She has already received and correctly reimbursed two loans from ALIDé. Very much in demand with her customers, Sébastienne would like to expand her offering so as to manage her growing customer demand and be able to put aside savings regularly. This is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize and rice

loans.name: Kely Iris

texts.es:
La Sra. Kely vive en casa propia en la zona de Esmeralda norte -sacaba , como actividad economica tiene una tienda de barrio que esta ubicado en su domicilio, la cliente es de clase sencilla y humilde, es madre de cuatro niños, Ella mantiene el hogar.

En la tienda tiene una variedad de productos para vender entre ellos son : pan , leche ,refrescos , arroz , fideos otros, todos ellos de uso domestico.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Kely lives in her own house in the Esmeralda Norte neighborhood in Sacaba. Her source of income is a small store that she has in her house. She is an unassuming and humble person and is the mother of four children. She is the provider for her household. In her store she has a variety of products for sale, such as: bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, and noodles, among others. Everything is for household use. She is very grateful to Emprender [Kiva Field Partner] and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in her and for granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her small store.

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Allahverdi G. is 29 years old. He began to work with land at a young age because of lack of financial resources. He grows different kinds of fruit, which has allowed him to support his family.

Allahverdi is now requesting loan of 1,600 AZN to enlarge his business and purchase seeds and fertilizer to grow more crops. This should allow him to satisfy the needs of his customers and improve socio-economic conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer to increase crop production

loans.name: Lavodi Plus Group

texts.en:
Lavodi Plus is a community bank of twenty-nine owners of small businesses. It is chaired by Franck O.. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Franck, 31, became a micro-entrepreneur in 2007 and runs a booth selling phone accessories. Currently he earns a profit of $25 a day. His dream is to open a boutique in his area.

Franck has already received four loans from HOPE DRC and has fully repaid them. He intends to use this loan to reinforce his working capital in order to purchase more phone accessories to sell.

Franck is married and has two children, 6 and 8 years old. Both go to school.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gédéon Plus Group

texts.en:
Nzeki M. is the leader of the community bank named “Gédéon Plus” which is composed of thirty-one micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity. They will receive loans from Kiva through HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Nzeki M., 44, is single and runs a restaurant. With her first loan, she expanded her business by adding vegetables and palm oil, items in high demand where she works in eastern Kinshasa. She has been a faithful HOPE DRC client since then and her business has prospered. She makes the equivalent of $10 per day in profit.

Nzeki M. is planning with this loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by purchasing twenty kilograms of salted fish. She is working very hard and would like to continue receiving HOPE DRC loans in order to achieve her dream of modernizing her restaurant by using electrical appliances such as hot plates instead of charcoal. She also plans to start a catering service.

loans.use: To purchase twenty kilograms of salted fish for her restaurant

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: D. Georgette est née en 1954 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de 32 ans que Georgette vit à Sodjèatinmè à Cotonou. C’est une veuve, ayant à sa charge six enfants, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants de Georgette sont scolarisés. Georgette vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Georgette n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Georgette vend du pétrole, des pièces de rechange à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Georgette s’approvisionne. Georgette a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. L'activité de Georgette lui génère de revenus et lui permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille. Mais faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner à temps afin de répondre efficacement à la demande des clients, Georgette perd ses clients. C'est pourquoi Georgette sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son activité et garder sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Georgette D. was born in 1954 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Georgette has been living in the Sodjèatinmè area of Cotonou for the past 32 years. She is a widow, with six children under her care, of which four are her own. All of Georgette’s children are educated. Georgette lives alone with her children and is the sole provider for her family needs. Georgette has only attended primary school. Georgette sells petroleum gas and spare parts from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Georgette has already been granted three loans from ALIDé, all of which have been fully reimbursed. Georgette’s activity generates enough income to meet her household expenses. However she is losing customers, because lacking sufficient financial resources, she is unable to get supplies in time and respond efficiently to customer demands. For this reason, Georgette is requesting a fourth loan to reinforce her business and keep her customer base.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 25-liter jerrycans of petroleum gas

loans.name: Line

texts.fr: S. Line est née le 30 Mai 1977 et est mariée à SESSINOU Simplice, un magasinier. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Il y a 2 ans environs que la famille s’est installée à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Line mène comme activité, depuis une dizaine d’année la vente de divers produits (produits concentrés, pâtes alimentaires, sardine, lait, petit pois, mayonnaise, couscous, riz, savons, bougies, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile à Agla. Line vend également des condiments de sauce (tomate, piments, huile de palme et d’arachide), ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. Line a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Très sollicitée par ses clients, Line ambitionne agrandir davantage son étalage afin de mieux faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante, mais Line manque de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est ce qui amène Line  à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Line voudrait également plus tard construire sa boutique en briques.
texts.en:
Line S. was born May 30, 1977 and is married to Simplice SESSINOU, a storekeeper. The couple has five children, all in school and living with their parents. About two years ago the family moved to the Agla area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple share in supporting the family. For the past ten years Lise has been selling various products from her home-based shop in Agla : concentrated products, pasta, sardines, milk, peas, mayonnaise, couscous, rice, soap, candles, etc.. She also sells sauce ingredients (tomatoes, hot peppers, palm and peanut oil), which allows her to diversify her sources of income. Line has already been granted two loans with ALIDé, both of which have been reimbursed. Very much valued by her customers, Line wants to expand her display of goods to better respond to the ever-growing demand, but lacks the financial resources to do so. This is why Line is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. At some point, she would also like to rebuild her shop with bricks.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (pasta, concentrated products), condiments (tomatoes, hot peppers, etc.), and peanut oil

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago A. Hernández de 47 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su esposa y su madre. Él posee una venta de ropa casual para niños mujeres y hombres, dicho negocio esta ubicado en el centro de San Salvador, lugar que es muy apto para este tipo de negocio, debido a que transita una gran cantidad de personas. A pesar que Santiago no cuenta con hijos, es un hombre muy trabajador quien desea obtener muy buenas ganancias las cuales le permitan darle una vida mejor a su esposa y su madre, quien por su avanzada edad depende exclusivamente de lo que su hijo pueda ofrecerle. Es por esto que Santiago solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes tamaños, colores y estilos, de manera que pueda captar la atención de más clientes, los cuales buscan algo diferente.
texts.en:
Santiago A. Hernández is 47 years old and lives in the county of San Salvador with his wife and mother. He sells casual clothes for kids, women and men, and this business is located in the centre of San Salvador, an area which is very apt for this type of business as many people pass through it.

Despite the fact that Santiago does not have kids he is a very hard working man who would like to earn a good living which would allow him to give his wife and mother better lives, especially as his mother is elderly and depends on him for everything. This is why Santiago would like a loan with which he would be able to buy larger quantities of clothes in different sizes, colours and styles, which would mean attracting the attention of more clients who are looking for something different.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes/Compra de ropa.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia TOAMASA, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, la socia es natural D. Pisac situado en la provincia D. Calca departamento D. Cusco, está a 40 minutos D. la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero D. unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado D. paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia Tomasa tiene 60 años D. edad, ella es casada con otro artesano y juntos tienen su stand en la feria D. Pisac en la plaza principal del pueblo a unos metros D. los magníficos monumentos incas, la socia también tiene 3 hijos D. 38, 35, 30 años D. edad, nuestra socia comparte este oficio por años con su esposo y amigo, la socia nos cuenta que ella tal vez fue una D. las primeras artesanas en instalarse hay y cada año lo ha hecho y esto le permitió construir su casita y criar y educar a sus tres hijos y hasta el día D. hoy es una fuente D. ingreso económico, la socia a alternado a esto la crianza D. cuyes, ella cría estos animalitos para su reproducción y venta final, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materia prima e implementar su tienda con nuevos productos para la venta D. artesanía y parte del dinero lo destinara para comprar algunos animalitos mas.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, asi mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Tomasa, belongs to the community bank “INTIWATANA”. She is originally from Pisac which is in the province of Calca, in the county of Cusco which is 40 minutes from the city. It is a small town which was beautifully built by the Incas, and is a place which all tourists are obliged to visit when they pass through Cusco.

Our member, Tomasa, is 60 years old and she is married to another craftsman. Together they have a stand in the Pisac market which is in the central square of the town, a few metres from the magnificent Incan monuments. Tomasa also has three kids, who are 38, 35 and 30 years old. Tomasa, her husband and her business partner have worked together for many years, and she tells us that they were perhaps the first artisans to set up there, as they have done each year. This allowed her to build her small house and raise and educate her 3 kids, and even today it is a great source of income for them. She alternates doing this with keeping guinea pigs, which she raises to breed and sell.

She would like a loan to buy raw materials and to stock her shop with new craft products. Some of the money will go towards the animals.

She is grateful and values the opportunity given to her, and she is committed to repaying the loans she owns on time.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She requires a loan to buy raw materials to make clay and to increase the number of guinea pigs to raise/La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar materia prima para elaborar arcilla y aumentar cuyes para su crianza.

loans.name: Israel Baltazar

texts.es: Israel Baltazar A. 51 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposa e hijos. Él posee una venta de hamacas, con la cual cuenta desde hace más de 10 años atrás, Israel es una persona muy agradecida con la vida, ya que goza de la bendición de poseer un negocio propio que le ha permitido brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, que son la principal razón por la que se esfuerza día con día. La venta de hamacas esta ubicada a un costado de La Alcaldía de Usulután.
