Cada día muy temprano Israel  carga sus hamacas desde su hogar hasta las calles de Usulután colocándolas en la pared de la Alcaldía,  con el deseo  de vender la mayor cantidad  de su producto, y con la ilusión de poder obtener muy buenas ganancias, que le permitan ofrecer una mejor vida a su familia. Es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de hamacas, así mismo comprar otros productos típicos de El Salvador como sandalia y adorno hechos a mano. Israel cuenta con el deseo de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
51-year old Israel Baltazar A. lives in Usulután Department with his wife and children. He has sold hammocks for more than ten years. Israel is grateful for his life since he is blessed with a business of his own which allows him to provide his family with all the necessities. This is his main motivation for working hard every day. His hammock business is located on one side of Usulután’s City Hall. Very early every day Israel loads up his hammocks and takes them from his house into the streets of Usulután where he hangs them from the walls of City Hall. He sells as many as possible hoping to earn a good profit so that he can provide a better life for his family. For this reason he is asking for a loan so that he can buy more hammocks and other items typical of El Salvador such as sandals and handcrafted ornaments. His wish is to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hammocks, ornaments, and sandals

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia LUCIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 47 años de edad, ella es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24,21, 11 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella está ene l negocio de compra y venta de frutas y verduras en la feria de Pisac en la plaza principal del pueblo a unos metros de los magníficos monumentos incas, la socia vende también menestras y de este modo diversifica sus productos, ella dice que es necesario la presencia de otros rubros en esta área dedicado al turismo y a la venta de artesanía, la socia a encontrado un excelente mercado y por ello solicita ahora el préstamo de este capital que le permitirá compra al por mayor frutas y verduras para su venta.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Intiwatana Community Bank. She lives in Pisac, Calca province, in the department of Cusco, about 40 minutes from the city. It is a small town with some beautiful Inca buildings which tourists have to pass through on their way to Cusco . Lucia is 47 years old, divorced, and has four children aged 26, 24, 21, and 11. Part of her day is taken up with household activities, and part with her business buying and selling fruit and vegetables in Pisac market. The market is located in the main plaza of the city, a few metres away from magnificent Inca monuments. Lucia also sells vegetable soup, thus diversifying her products. She says that it is necessary to have different work in an area generally dedicated to tourism and handicrafts. Lucia has found an excellent market for her produce so she is asking for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices which she can then re-sell. She is grateful for this valuable opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make the repayments according the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Olinda Del Carmen

texts.es: Olinda del Carmen T. D. F. D. 56 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante. Olinda posee una venta D. frutas y verduras en un pequeño mercado D. Usulután. DesD. hace 2 años que ella cuenta con este negocio, el cual les ha permitido tener una vida llena D. todo lo básico necesario para sobrevivir. Olinda trabaja en conjunto con su esposo en el negocio, con la diferencia que el sale a las calles D. Usulután en un pick up ofreciendo su producto, y Olinda se queda en el lugar D. la venta, esto lo hace con el fin D. obtener mayores ganancias. Razón por la cual solicitan un préstamo, ya que Olinda desea poder comprar más frutas y verduras al por mayor con el fin D. poder comprar a menor precio y D. esta forma ofrecer su productos a menores precios que su competencia. Tanto Olinda como su esposo son un matrimonio muy trabajador, los cuales se esfuerzan por una vida mejor para ambos.
texts.en:
56-year old Olinda del Carmen T. D. F. lives in Usulután Department with her husband who is a businessman. Olinda owns a fruit and vegetable stand in the small Usulután market. She started the business two years ago, and it has allowed her to obtain the basic necessities in order to survive. Olinda and her husband work together in the business. He goes out into the streets in a pick-up to sell the produce, while she stays with the stall. This way they can earn the most money. They are asking for a loan as Olinda wants to be able to buy more fruit and vegetables at cheaper wholesale prices so she can sell her produce for less than the competition. Olinda and her husband are a hardworking couple who both put in a lot of effort to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: AÏTCHEOU Suzanne est née le 11 Août 1967 à Savalou, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Mais depuis près de 20 ans, Suzanne s’est installée à Yagbé à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ZANGRONIO C. Joseph un agent de sécurité, Suzanne est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Yagbé. Suzanne vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Suzanne a fréquenté jusqu’au cours secondaire. Il y a environs 10 ans que Suzanne mène comme activité, la vente de maïs et de piments à son domicile. Suzanne vend également de l’huile d’arachide à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de multiplier ses sources de revenus. C’est dans le Nord du Bénin et aussi à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Suzanne s’approvisionne. Suzanne a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Suzanne souhaite renforcer son capital et augmenter le stock de ses produits pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Cependant, Suzanne ne dispose pas suffisamment de fonds pour y arriver. C’est la raison pour laquelle Suzanne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Suzanne A. was born August 11th, 1967, in Savalou, in the Zou department of Benin. But for nearly 20 years, she has been living in Yagbé in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to C. Joseph Zangronio, a security guard, Suzanne is the mother of six children who all go to school. All the children live together with their parents in Yagbé. The income brought in by her business enables Suzanne to help her husband with the family expenses. Suzanne attended school up until high school. For about 10 years, Suzanne has been selling corn and hot peppers out of her house. She also sells peanut oil at her house, thereby increasing her sources of income. Suzanne gets her supplies from northern Benin and also from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She has already received three loans from ALIDé, which she has paid back. Suzanne would like to strengthen her capital and increase her product stock to better cater to her clients, but she doesn’t have enough funds to do so. This is why Suzanne is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of corn and seasonings (hot peppers)

loans.name: Jeremías Azarias

texts.es: Jeremías Azarías T. P. de 35 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 16 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Desde hace 10 años que Jeremías posee  una panadería, en la que junto a su esposa se dedican a elaborar el pan que posteriormente Jeremías sale a vender de manera ambulante por las calles de Cojutepeque, así mismo su esposa se encarga de atender las ventas por unidad o al por mayor que se hacen en la panadería. Jeremías solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, levadura y otro horno para poder hacer más pan. Tanto para él como para su esposa contar con la panadería es una gran bendición debido a que es a través de esta como obtienen el dinero para pagar todos los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeremías Azarías T. P. is 35 years old, and lives in Cojutepeque, in the Cuscatlán region of El Salvador. He lives together with his family, including his wife and his two sons, ages 6 and 16, both of whom are enrolled in school. For 10 years Jeremías has owned a bakery, in which, together with his wife, he bakes the same bread that, in years past, he went out on foot to sell in the streets of Cojutepeque. Now, his wife manages the bakery's sales, both of individual units and of wholesale orders. Jeremías requests a loan through which he would be able to purchase flour, lard, yeast, and another oven so that he may produce greater quantities of bread. For his wife as much as for himself, Jeremías looks to his bakery as a great blessing for his family, as it provides them with a means to earn the money they need to pay for all the expenses of their home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de harina, manteca, levadura y un horno.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Ana Lisbeth

texts.en:
Ana Lisbeth is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five daughters in Desemparados, San Jose, in the central valley of Costa Rica.

This is Lisbeth’s second loan with Fundacion Mujer. Her first was for 1,000,000 colones over twenty-four months and was dispersed in 2003. Lisbeth owned a corner store but, unfortunately, she had to close down the project because three mini-supermarkets opened in close proximity to her small store. The competition was too much and she was crowded out of the market.

Not to be deterred by the breakdown of her first enterprise, Lisbeth has since opened a beauty salon named “Lisbet’s Salon”. She has two years of experience working in salons and so, five months ago, she decided to open her own business. For the last five months, she has been working hard to keep the salon profitable.

Business hours are from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m., Tuesday to Saturday. Lisbeth works alone in her salon and offers a range of services including manicures, pedicures, haircuts and hair extensions. In a good month she earns 400,000; in bad months 160,000. The loan officer that has been working with Lisbeth describes her as hardworking with a fighting spirit and a strong history of punctual repayments.The current loan will be used to invest in her new business.

Lisbeth is applying for this loan to reinforce her working capital. She will use the loan to invest in general activities conducive to the growth of her salon. This last year was hard on business but in January her products and services have become popular in her community.

Specifically, Lisbeth will use this loan to buy a swivel chair to replace her old one in an effort to provide better service to her clients. She will also use the loan to purchase various products necessary for hair alterations, manicures and pedicures. Lisbeth says her only obstacle is economic.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and a swivel chair

loans.name: Anita De Jesús

texts.es: Anita D. Jesús H. D. F. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y tres nietos. Anita posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, tamales y quesadillas, las cuales son hecha por ella y comercializadas en su propia casa, trabajo en el cual su hijo menor y sus nietos le ayudan, mientras Anita sale por las calles D. Ateos, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, a comercializar D. manera ambulante sus productos, esta ultima actividad, la realiza con el fin D. obtener unas ganancias extra. Anita solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar arroz, maíz y más frutas y verduras, D. manera que pueda surtir su negocio y al mismo tiempo cuente con mayor materia prima para la elaboración D. los tamales y las quesadillas, Anita junto a su esposo son conocidos como personas muy emprendedoras, las cuales se han esforzado por brindarles a sus hijos una vida humilD. pero  con todas las necesidades básicas suplidas.
texts.en:
Anita D. Jesús H. D. F. is 60 years old and lives in the La Libertad district with her husband, two children, and three grandchildren. Anita's business is the sale of fruits and vegetables as well as tamales and quesadillas (regional foods) which she makes herself and sells out of her own house. Her oldest son and her grandchildren help her with her sales while she travels the streets of Ateos, also located in the district of La Libertad, to sell her products door to door. She started to sell her goods through mobile means in order to gain some extra income. Anita is seeking this loan to buy rice and corn as well as more fruits and vegetables in order to restock her business and at the same time have more raw materials for the production of her tamales and quesadillas. Anita and her husband are both known for being entrepreneurial people who have maD. an effort to proviD. a humble but basically sufficient life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetables; rice and corn.

loans.name: Xekh Niakh Group

texts.fr:
Xekh Niakh N°27 est un démembrement du groupe Xekh Niakh un groupe qui fait de la lutte contre la pauvreté  son champ de bataille. D’ailleurs même  Xekh Niakh est une expression  wolof qui veut dire vaincre la pauvreté. 
Le sous groupe Xekh Niakh N°27 est dirigé par Madame Sadio Guèye et composé de 6 membres tous d’une même famille dont le père est le seul homme du groupement. Ils demandent un prêt de 500 000 FCFA payable sur 10 mois pour financer individuellement leurs activités. 
Pour Madame Sadio Guèye,  la présidente,  ce crédit lui permet d’acheter de l’huile de palme, des balais, de la pâte d’arachide  qu’elle vend depuis 3 ans dans sa localité.  Et les bénéfices qu’elle espère tirer de cette activité permettent de se réapprovisionner et de régler ses besoins et ceux des ses 2 enfants âgés de 11 ans et de 6 ans. Madame Guèye mariée et  agée de 39 ans pense que le succès eu du prêt précédent qu’ils ont soldé avant l’échéance  a motivé leurs membres à demander un autre financement.
Les autres membres du groupement sont : Madame Bineta S. la trésorière et leur maman, elle vend des tissus, des assiettes, et du jus et crème, Monsieur Papa Ibrahima N. leur père lui vendeur de pièces détachées, Madame Tacko F. vendeuse de parfums au marché Grand Thiès, Madame Fatou Diop N. vendeuse de tissus lui elle s’approvisionne à Rosso en Mauritanie et de Madame Dibor N. travailleuse dans une agence immobilière vend des parfums à ses collégues et clients.
texts.en:
Xekh Niakh no. 27 is an offshoot of the Xekh Niakh group, a group which has made its main objective to fight poverty. In fact Xekh Niakh is a wolof expression which means to conquer poverty. Subgroup Xekh Niakh no. 27 is managed by Mrs Sadio Guèye and comprises 6 members, all from the same family; the father is the only man in the group. They are asking for a loan of 500,000 FCFA to be repaid over ten months in order to finance their individual activities. This loan will allow Mrs Sadio Guèye, the president, to buy palm oil, brooms, and peanut butter, which she has been selling for three years in her neighbourhood. And the profits which she expects to make from this activity will allow her both to build up her stock and to cover her needs and those of her two children, who are 11 and 6 years old. Mrs Guèye who is married and 39 years old, thinks that the success of the previous loan that they repaid ahead of schedule has motivated the members of the group to ask for another loan. The other members of the group are: Mrs Bineta S., the treasurer and their mother, who sells cloth, plates as well as juice and cream; Mr Papa Ibrahima N., their father, who sells spare parts; Mrs Tacko F., a perfume seller at the market in Grand Thiès; Mrs. Fatou Diop N., who sells cloth and stocks up at Rosso in Mauritania; and Mrs Dibor N. who works in a real estate agency and sells perfumes to her colleagues and customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finance their activities

loans.name: Boox Xalat Group

texts.fr:
Boox Xalat  est un groupement de femmes qui regroupe à son sein 10 femmes toutes actives dans divers secteurs. Il a été créé, il y’a tout juste un an et est dirigé par Madame Ndeye Fatou S. enseignante  depuis 8 ans dans l’élémentaire. Ce groupement  qui  regroupe les femmes d’un même quartier  permet  pour ces dernières de développer   l’entre aide et  la bonne  cohésion  pour le  bien de leur fief. 
Boox xalat, un mot  wolof  qui signifie avoir la même idée  s’est adhérée  à l’IMCEC Thiès et sollicite un prêt de 500 000 FCFA que va partager à part égale  ses membres afin de financer ou de régler des besoins personnels.
Quant à la présidente Madame Ndeye Fatou Sylla, elle contracte le crédit pour un besoin personnel. Elle compte  financer  avec ce montant l’activité de sa belle sœur qui par manque de pièce d’identité ne peut  bénéficier des œuvres des mutuelles. Sa belle soeur s’active dans la vente du couscous très prisé par les habitants du quartier. Ainsi, grâce à ce financement, elle pourra acheter du mil  et  les éléments nécessaires pour  préparer  le couscous.  Madame Ndeye Fatou Sylla  très respectée par ses paires grâce à sa générosité  est mère de 2 enfants âgés de 04 ans et de 02 ans et elle  est  âgée de 32 ans.
Par contre pour tous  les autres membres du  groupe, le crédit demandé sert à  financer leurs activités.  Elles sont : Madame Boye M.  la trésorière  vendeuse de parfum et  savon,  Madame Awa D. la secrétaire générale  vendeuse  des tissus, Madame Khady N. vendeuse du poisson, Madame Aïssatou F. vendeuse de savon, Madame Marie F. vendeuse  de produits cosmétiques, Madame Sokhna L. vendeuse de petit déjeuners,  Madame Rokhaya D. vendeuse de crèmes glacées, Madame Ndeye Fatou D. vendeuse de fataya et Madame Maguette F. vendeuse de parfums .
texts.en:
Boox Xalat is a group of ten women who own businesses operating in various sectors. The group was set up just one year ago and it is chaired by Mrs Ndeye Fatou S., who has been an elementary school teacher for the past eight years. The group members are women of the same neighborhood. They help each other and share a strong feeling of cohesion for the greater good of their "private kingdom". "Boox xalat" is a Wolof expression which means "sharing a common idea". The group joined the Thiès branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC and applies for a loan of 500,000 CFA francs. Each member will receive an identical share of the loan and use it to finance her business or personal family needs. The chairwoman, Mrs Ndeye Fatou S., will use her loan for personal needs. She will invest it in the business of her sister-in-law who cannot take advantage of the institution's financial products due to lack of proper identification documents. Her sister-in-law sells couscous, which is in high demand in her neighborhood. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to purchase millet and ingredients needed to prepare couscous. Mrs Ndeye Fatou S. is highly respected by her peers thanks to her generosity. She is the mother of two children, aged 4 and 2. She herself is 32 years old. All the other group members, however, will use their loan share to finance their own activities. Mrs Boye M. (the group's treasurer) sells perfume and soap, Mrs Awa D. (the general secretary) sells cloth, Mrs Khady N. sells fish, Mrs Aïssatou F. sells soap, Mrs Marie F. sells cosmetics, Mrs Sokhna L. sells breakfasts, Mrs Rokhaya D. sells ice cream, Mrs Ndeye Fatou D. sells fataya (beef or fish pasties), and Mrs Maguette F. sells perfume.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finance their activities

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma vive en casa de su madre en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como profesora en la provincia, la madre y hermanos de ella se dedican a la elaboración de papas fritas, con este ingresos la familia cubre sus mas mínimas necesidades.
El crédito que solicita es para pagar la operación de su madre porque la señora es diabética y se hizo una herida en el pie el cual tendrán que amputar, y lamentablemente no cuentan con seguro medico.


Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro y  por la actividad que desempeña y el carácter social del crédito, puede acceder a uno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma lives in her mother's house in the zone of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz. She works as a teacher for the province. Her mother and siblings make french fries, which provides enough income to cover the family's basic necessities. She is seeking a loan to buy her mother's business because her mother has diabetes and has hurt her foot, which will need to be amputated, and unfortunately the family does not have medical insurance. This is the first time Irma has sought a loan from Impro and because of the time of business she will be running and the social character of the loan, she will be approved.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating costs of her mother's business

loans.name: Futuro Group

texts.es:
Adela C. integrante del grupo Futuro que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II, se dedica a la producción de mandiles (delantales para señoras originarias de El Altiplano), ella trabaja con este negocio hace 20 años aproximadamente, vende sus productos  en diferentes provincias y pueblos de EL Altiplano, con estos ingresos ha podido sacar adelante a sus  6 hijos. Con el préstamo  comprará una máquina doméstica, tela e hilos de la 16 de Julio.
Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de material de escritorio, venta de papas, tarros de gasolina, comida, atención de una peluquería, tienda de barrio e Internet.
texts.en:
Adela C. is a member of the "Futuro" group, which, in turn, belongs to the Santiago II Focal Center. She produces "mandiles" (aprons for women from El Altiplano). She has been working in this business for about 20 years. She sells her products in different provinces and towns in El Altiplano. With this income, she has been able to provide for her 6 children. With this loan, she will buy a sewing machine, fabric and thread at the 16 de Julio market. The other members of the group also have their own businesses, such as the sale of office supplies, potatoes, cans of gasoline, food, a beauty shop, a neighborhood store and the Internet.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials, merchandise and fixed assets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio MAURO, pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, el socio vive en el poblado de  Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 31 años de edad, el es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 1 años de edad, el socio se dedica a la artesanía, nuestro socio compra materia prima para elaborar artesanía en base de arcilla y otros minerales para sus acabados como son pintura vegetal, pinceles y mucho más, El socio tiene un stand en el mercado central en la plaza principal del poblado de Pisac, los meses de verano que son entre enero, febrero, marzo nuestro socio viaja llevando un porcentaje mayor al país vecino de Chile, él aprovecha el verano y las playas en este país para vender su artesanía en la playa en un stand alquilado, luego regresa a Perú para seguir el resto del año laborando en Pisac y ofreciendo su arte a los visitantes nacionales y extranjeros, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su negocio y de este modo brindar una excelente calidad de vida a su familia.                                   

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our client MAURO belongs to the communal bank “INTIWATANA”. He lives in the town of Pisac located in Calca province in the district of Cusco. He is 40 minutes outside of the city, in a small town situated in beautiful buildings inherited from the ancient Incas, a town known as a must for any tourist who visits Cusco. Mauro is 31 years old, has a common law wife, and two children aged 5 and 1 years old respectively. His business is handicrafts. He buys raw materials like clay and other minerals to make these handicrafts, which include finished products like paintings of nature and other topics. He has a stand in the central market in the main square of Pisac. During summer months (January, February, and March), Mauro brings his merchandise to sell for higher prices in Chile (a neighboring country) and thus he takes advantage of the summer beach tourism to sell his handicrafts. He rents a stand at the beach for the summer but then returns to Pisac, Peru for the rest of the year to offer his work to the national and international tourists who come there. He is seeking this loan to reinvest in his business in order to provide a high quality of life to his family. He is thankful and appreciative of this opportunity and therefore he promises to repay his dept according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for the creation of handicrafts wholesale and retail

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Dolores tiene 26 años, a pesar de ser tan joven le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad venta de ropa. Ella se dedica a la venta, Hace más de 5 años que inicio esta actividad cuando inicio sus estudios de carrera universitaria todo con el propósito de ayudarle a su Mama ya anteriormente también ofrecía cosméticos pero la mayoría de sus clientes eran sus compañeras pero ellas le solicitaban ropa es por eso que dedica a la venta de este productos.  Ella está muy agradecida por todas las cosas que paso para poder madurar y ayudarle a su Mama en el negocio. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa de cama, ropa para niños, para damas por lo que le permitirán diversificar mas las ofertas de sus productos y así generar un poco de ingresos. Tiene el deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dolores is 26 years old, but despite being young, she truly enjoys her job, which is the sale of clothing. She has been selling for more than 5 years, which she started at the same time that she started her college studies with the goal of helping her mother. Previously, she also sold cosmetics, mostly to her friends, but her friends started asking her for clothes, so she decided to sell those products instead. She is very grateful for everything that has happened, which has allowed her to grow and to help her Mother's business. For this reason she is seeking a loan – for working capital to buy pajamas, children's clothes, and more women's clothes in order to diversify her selection and thus generate a little more income. She would like to open a clothing store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - clothing

loans.name: Retamitas Group

texts.es: Rona C. A. integrante del grupo Retamitas por primera vez ingresará a ser parte de la familia de Pro Mujer  ya que necesita el préstamo para acceder a los servicios básicos como luz y agua, ella trabaja por la mañana en una carpintería, pintando y cepillando las maderas y muebles ya que tiene 3 hijos pequeños a los cuales no puede abandonar todo el día. Las demás integrantes del grupo Retamitas que se reúnen en el Centro Focal Santiago II tienen sus propios negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, servicio y producción.
texts.en:
Rona C. A. is a member of the "Retamitas" group. She will become part of the Pro Mujer family for the first time, since she needs a loan in order to gain access to basic necessities, such as power and water. She works in the mornings in a carpentry shop, painting and brushing the wood and furniture, since she has 3 small children whom she cannot abandon during the whole day. The other members of the "Retamitas" group who meet in the Santiago II Focal Center have their own businesses dedicated to commercialization, service and production.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of plastic plates, wholesale

loans.name: Dieng

texts.en:
Mr. Dieng S. is a new client at the Moda Kone branch of UIMCEC in Thies, a city located about seventy kilometers from buS. Dakar. Mr. S., aged 41, is married and the father of three children between the ages of three and eleven. This is his first loan.
Mr. S. works as a carpenter and will use his loan of 100,000 FCFA to purchase wood, glue and other materials for his work. He chose carpentry because of his passion for woodwork, he says.

loans.use: To purchase wood, glue and other materials

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Silvio tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, pues se siente muy bien al realizar una nueva experiencia pues cada uno son diferentes experiencias. Su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de joyería, el un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene que proporcionarle a sus 2 hijos y a su esposa él es un hombre dedicado a su familia. Además solicita este financiamiento con el fin de obtener lo suficiente en materia prima ya que ha tenido muchos pedidos recientemente por lo que tiene varios clientes. El deseo de Silvio es mejorar las condiciones de su local ya que es muy pequeño y le gustaría ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Silvio has received a number of loans from Fundación León 2000, and he is very happy to have had this series of new and different experiences because each loan was unique. His business is the creation and sale of jewelry. He is a very responsible man who truly enjoys his work. He has had this business for more than 17 years. He is the primary provider for his wife and two children, and he is very dedicated to his family. He is seeking this loan to purchase enough raw materials to satisfy the many recent orders he has received from his large client base. Silvio's dream is to improve the conditions of his store – it is very small and he would like to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - raw materials for jewelry

loans.name: Clara Olga

texts.es:
La señora Clara Olga M. Calderón es originaria del municipio de san Juan de Limay se dedica principalmente a la ganadería ella trabaja  en una cooperativa de crédito en san Juan  Limay ya que es contadora el cual se encarga de llevar la contabilidad se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de  cuatro vacas paridas ya que quiere sacar mas ganancias de la venta de leche que tiene actualmente su negocio comenzó trabando como secretaria y con la ayuda de su esposo se dedico ala ganadería ya que su esposo era agricultor y ganadero actualmente doña clara Olga es viuda ya que su esposo falleció  y le toca llevar el control de su pequeña finca junto con sus hijos.

Clara Olga trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábado ella espera que con la compra de sus vacas le vaya muy bien ya que aumentara la venta de lácteos  le generara mas ingresos y de esta manera plantea que quedara bien con ceprodel y mejorara mejor su finca con las ganancias.

Clara es viuda y tiene tre hijos dos de ellos están en la universidad el cual les da su estudio este es el quinto crédito que tiene con ceprodel en un periodo de 5 años 
el cual a pagado muy bien ella nos expreso que los créditos con ceprodel  le han servido de mucho ya que a mejorado sus condiciones de vida de su familia y a podido aumentar la producción en su finca sacándole un mejor provecho por lo que piensa seguir trabajando 
y seguir para que sus hijos puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Clara Olga M. Calderón is from the San Juan de Limas municipality. She devotes herself primarily to raising livestock. She works in a loan cooperative in San Juan de Limay. Because she is an accountant she is in charge of the bookkeeping. She got the loan to buy four calving cows because she wants to get more earnings from the milk sales she currently has. The business began when she was working as a secretary. With help from her husband, she started raising livestock. Her husband grew crops and raised livestock. Clara Olga is currently a widow because her husband died. Running the small farm now falls to her and her children. Clara Olga works everyday, Monday through Saturday. She expects that with the purchase of the cows everything will go very well for her. She will increase the sale of dairy products, and that will generate more income. This way she plans to be in good standing with Ceprodel, and she will improve her farm with the earnings. Clara is a widow with three children. Two of them are in the university. This is her fifth loan with Ceprodel in a period of five years. She has paid very well. She tells us that the loans with Ceprodel have helped her very much because they have improved her family’s living conditions. Also, she has been able to increase production on her farm and get a better profit. She plans on continuing to work so that her children can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four calving cows

loans.name: Angela Asunción

texts.es:
Ángela es socia del  al Banco Comunal Pedregal desde hace 13 ciclo, este banco esta  ubicado en la provincia de Manabí en la costa ecuatoriana,  ella vive en Picoaza y se dedica a la venta de legumbres en el mercado de Portoviejo su jornada laboral empieza muy temprano  desde las 4 de la mañana esta en pie para ir a vender, el lunes es el único día que no sale al mercado.

No es nada fácil realizar este trabajo comenta Ángela, pero ha sabido sacarlo adelante con la ayuda de su familia pues ya lleva 15 años laborando  en el mercado. Con este nuevo crédito solicitado la señora Ángela podrá cancelar a sus proveedores mayoristas de pedidos anteriores  y la diferencia comprará  zanahoria, tomate, cebolla colorada, acelga y más legumbres para abastecer su puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Angela has been a member of the Pedregal Communal Bank through 13 cycles. This bank is located in the province of Manabí on the Ecuadorian coast. She lives in Picoaza and dedicates herself to selling vegetables in the Portoviejo market. Her daily labors begin very early; by 4:00 in the morning she is on her way to the market to sell. Monday is the only day she doesn't go to the market. It isn't easy to do this work, comments Angela, but she has learned how to carry it forward with the help of her family. She has been working in the market 15 years. With this new loan she requests, Angela will pay off her wholesale providers' old bills, and with the difference she will buy carrots, tomatoes, colored onions, salt-wort and other vegetables to resupply her post in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CARROTS, TOMATOES, ONIONS AND OTHER VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia B. se dedica a comercializar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, ropa interior, bisutería entre otros productos según lo que le encarguen sus clientes. Ella está muy feliz por este año que paso su economia se vio muy mejorada y espera que este año nuevo su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
María Eugenia B. has a business selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and imitation jewelry among other products that her clients request. She is very happy because last year she saw her earn economic situation improve and she hopes that it will continue to grow in this new year.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Marvin German

texts.es: Marvin tiene 39 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que el realiza, por lo que ha sido una gran experiencia. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que todos los días sale cargando un bolso en donde lleva toda su mercadería para mostrárselas a sus diferentes clientes, a pesar del inmenso sol y cansancio sabe que tiene que seguir luchando para sus 3 hijos que están a su cargo el es un buen Padre a pesar de no tener la oportunidad de estudiar quiere que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser personas de bien. Actualmente el solicita un financiamiento que le ayude para la compra de calzado, pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior, trajes y además cosméticos. el siempre sueña con tener su propia vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marvin is 39. This is not his first loan, and it has been a great experience. He sells general merchandise. Everyday he leaves carrying a bag where he takes all of his merchandise to show to his different customers. In spite of the immense heat and the exhaustion, he knows that he needs to keep fighting for his three children that he is raising. He is a good father. In spite of not having the opportunity for an education, he wants his children to be able to have an education and be good people. He is currently asking for a loan to buy footwear, pants, t-shirts, underwear, suits, and cosmetics. He always dreams of having his own home for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a 36-year-old woman who is divorced and the mother of two children. Both her children are in school. She is a food vendor who serves food like waakye. Waakye is prepared from local rice grain mixed with beans. Many Ghanaians enjoy it as it has local taste and standards. She says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She has been in food production for four years now to take care of the family. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her children's educational needs. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more meat and rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The loan will go towards purchasing large quantities of fishing products

loans.name: Sebastian Alfredo

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 42 años, es una persona humilde. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. El se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras en el mercado más cercano, el tiene sus clientes que le venden sus productos favorables. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio desde muy joven le gusto el comercio y ha trabajado en diferentes actividades pero necesitaba algún negocio que le proporcionara ganancias diarias y es así que decide establecer una pulpería. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo y así comprar  productos de consumo diario para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y golosinas en general. Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio y además mantener su record crediticio
texts.en:
Sebastián, 42, is a humble person. His business is a mini-market. He gets up very early to make his purchases in the closest market. He has people who sell him their products at favorable prices. He has been in this business for over 20 years. Ever since he was very young he has liked commerce. He worked at different activities, but he needed a business that would give him daily income. That is how he decided to establish a mini-market. He is asking for a loan for working capital. He will buy daily consumption products for his store like rice, oil, beans, sugar, and sweets in general. His greatest dream is to keep growing with his business. He would also like to maintain his loan record.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 52 years old, married and the mother of four children. Three of her children are currently in school and her first son is working. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey as well as cereals like maize and peanuts in bulk. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. Her major target groups are the travelers who ply the road to their destination. Those travelers purchase the kenkey in bulk. She treks to Kumasi in the Ashanti region to buy her stock of goods in bulk. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Geoconda Monserrate

texts.es:
Geoconda V. es socia activa del  Banco Comunal El Pedregal ubicado en la parroquia Picoaza en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí.

Geoconda lleva catorce años de casada, es ama de casa pero también se dedica al negocio familiar de  venta de colas y jugos junto a su esposo desde hace diez años, nos comenta que sus niños aun son pequeños y tienen que trabajar duro para sacar adelante a su familia, sus productos entrega al por mayor a las tiendas en algunos lugares de Portoviejo y lo hace por medio de pedidos, recorre dos veces por semana en su propio auto visitando a sus clientes y tomando los pedidos para luego entregárselos. 

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Geoconda comprará  mas jabas de colas y jugos y nos comenta  para que el negocio crezca tiene que invertir todo el crédito que la Fundación le entregará.

El sueño de Geoconda es poder terminar su casa que aún  le falta algunos arreglos.
texts.en:
Geoconda V. is an active member of the communal bank "El Pedregal," located in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo in Manabí province. Geoconda has been married for 14 years; she is a housewife but also has a business selling colas (soft drinks) and juices along with her husband. They have had this business for 10 years. She tells us that her children are still small and they have to work hard to advance their family economically. They deliver their products wholesale to the stores in some places in Portoviejo and they run the business through orders. Two times a week they go to visit their customers in their own car, taking orders and then later delivering them. With this new loan Geoconda will buy more crates of colas and juices; she comments that in order for her business to grow she must the entire loan that the Foundation gives them. Geoconda's dream is to be able to be able to finish her house, which still needs some work done on it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy crates of colas and juices

loans.name: Felipa Clotilde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia CLOTILD., pertenecen al banco comunal “INTIWATANA”, la socia vive en el poblado D. Pisac situado en la provincia D. Calca departamento D. Cusco, está a 40 minutos D. la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero D. unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado D. paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 58 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 33 y 30 años D. edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella es artesana, compra y venD. artesanías y platería, nuestra socia tiene su stand en el poblado D. Pisac, exactamente en la plaza principal a unos metros del complejo arqueológico D. Pisac, la socia tiene bellísimos trabajos en plata como pendientes artesanía collares, pulseras, prendedores, todos ellos con un fino acabado, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. artesanía y el acabado final D. los colores con óxidos naturales, y comprar las piedras y la plata para las joyas.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su préstamo en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate ClotilD. is a member of the community bank "INTIWATANA”. She lives in the town of Pisac located in the province of Calca, department of Cusco. She is 40 minutes away from the city, in a small town with many beautiful Inca structures. It is a town that is visited by all tourists that come to the city of Cusco. The member is 58 years old, married and has two children of 33 and 30 years of age. She divides her time between activities of running her home and a retail business. She is a craftswoman, buys and sells crafts and silver goods. She has a stand in the main plaza of her town of Pisac. It is a few meters away from the archaeological complex of Pisac. She has beautiful works in silver such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, brooches, all very well crafted. Our member is requesting a loan to be able to invest it in raw materials for the making of her crafts, finishing materials of colors with natural oxides and purchase of stones and silver for the making of the jewelry. The member appreciates and values the opportunity that this medium offers her and therefore she promises to comply with the payment terms of the loan in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The associate requests a loan for the purchase of raw materials for the design and production of crafts and silver goods.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married and has one kid who is currently in school. She resides in her family house in the central region of Ghana. She is 39 years old.  She has been running a clothing shop for five years. She sells ladies and children's wear including shirts for both sexes, blouses, skirts and lingerie goods. She is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She takes delivery of stock in bulk from Accra, the capital city of Ghana. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Felipe Rafael

texts.es: Felipe Rafael tiene 58 años, a pesar de su edad es un hombre que ha trabajado mucho y que disfruta de su actividad como es brindar el servicio de sastrería. El inicio trabajando como aprendiz en otro taller, pero con el tiempo este medio de vida le fue gustando hasta que logro comprar su máquina de coser y con el paso del tiempo compro las herramientas necesarias, anteriormente él decide establecerse en su vivienda pero no tenía suficiente clientes pero esto no lo deprimió pues lo ayudo a salir adelante y con la ayuda de los financiamientos lo obtiene. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de telas, tijeras, hilos, bordados, botones por lo que se acerca la temporada escolar. Su deseo es agrandar un poco mas su local y ofrecer empleo.
texts.en:
Felipe Rafael is 58 years old. In spite of his age he is a man who has worked hard and who enjoys his work as a tailor. He started working as an apprentice in another workshop and he grew to like the trade, so he managed to buy his own sewing machine and gradually acquire other necessary tools. He decided to establish his business from his home, but he did not have enough customers. But this did not get him down, because having his own business helped him to get ahead and with the support of these loans he will achieve success. Currently he requests financing for working capital so that he can buy fabric, scissors, thread, embroidery and buttons because we are approaching the school season. His wish is to expand his premises a little more and offer employment.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 36 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He works very hard in taking care of his children who are in school. He owns a taxi cab for commercial purposes. He has been driving a taxi for four years now to take care of his family. He said business is moving very well but his engine keeps breaking down. He therefore needs loan assistance to buy a new engine so as to remain in business. He dreams of buying a new car before the end of the year and that can be achieved with your loan support.

loans.use: To buy a new engine and a new car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing a large number of foam-rubber mattresses

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga es cliente antigua, trabajo en grupo solidario CONFITAL, desD. el año 2001, actualmente ella trabaja con crédito individual.

La actividad que realiza es la crianza D. cerdos para luego venderlos en la ciudad ya que muchas personas consumen en los platos tipicos D. la ciudad como el fricase el chicharron y el plato tipico D. sucre la fritanga y el mondongo todos estos platos estan hechos a base D. la carne D. cerdo, ella tiene el esposo que trabaja en albañileria y sus hijos que son en su mayoria casados, excepto el menor que se encuentra en edad escolar, la Sra. es una persona muy buena y responsable, vive en casa propia en la zona D. Coqueni,ambos esposos son personas trabajadoras y cumplen con sus pagos en el crédito.						

Estan agradecidos con Emprender y con KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Olga is an old client and has worked in the solidarity group CONFITAL since 2001. Currently, she works with individual loans. Her job is to raise pigs in order to later sell them in the city since many people eat them in traditional dishes in the city like fricase, chicharron and fritanga and mondongo (the regional dish of Sucre). These dishes are all maD. with pork. Her husband works as a bricklayer and their children are mostly married, except for the youngest, who is still in school. Olga is a very good and responsible person and lives in her own home in the Coqueni region. Both spouses are hardworking people and make their loan payments on time. They are thankful to Emprender and to Kiva for the confidence shown in granting them the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balanced food

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is 32 years old, married and the mother of two children. All her children are still in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to expand by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and foodstuffs such as tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa y especies al por mayor, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Hace más de 8 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sin embargo fue hasta hace dos años que la señora decidió invertir en la compra de especies, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Últimamente han tenido muchos problemas relacionados con la inestabilidad en el precio del producto, y es por ello que necesitan financiamiento para cubrir cualquiera de estos problemas. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 41. She has her own business in her home selling clothing and spices. Although she has been working on her own for the last 8 years, it wasn’t until two years ago that she decided to invest in buying spices to increase her income. Lately there have been many problems related to the instability of the price of the products. That is why she needs financing to handle these problems. Her dream has always been to increase her business to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en: Adriana is 23 years old, married and the mother of a baby who is breastfeeding. Adriana is very resourceful in providing her family with food and in paying the bills. She is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in her neighborhood. She has many customers who enjoy her hand prepared food. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her business and pay for her child's medical expenses. It was her dream to attain a higher education but unfortunately that dream could not be realized as she got pregnant and had to marry to survive. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”. Algunos de nuestros socios viven en la ciudad de Compone y otros en la ciudad de Anta. La cuidad de Compone se encuentra a 40 minutos de la Ciudad de Cusco. 

En la ciudad de Compone no existen fabricas, el aire es fresco y no hay mucha contaminación. Es un valle muy hermoso donde las personas mayormente se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería. Nuestros socios se dedican a las actividades antes mencionadas como por ejemplo Paulino, Cirilo, Gregoria, Antonia, Celia y Nancy a la agricultura y Lucila a la ganadería. 

Algunos de nuestros socios ofrecen el servicio de transportes como por ejemplo Virgilio y Sabino que son conductores de taxi. Las socias Albertina, Doris y Carlota venden leche. La socia Marlene se dedica a la producción de yogurt y Benedicto vende comestibles.  
En la casa de la socia Avelina cada treinta días se reúnen los socios. Avelina tiene 45 años y se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar y después continuar con el trabajo. Avelina tiene un pequeño negocio de producción y venta de queso andino. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Por ejemplo la socia Avelina requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para la producción de quesos como ollas y moldes de queso.
Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como fertilizantes, semillas, comida para los animales y comestibles, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
(El socio Virgilio pidió permiso a la junta directiva por motivos de salud y no aparece en el video)
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Mujeres En Acción Communal Bank. Some of our members live in the city of Compone, and others live in the city of Anta. The city of Compone is 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. There are no factories in the city of Compone, the air is fresh, and there is little contamination. It is a beautiful valley where most people work in agriculture and with livestock. Our members work in those activities. For example, Paulino, Cirilo, Gregoria, Antonia, Celia, and Nancy work in agriculture, and Lucilia works with livestock. Some of the members offer transportation services. For example, Virgilio and Sabino are taxi drivers. Albertina, Doris, and Carlota sell milk. Marlene produces yogurt, and Benedicto sells food. The members meet every thirty day’s in Avelina’s house. Avelina is 45. She gets up very early to do the household chores; after that she continues with her work. Avelina has a small business where she produces and sells Andean cheese. She has been in the business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business. For example, Avelina needs the loan to buy more materials like pots and cheese molds to make her cheese. The members need the loan to buy more products like fertilizers, seeds, animal feed, and food. This way they will be able to increase their business capital, have greater income, and give their children a better quality of life. The members appreciate and value the loan, and they promise to pay it on time. (Vigilio asked the governing board for permission for health reasons, and he does not appear in the video.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like fertilizers, seeds, animal feed, and food

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 35 years old, is married, and is the mother of four kids who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment.

Diana is a trader, trading in garment cloth and lace material which she sells through hawking (going door-to-door). Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Accra to buy her stock of goods but, for lack of adequate working capital, Diana buys only a small stock of lace material.
		
Diana loves selling goods. She has another business through which she obtains an additional source of livelihood: she has been selling beans and maize cereals for seven years to support her family. Maize is one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrates in diets. She takes delivery of stock direct from farmers in Techiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, Diana wants to buy maize and beans in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her business expansion and her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase lace material, textiles, beans and maize in bulk

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
el sr. Reynaldo V. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la Colonia el Obrero de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene pocos años de tener su pulperia.
este negocio le genera ganancias para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y su familia.
en estos momentos necesita el credito ya que quiere surtir mas su negocio, las ventas se estan poniendo buenas y no se da abasto para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
el sr. reynaldo es una persona con mucho espiritu de trabajo y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
nos comento que lo que mas quiere en esta vida es su familia y esta dispuesto a trabajar por ellos para darles una mejor calidad de vida.
esta muy contento porque su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Sr. Reynaldo V. is 41 years old and resident of Colonia el Obrero in the city of San Lorenzo. He sells popular consumer products from the store he has managed for the past few years. With his business earnings, he is able to cover his family’s household expenses.

At the moment, Reynaldo is requesting a loan so that he can increase his business inventory. His sales have been good, so he wants to continue meeting all of his customers’ demands. Reynaldo is a person who has a great desire to work and get ahead. He said that what he wants most in life is to be able to give his family a better quality of life. Reynaldo is very happy because his business is growing each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for his store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karel Tatiana

texts.es: La joven Karel Tatiana tiene una farmacia ubicada en su casa de  habitación desde hace 3 años, ella es una persona muy emprendedora pues disfruta mucho interactuar con sus clientes, por lo que alguna veces le solicitan consejos acerca de las medicinas. A pesar de los diferentes problemas que ha enfrentado como es la competencia pero la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos y otros son amigo y familiares de ella. Solicita un financiamiento para la compra de diversidad de medicamentos, ya que esta farmacia es bien solicitada por los clientes, debido a que los precios del medicamento son más favorables que en otras, gracias a Dios y a su arduo esfuerzo a podido salir adelante. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karel Tatiana has been managing a pharmacy out of her home for the past three years. She is an enterprising person who enjoys interacting with her customers who seek her advice about medicines. Despite encountering different problems, including the competition, she continues to serve her customers who are mostly neighbors, friends, and relatives.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a variety of medicines. Her pharmacy is frequented by her customers because the prices of her medicines are more affordable than other places. Thanks to God and her hard work, she has been able to get ahead. Her wish is to see her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 32 years old; he is married with no children. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc., in his neighborhood. 'Ike', as he is popularly known, deems it a big opportunity to expand his business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. He wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, toilet soap, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve sales to enable him to save more for business growth and for the future. He buys his stock from Accra, the capital of Ghana. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase beauty and hairstyling products.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
la señora Francisca C. tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos que dependan de su matrimonio, su esposo trabaja y aporta al hogar. Francisca se dedica a vender pescado y camarones 
esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años.  Este producto lo compra en la playa El Zope y lo comercializa en el departamento de Comayagua a varios restaurantes de la zona, y tambien vende a personas al detalle.
 
Los dias de venta son los miercoles y viernes, el producto lo trasporta en auto bus. 
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar pescado blanco, camaron pargo, filete y curiles. 
gracias a este negocio logra cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
se siente muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca C. is 56 years old, married, and does not have any dependent children. Her husband works and helps support their household. Francisca sells fish and shrimp. She has been in this business for eight years. Her products are acquired at El Zope Beach and sold in the department of Comayagua to different restaurants in the area. She also sells to individual retail customers. The days when she sells are Wednesdays and Fridays. Francisca transports her products in her minibus.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy whitefish, shrimp, snapper fillets, and clams. Thanks to her business, she has been able to cover her household expenses. She is very happy because her business continues to grow each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seafood to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rafaela De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela de Jesús Calderón R. es originaria del departamento de Estelí ella va usar el crédito para comprar lo útiles  escolares  y matricula de sus hijo solicita el crédito porque no tiene todo el dinero para  hacerlo actualmente  y desea matricular a sus hijos sin que ellos tengan ninguna dificultad 

Rafaela es maestra y tiene mas de 10 años de estar trabajando para el ministerio de educación y toda la vida se a dedicado a esto desde que su padres le dieron su estudio ella espera que el crédito le sirva de mucho ya que resolverá sus problemas persónales Rafaela es madre soltera  y tiene tres hijos pero solo dos están bajo su cargo estudiando actualmente  el cual uno de ellos esta en al universidad y el otro en secundaria además sus padres no viven con ella ya que ellos se dedican a la agricultura  este es el primer crédito que    se le otorga a Rafaela y expresa que quedara agradecida con ceprodel por la ayuda que se le esta brindando ya que le ayudara a solucionar los problemas  que tiene por ahora y desea seguir trabajando con ceprodel .
texts.en:
Sra. Rafaela de Jesús Calderón R. is a native of the department of Estelí. She will use this loan to purchase school supplies and pay for registration fees for her children. Rafaela does not have all the money to do this now, but she wants to enroll her children without facing any difficulties.

Rafaela is a teacher and has been working for the Ministry of Education for more than ten years. She has devoted her life to this profession as a result of her parents providing her with an education. Rafaela hopes this loan will solve her personal problems. She is a single mother with three children, but only two of them live with her and are in high school. The other one is attending university. Rafaella’s parents do not live with her and make their living in agriculture.

This is Rafaela’s first loan. She says she is grateful to CEPRODEL for its assistance in helping her solve her problems and looks forward to continue working with the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for school supplies & registration fees for her children

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is 45 years old; she is married and the mother of five children. Two of her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals like beans, maize, and groundnuts, etc., in her neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative and with her eight years' experience she can increase her market size. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income to support her family, especially the children’s education and business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals such as groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Maria Dioselina

texts.es:
La señora Maria  Dioselina V.  forma parte Banco Comunal El Pedregal desde hace 13 ciclos,  las socias se reúnen  en la  parroquia Picoaza en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Maria está casada su esposo es comerciante y viaja al Oriente llevando mercadería como prendas de vestir y ella se dedicada a la venta de productos de belleza Avon,  recorre en la parroquia donde vive visitando a sus clientes puerta a puerta   dejando la mercadería con  facilidad de pago, para comprar los productos invierte un aproximado de 300 dólares por pedido mensual.

Con este nuevo préstamo ella invertirá en su negocio comprando perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, sombras y todo los productos de belleza para la mujer y otra parte entregará a su esposo para abastecer su negocio con ropa para toda la familia e incrementar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Dioselina V. has been part of the Communal Bank “El Pedregal” (The Stony Ground) for the past 13 loan cycles. The members meet in the city of Portoviejo in Picoaza Parish.

Maria is married to a merchant who travels to the east and brings back merchandise such as clothing. She spends her time selling Avon beauty products in the parish where her customers live. Maria travels door-to-door to deliver her merchandise and provide different payment options. She invests approximately $300 dollars each month in order to fulfill her orders.

With this new loan, she will purchase products for her business such as perfumes, crèmes, treatments, eye shadows, and all types of beauty products for women. Part of the loan will be used by her husband to acquire clothing for all ages so that they can grow both of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & clothing

loans.name: Jeffer Alcides

texts.es: El señor Jeffer administra un bus el cual viaja de la paz centro a Managua, de lunes a domingo, el se levanta muy temprano para iniciar los viajes. Además tiene 1 hijo a su cargo que lo motiva a seguir trabajando pues él trabaja muy duro para proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario el agradece la oportunidad con el financiamiento porque es de mucha ayuda para que su negocio salga adelante. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para las mejoras de la unidad y a si brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, a pesar de ser una hombre humilde y trabajador siempre sueña tener vida para que su a familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Sr. Jeffer operates a bus that travels from La Paz Centro to Managua, Monday through Sunday. He wakes up very early in order to start these trips. Jeffer has one dependent child who motivates him to continue. He works extremely hard to provide for his family and put food on the table every day. Jeffer is thankful for the opportunity to receive financing because it will help his business succeed.

This new loan will be used to make improvements to his vehicle so that he can provide better service to his customers. Despite being a hardworking man of modest means, Jeffer always dreams of having a life in which his family lacks nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle improvements

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a businesswoman. She sells Dumas cloth, linen, and lace materials. She sometimes sells through hawking, that is, she uses a personal selling method; this, she said, makes her goods move very fast.  She is 36 years old and a married mother with one child. She is supportive to her family through the proceeds she makes from the business. She has one year's selling experience but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make profit that is more viable to sustain her business. She wants to purchase Dumas cloth in bulk, as well as linen and lace materials to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more to give her child a better education when he grows up.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas cloth in bulk to increase her inventory

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: Mercidia tiene 58 años, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos ya mayores de edad. La señora tiene 25 años de dedicarse de tener de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general, las cuales vende por encargos de forma ambulante. Ella empezó hace 7 años con este negocio, sin embargo en ese tiempo solamente vendía cosméticos porque no tenía el capital suficiente, después se fue haciendo su propio negocio con capital propia y hace 4 años logro trabajar por cuenta propia. Su negocio nace debido a la necesidad de empleo que actualmente acoge a nuestro país. Ahora cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, ya que actualmente tiene bastantes pedidos que le permitirán incrementar sus ganancias. Su sueño siempre ha sido mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mercidia is 58 years old and a single mother of six adult children. She has 25 years of experience selling general merchandise as a traveling merchant. She started this business seven years ago, but at the time, she was only selling cosmetics because she did not have sufficient capital. After establishing her business and raising enough capital over a period of four years, Mercidia was able to start working for herself. Her business emerged as a result of a lack of jobs throughout the country. She now encounters a wide variety of customers.

The loan she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise. She currently has enough orders to help increase earnings. Her dream is to always keep improving her living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Francisco Donato

texts.es:
el sr. Francisco Donato B. tiene 48 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ir a cargar su producto (pan planco) y salir a venderlo en su bicicleta a diferentes colonias y caserios, este pan lo vende bastante ya que el llega a la puerta de cada casa para verder el pan, esto es de mucha comodidad para sus clientes ya que no tienen que salir de sus casas para comprar pan. 
Francisco es padre de 2 hijos, los tiene en la escuela uno en 6 grado y el otro en 5 grado. Francisco dedicado por sus hijos.
necesita el credito para comprar mas pan ya que todo lo vende antes de terminar su ruta diaria.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Donato B. is a 48 year old entrepreneur. He wakes up at 5am to acquire his product (white bread) and travels by bicycle to sell it in different neighborhoods and villages. The bread sells well as he goes door-to-door. His customers find this to be very convenient since they do not have to leave their homes to buy bread.

Francisco is the father of two children. One is in sixth grade and the other is in fifth grade. He is dedicated to his children. He needs a loan to buy more bread since all of his inventory is sold when he finishes his daily route.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase white bread to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akaa

texts.en:
Akaa is 56 years old; he is married and the father of four children. All have completed school and are fully independent. Akaa works very hard to support some of the members in his community by sponsoring brilliant but needy students in his own small way. For his kindness and generosity he is loved by many in the community. He runs canoe business that goes for fishing for him. Through that business he has managed to buy a taxi that generates additional income in support of his love for helping others.

Akaa was a retired fisherman with lots of fishing experience when he finally stepped down so that the upcoming ones can take over from him. He complains of the breakdown of his engine and also needs an additional canoe so that he can maximize his profit margin. He requests your loan assistance to buy a canoe and a taxi cab. He would be grateful for your support as he dreams of using his proceeds to support the needy ones in his community.

loans.use: To buy a canoe for fishing

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Z. Marguerite est née en 1959 et est mariée à NOUVETONOU Denis. Le couple a 8 enfants à charge, dont six sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Marguerite n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs 10 ans que Marguerite mène comme activité, la vente de tissus, de façon ambulante et au marché Vèdoko à Cotonou. Cette activité procure à Marguerite des revenus qu’elle utilise pour la développer davantage et pour subvenir à ses besoins.  Marguerite s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marguerite a obtenu déjà deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Marguerite s’accroît au jour le jour ; mais Marguerite n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. Marguerite sollicite donc un troisième crédit pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Marguerite Z. was born in 1959 and is married to Denis Nouvetonou. The couple cares for eight children, six of whom are their own. All of the children attend school and live together with their parents in the Zogbo quarter in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. The couple shares the family responsibilities. Marguerite did not attend school. For about 10 years Marguerite has been in the business of selling fabric, as a traveling vendor and at the Vedoko market in Cotonou. This work brings income which she uses to develop her business further and to meet her daily needs. Marguerite secures her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. Marguerite has already received two loans through the ALIDé, loans which she has repaid. Marguerite's clientele is getting bigger every day, but she is not able to satisfy demand because her financial means are limited. Marguerite is requesting, therefore, a third loan to build up her business and to better satisfy the demands of her clients.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Ana Isabel Maravilla

texts.es: Ana Isabel Maravilla H. D. O. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana Isabel posee un bazar en el que comercializa botones, accesorios para el cabello, zapatos y otros productos más. Así mismo confecciona ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la que posteriormente pone a la venta en el bazar. Es así como Ana logra darle el apoyo necesario a su esposo, brindándoles así una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar diferentes tipos D. telas en varios colores y estampados, así mismo comprar hilos D. diferentes colores y botones, lo cual será D. mucha ayuda para Ana, ya que contara con mayor cantidad D. materia prima para la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel Maravilla H. D. O. is 38 years old and a resident of Ciudad Arce, which is in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and four children who are students.
