Ana Isabel manages a bazaar where she sells buttons, hair accessories, shoes, and other products. In addition, she manufactures apparel for men, women, and children and then sells them in her bazaar. This is how Ana Isabel provides necessary support to her husband and provides a better quality of life for her children.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics of various styles and prints. In addition, she will acquire threads of different colors and buttons. This will be of great help to Ana Isabel, since she will use most of these materials for making clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and buttons

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Yansy Marlene

texts.es: Yansy Marlene D. E. de 34 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Yansy posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, así mismo se dedica a hacer y vender tortillas en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual las personas llegan a comprar sus productos. Yansy solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos alimenticios como carne, pollo, verduras de modo que surta la tienda, así mismo comprar maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas. Ella tiene la ilusión de mejorar las ganancias de su negocio, ya que el fin de su esfuerzo es por esto, puesto  que mejores ganancias le permitirán brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos, en la que cuenten con todo lo necesario para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Yansy Marlene D. E. is 34 years old and a resident of Lourdes Colón in the department of La Libertad. Her family consists of her husband and their three dependent children, who are full-time students. Yansy manages a store where she sells perishable products and basic necessities. In addition, she prepares and sells tortillas from her home, the place where people come to buy her products.

Yansy is requesting a loan so that she can acquire a large quantity of food products such as meat, chicken, and vegetables in order to restock her store. At the same time, she plans to buy corn for making tortillas. She has plans to improve her business earnings, since that is the main reason behind all of her efforts. The income she generates allows her to provide a better life for her children and give them everything they need to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es: José Mauricio V. A. de 33 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, dos hijos y un sobrino, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y a ayudarle a José con el negocio. Él posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en las cercanía del parque central de Santa Tecla, lugar muy concurrido en el cual las ventas son muy estables, así mismo José posee un vehiculo en el que se encarga de repartir el pan con los diferentes clientes. Sus hijos y su esposa le ayudan a la elaboración del pan y a atender el negocio cuando José se encuentra afuera repartiendo el pan. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para llevar al taller su vehiculo y así mismo comprarle todos los repuestos necesarios para mantenerlo en buen estado, esto es de mucha importancia para José debido a que gracias a su vehiculo le es posible hacer las entregas de pan de una manera más rápida y segura. José es un hombre muy responsable quien trabaja arduamente para brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, es por esto que para él, mantener las ganancias estables es de mucha importancia, ya que la panadería es su única fuente de ingresos, por ello es necesario esforzarse por mejorarla día con día en su servicio.
texts.en:
José Mauricio V. A. is 33 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife, 2 children and a nephew who study in school and also help Jose with the business. He has a bakery that is located near the central park of Santa Tecla, a place that is very busy and where the sales are very stable. Jose also has a vehicle that he uses to distribute the bread to different customers. His children and his wife help him make the bread and attend to the business when Jose is out distributing the bread. He requests a loan to have the money he needs to take his vehicle to the shop and also to buy all of the spare parts needed to maintain the vehicle in good condition. This is very important for Jose, since his vehicle makes it possible to make his bread deliveries in a way that is quick and secure. Jose is a very responsible man who works hard to provide the best for his children, which is why for him, maintaining stable earnings is very important, since the bakery is his only source of income so it is necessary for him to strive to improve his service day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ana Edelmira

texts.es: Ana Edelmira S. de 42 años de edad, reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa privada, y junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales estudian. Ana es una mujer muy comprometida y trabajadora quien se interesa por el bienestar de su familia, es por ello que se esfuerza por brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y darle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo. Ella posee una venta de perfumes para hombres y mujeres, las cuales las comercializa de manera ambulante, haciendo visitas de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos, así mismo se encarga de elaborar prendas de vestir que comercializa en su propia casa. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio comprando más perfumes y telas, de manera que pueda contar con más productos para vender y materia prima para atender más pedidos de ropa.
texts.en:
Ana Edelmira S., 42, lives in Colón, La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works for a private firm, and their 3 young children, all in school. Ana is a very committed and hard-working woman who cares for the well-being of her family--this is why she is working to give a better quality of life to her children as well as helping her husband. She sells mens and womens perfumes as a street vendor, presenting her products from house to house. She also creates garments that she sells from her own home. Ana is requesting a loan that she can invest in her business, purchasing more perfumes and fabrics, so that she will have a larger inventory to sell and more raw materials to fill more clothing orders.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and fabrics for her business

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Paz Cubías D. M. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y un hijo D. 15 años D. edad, quien estudia. La señora Paz posee una venta D. ropa interior femenina, la cual comercializa en la calle Rubén Darío, uno D. los lugares con más afluencia D. personas del centro D. San Salvador. Ella cuenta con mucha clientela, así mismo muchas personas que pasan por el lugar al ver su producto se detienen a comprarle. Paz solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda tener el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, en diferentes tallas, colores y estampados, ya que una D. las principales razones por la cual las personas se acercan a su negocio es por lo llamativo D. su  producto. Para ella es D. mucha importancia el mejorar sus ventas, debido a que es por medio D. su negocio por el cual logra solventar muchos D. los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Paz Cubías D. M. is 44, and she lives in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband and her 15 year old son who goes to school. Paz has a business selling women’s underwear. She sells on Rubén Darío Street, which is one of the places with the most people in the center of San Salvador. She has a lot of customers. Many people pass by her place, and when they see her products they stop to make a purchase. Paz is asking for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of clothes in different sizes, colors, and designs. One of the main reasons people come to her business is because her product is so striking. It is very important to her to improve her sales because it is through her business that she is able to pay so many of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear

loans.name: Ana Lila

texts.es: Ana Lila R. M. de 49 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango, una de las ciudades más importantes del departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, junto a su madre y una hija. Ana posee una venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, la cual esta ubicada en el centro de San Salvador, uno de los mejores sitios para comerciantes, debido a que muchas personas transitan por este lugar. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, en varios colores estilos y tamaños, de manera que pueda ofrecer mejor calidad de prendas de vestir. Para Ana es muy importante obtener mayores ganancias debido a que es por este que tanto ella como su esposo logran solventar muchos gastos en el hogar, Ana cuenta con la ventaja que sus ganancias son diarias a diferencia de su esposo quien debe tocar puertas para obtener algún trabajo, razón por la cual ella desea mejorar su venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Ana Lila R. M. is 49 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, one of the most important cities in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and his mother and a daughter. Ana has a business selling clothing for men and women, which is located in the center of San Salvador. This is one of the best sites for trade, since many people pass through this place. She requests a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothing, in various colors, styles and sizes, so that she can offer better quality garments to her customers. For Ana it is very important to have better earnings since this will allow her to help her husband cover the household expenses. Ana has the advantage of having daily earnings, which is different from her husband, who must knock on doors to get some work, and for this reason she wants to improve her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Lilian Elsa Beatriz

texts.es: Lilian Elsa Beatriz V. A. de 23 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad en su casa de habitación, la cual tiene 3 años de poseerla. Lilian es una joven muy trabajadora quien se dedica por completo a sus dos hijas y quien a su corta edad conoce la responsabilidad de sostener a dos hijas por si misma. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar frijoles, azúcar, arroz y sodas, productos que son mucho más solicitados en la tienda y que generan mayores ganancias. Para Lilian es necesario surtir la tienda, debido a que es esta la manera en la cual podrá obtener mayores ganancias y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para sus pequeñas.
texts.en:
Lilian Elso Beatriz V. A. is 23 and lives with her two children, 5 and 2, in the Department of San Salvador. Out of necessity, she has a store selling perishables in her home. Lilian is a very hard-working young woman who dedicates herself completely to her two daughters. From her young age she has known the responsibility of supporting her children on her own. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy beans, sugar, rice and sodas; items that are more popular in her store and earn her better profit. For Lilian it is necessary to stock her store well, because this is the way she can have higher income and offer a better quality of life to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and soda

loans.name: Cecilia Jeannette

texts.es: Cecilia Jeannette M. Z. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente. Vive junto a sus dos hijas la cuales se dedican a estudiar. Cecilia es una mujer muy responsable quien ha trabajado durante muchos años por sostener a sus dos hijas quienes depende económicamente de ella. Cecilia posee un comedor  el cual esta ubicado en el mercado Municipal, lugar en el que logra muy buenas ventas, debido a que las personas de los otros puestos llegan a comer al lugar. Ella se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo elabora pupusas, café y jugos. Cecilia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar frutas y verduras, sodas y todo lo necesario para elaborar los alimentos y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de comida a sus clientes, así de esta manera poder obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales le permitan pagarle los estudios universitarios a su hija mayor. Para Cecilia brindarle estudios a sus hijas es muy importante ya que de esta manera podrá asegurarles un futuro mejor a ambas.
texts.en:
Cecilia Jeannette M. Z. is 43 years old and lives in the department of San Vicente. She lives with her 2 daughters who are students. Cecilia is a very responsible woman who has worked for many years in order to support her 2 daughters who depend on her financially. Cecilia has a food stall located in the municipal market. She is able to sell a lot because the people who work at other stands visit hers to eat. She is in charge of preparing breakfasts and lunches, and she herself makes pupusas [stuffed flatbread], coffee, and juices. Cecilia is asking for a loan that she will use to buy fruits and vegetables, sodas, and the ingredients necessary to prepare her food and offer a wider variety to her customers. This will allow her to earn more income and pay for her oldest daughter's university studies. For Cecilia, being able to provide for her daughters' education is very important since in this way, she will be able to insure a better future for both of them.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús P. P. de 25 años de edad, reside en San Antonio del Monte ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos menores de 6 años de edad. Manuel posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en  su casa de habitación. El se encarga de elaborar el pan y de repartirlo con los diferentes clientes que posee. Manuel solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y toda la materia prima necesaria al por mayor, ya que el desea poder comprar a menor precio, debido a que en la actualidad compra el producto en menores cantidades, lo cual es negativo para su negocio, ya que no obtiene muy buenas ganancias. Manuel tiene la esperanza de mejorar su negocio y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias lo cual beneficie a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús P. P. is 25 and lives in San Antonio de Monte, which is located in the department of Sonsonate. He lives with his wife and 3 children, who are all younger than 6. Manuel has a bakery that is located in his home. He is in charge of making bread and delivering it to different clients that he has. Manuel is requesting a loan that he will use to buy flour, sugar, butter, and all of the supplies he needs on a wholesale basis since he hopes to be able to buy them at a lower price. Currently he buys his supplies in smaller quantities, which is negative for his business because he doesn't make very good profits. Manuel hopes to improve his business and in this way obtain better profits that will benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and butter to make bread.

location.town: San Antonio del Monte, departamento de Sonsonate

loans.name: Abulfat

texts.en:
Abulfat H. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and their six children.

Abulfat has been breeding cattle for more than 20 years and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, especially getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets.

Abulfat keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, who, along with his wife, help him care for the animals. Abulfat needs a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy more calves to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase special fertilizer

loans.name: Alejandro Edilberto

texts.es:
el sr. Alejandro Edilberto B. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Nueva Concepcion en el departamento de Choluteca. todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender su negocio, el se dedica a la compra de ganado para destazo, compra el ganado lo mantiene por un tiempo y luego destaza las vacas para la venta de carne.
este es un buen negocio ya que la carne de res es muy vendida en choluteca. 

don Alejandro es padre de 3 hijos los que tiene estudiando en escuela y en el colegio.
Es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y a sus hijos. Tiene la ayuda de su esposa para el cuidado de sus hijos, entre los dos los han sacado adelante.
necesita el credito para comprar ganado.
texts.en:
Señor Alejandro Edilberto B. is 49 and lives in the town of Nueva Concepción in the department of Choluteca. He gets up every day at 5 a.m. to attend to his business, which is buying livestock to butcher. He buys and maintains the livestock for awhile and then butchers the cows to sell their meat. This is a good business because beef sells very well in Choluteca. Don Alejandro is the father of 3 children who are studying in primary and secondary school. He is very dedicated to his work and to his children. He has his wife's help in caring for their children. Between the two of them, they have gotten ahead. He needs this loan to buy livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Qamet

texts.en:
Qamet S. is a 39-year-old farmer who grows apples, pears and pomegranates in the small village of Agsu. He has been engaged in this business since 1986 as an additional source of income for his family.

Qamet is married and has two children who are the meaning of his life. Qamet is a veterinarian but during the last five years, raising fruit has become the main source of income for Qamet and his family. 

Qamet applied for 1,600 AZN to purchase fertilizer which he is going to order from Turkey. He counts on your help.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his fruit trees

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
el sr. Faustino L. P. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en la aldea Nueva Concepcion de la ciudad de Choluteca. Faustino es sr. bien dedicado a su trabajo, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para atender  a su clientela, vive en una zona agricultora, y la mayoria de las personas se levantan muy temprano para ir a los cultivos. Faustino  y su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante a su  familia, son padres de 4 hijos los cuales estan en la escuela.
Fautino necesita el credito para surtir su pulperia ya que en estos momentos le tiene sin mucho producto, la razon de esto es que muchas personas no estaban trabajando por el problema politico que existio en Honduras, pero ahora todo esta cambiando y desea levantar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Faustino L. P. is 50 years old. He lives in the Nueva Concepcion neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. Faustino is a man who is very dedicated to his work. He gets up at 4 in the morning to serve his customers. He lives in an agricultural region, and the majority of people get up very early to go to their fields. Faustino and his wife work hard to advance their family. They are the parents of 4 children who are in school.

Faustino needs the loan to stock his store, since at the present time there are many products he doesn't have. The reason for this is that many people are not working because of the political problem which exists in Honduras, but now everything is changing and he wants to increase his business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy beans, sugar, rice, cornmeal, flour, tortillas, bread, cookies, lard, oil, margarine, toilet paper, toothpaste, soaps, sanitary napkins,candles, matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es: Nilo tiene 47 años de edad, el un hombre trabajador y que le gusta mucho su trabajo. Su actividad económica es la venta de hot- dog, hamburguesas, sándwich y refrescos naturales, además de tener este negocio también se dedica a brindar el servicio de recargas telefónicas el tiene 3 hijos y solamente 1 está a su cargo que es la menor de 9 años. El inicia este negocio, ya que anteriormente donde laboraba lo corren por recorte de personal, es así  que se arma de valor para emprender su propia empresa. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, tomate, cebolla, pan y materia prima. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Nilo is 47 years old. He is a hard-working man who likes his work very much. His business is the sale of hot dogs, hamburgers, sandwiches, and natural drinks. In addition to this business, he also recharges telephone cards. He has 3 children, and only one is in his care, the youngest, who is 9 years old. He began this business because he was laid off at his previous job due to personnel cutbacks, and thus he plucked up his courage to begin his own business.

He is asking for this financing for working capital for the purchase of juices, soft drinks, tomatoes, onions, bread, and basic ingredients. His goal is to continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Santos Eufemia

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Eufemia E. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la aldea nueva Choluteca de la ciudad de Choluteca, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos.
Eufemia se levanta a las 5 de la mañana  a para atender a sus hijos y luego abre su negocio para empezar a atender a sus clientes. Eufemia cuenta  con su madre que tambien le ayuda en cuidar la casa y el negocio cuando tiene que salir a comprar algo del hogar o para sus hijos.
en estos momentos Eufemia tiene poco inventario en su pulperia y desea comprar mas productos para tener mas variedad y asi tener mejores ventas, todo ahorita esta mejorando y las ventas se estan incrementando.
necesita el credito para sacar adelante su negocio y su familia,.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos Eufemia E. is 33 years old. She lives in the New Choluteca neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. She is a single mother with 3 children. Eufemia gets up at 5 in the morning to take care of her children and then she opens her business to begin taking care of her customers. Eufemia relies on her mother, who also helps her take care of the house and the business when she has to go out to buy something for the house or for her children.

At this time Eufemia has little inventory in her grocery store, and she wants to buy more products in order to have more variety and thus have better sales. Everything right now is getting better and sales are increasing. She needs this loan to advance her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, beverages, juices, corn meal, tortillas, toilet paper, candles, matches, lard, oil, margarine, instant soups, condiments, salt, and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 49 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijas mayores las cuales viven con ella, la mayor, Carla,  de 32 años que trabaja y le apoya con los gastos de la casa y la menor Helen de 20 años  estudiando 4to año de Ingenieria en Sistemas en la Universidad UPONIC de Juigalpa;  doña Antonia trabaja como conserje, alquila un pequeño cuarto para vivir con sus hijas, pues gracias a un proyecto con del INVUR y la Alcaldia, logro construir su vivienda, la cual consta de un solo cuarto y una pequeña sala; espera seguir siendo  beneficiada con el fondo kiva para terminar de construir un anexo que le servirá para la cocina y un cuarto, pues con el crédito anterior logro comprar ventanas de metal y vidrio y anexar las verjas. El mayor sueño que tiene es poder culminar su casita para habitarla con sus hijas.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old, single, and has 2 grown children who live with her. The older, Carla, is 32 years old; she works and helps out with the household expenses. The younger, Helen, is 20 years old and in her 4th year of Systems Engineering studies at the UPONIC University in Juigalpa. Antonia works as a janitor, and she rents a small room to live in with her daughters. Thanks to a project with INVUR and the city, she has managed to build her own home, which consists of only one room and a small living room. She hopes to continue to benefit from Kiva to finish construction on an addition that will serve as a kitchen and an additional room. With the previous loan she was able to buy metal and glass windows, and add gates. Her main dream is to be able to finish her little house and live in it with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a kitchen and a room

loans.name: Benjamin Daniel

texts.es: Benjamín Daniel tiene 32 años,  La actividad económica es la venta de pan. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de su familia y además tenía que pagarse sus estudios por lo que tenía que buscar la manera de obtener ingresos él es un hombre que le gusta luchar y proponerse salir adelante con su actividad económica y sus planes para el futuro. Es por eso que solicita financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de pan que es la materia prima necesaria para ofrecerles a sus clientes. El sueño de él es poder finalizar sus estudios y además seguir adelante con este negocio que es el único medio de vida que posee.
texts.en:
Benjamín Daniel is 32 years old and his business is selling bread. He has been making his living from this business for more than 5 years. He started this business of his own accord because he had to take care of his family and to pay for his studies, which is the reason he had to find a way to make money. He is a man who likes to work hard and to set his mind toward getting ahead with his business and his plans for the future. For that reason he is requesting financing for working capital to purchase bread, which is the raw material he needs to offer to his customers. His dream is to be able to finalize his studies and in addition get ahead with this business, which is the only means he has of making a living.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
doña Maria Lidia A. vive en Guasaule muy cerca de la frontera con Nicaragua, su negocio es la venta de refrescos, jugos, agua, etc. este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que este lugar es muy caliente y muchas personas comprar refrescos y agua para quitarse la sed. ademas que es un lugar muy transitado ya que aqui exactamente queda la frontera Honduras-Nicaragua.
sale sola adelante con su negocio, ya que no tiene esposo.
tambien renta domitorios para los viajeros por lo que se levanta a las 6 de la mañana y se 
acuesta a las 11 de la noche. 
necesita el credito para comprar mas bebidas al por mayor ya que en ese lugar cuesta que lleguen los carros repartidores porque es un poco lejos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Lidia A. lives in Guasaule very close to the Nicaraguan border. Her business is selling soft drinks, juices, water, etc. The business generates good profits because where she lives is very hot so that lots of people buy drinks or water to quench their thirst. This is also a well-traveled area because it is just on the Honduras-Nicaragua border. She works by herself as a street vendor, since she has no husband. She also rents out rooms to travelers, so she is up at 6 in the morning and not in bed until 11 at night. She needs this loan in order to purchase more wholesale beverages, and she also has to pay shipping because it is a little far for the delivery trucks.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, juices, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Georgia Group

texts.es:
EL grupo Georgia está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Miriam del Carmen M. A. de 40 años quien desde pequeña trabaja confeccionando ropa pero es hasta1999 que logra tener su propio taller. Ella es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar por los cuales labora arduamente.

M. asegura que su negocio ha mejorado con cada  préstamo que ha tenido, ya que pudo invertir en telas para realizar sus productos. Ella sueña con tener su propia tienda donde vender sus productos.
Sus compañeras son María de los Ángeles M. Vivas quien vende fresco y Pablo Antonio Aguirre que comercializa sandalias.
texts.en:
The Georgia Group is composed of three working people. Miriam del Carmen M. A., 40, has worked at sewing clothing since she was small, but has only had her own workshop since 1999. She is the mother of three children, all in school, for whom she works hard. M.'s business has improved with each loan she has taken, by being able to purchase fabrics needed to create her products. She dreams of having her own shop where she can sell her products. Her group companions are María de los Ángeles M. Vivas, who sells soft drinks, and Pablo Antonio Aguirre who markets sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials such as fabrics, buttons, threads, applique, etc.

loans.name: Alejandro Alberto

texts.es: Alejandro Alberto, habitante del Municipio El Coral, tiene un año de trabajar como consejal de la Alcaldia del Coral Chontales, anteriormente se dedicaba a cuidar de su finca y ganado que el posee, su familia se siente orgulloso de tener un consejal ya que el se dedica a traer progreso para sus municipio  por medio de gestiones que realizan con el Alcaldia,  solicita su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, el que será invertido en mejoras de su vivienda, necesita ampliar su casa y así gozar de mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar, segun referencia este hombre es responsable con su compromiso en la comunidad, también tiene buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Alejandro Alberto, an inhabitant of El Coral, has worked for one year as councilor for the mayor's office of Coral Chontales; previously he worked on his farm with his livestock. His family is proud to have a councilor, since he works to bring progress to his town through the steps he has taken at the mayor's office. He is requesting his first loan through AFODENIC, which he will invest in improving his living situation. He needs to enlarge his house, to bring better living conditions to his home. According to references, this man is responsible to the commitments he makes in the community, and he also has good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an addition

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
doña Rosa Margarita L. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en guasaule frontera Honduras-Nicaragua. es una sra. muy activa, se dedica a la venta de carne de res por libras.
compra la carne en un destazadero y obtiene buen precio cuando la compra, pero en estos momentos no tiene mucho capital para comprar mas carne y a veces se le termina rapido el producto y se queda sin vender y pierde ganancias.
vende su producto a varios conductores de equipo pesado y tambien vende a los vecinos de guasaule.
aqui muy temprano hay movimiento de personas esto hace que todo el dia sea activo para las ventas.
necesita el credito para comprar mas carne y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para el sustento de su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Margarita L., 50, lives in Guasaule on the Honduras-Nicaragua frontier. She is very active, selling beef by the pound. She buys the meat from a slaughterhouse at a good price, but right now she does not have much capital to buy the meat. Sometimes she runs out of meat rapidly and is left with nothing to sell and profits lost. She sells her products to various heavy equipment drivers and also around the neighborhoods of Guasaule. People begin moving around very early, so she is busy all day long with her sales. She needs this loan in order to buy more meat in order to earn more profits for the sustenance of her family and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es: Bertha María G. Espinosa desde hace años vende ropa de diferentes estilos de manera ambulante y por encargo. Ella desde muy tempranas horas sale a recorrer las calles y las empresas en busca de clientela.
texts.en:
Bertha Maria Gomez Espinosa has been selling clothes of various styles for many years, both as a street vendor and by taking orders. She goes out very early in the morning to look for customers both in the streets and in local businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
la sra. Esmeralda C. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en guasaule frontera Honduras-Nicaragua, se dedica a la produccion y venta de jugos de naranja, este tipo de producto es muy vendido ya que en esa zona el clima es muy caliente y muchos viajeros le compran el jugo para refrescarse, muchos de sus clientes son conductores de transporte pesado.
Se levanta a las 4 dela mañana a vender su delicioso jugo.
Es es madre de 1 hijo, quien se lo cuida su mama durante todo el dia que sale a vender sus jugos. Esmeralda es una sra. aplicada en su negocio y bien atenta con su clientela.
 
necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de sus jugos.
texts.en:
Esmeralda C. is 31 years old and lives in Guasaule, a town on the border between Honduras and Nicaragua. She works making and selling orange juice. This type of product is commonly sold in the area because of the hot climate and because many travelers buy juice to cool off. Many of her customers are truck drivers. She gets up at 4 in the morning to sell her delicious juice. Esmeralda has one child, who is looked after by her mother during the time she goes out to sell juice. Esmeralda is very dedicated to her business and is very attentive with her customers. She needs the loan to buy more raw materials for making her juices.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase oranges, water, sugar, ice, plastic bags and straws.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anibal Antonio

texts.es: Anibal de 22 años de edad es soltero, trabaja desde hace 6 años como colector de impuestos en la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa, no tiene hijos, habita en casa de su mamá a quien le apoya con los gastos de la casa (agua, luz, alimentacion). Esta solicitando su 2do credito para realizar algunas reparaciones en la casa de su mamá cambiando el techo y poniendo perlines, pues el que tiene se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y con el invierno se mete el agua, por eso desea hacer esto antes que inicien las lluvias y de esta manera darle mayor comoidad a su mamá.  Espera poder ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para lograr realizar este pequeño proyecto, pues el asalariado solo con los creditos es que puede mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Anibal is 22 years old and unmarried. For the past six years, he's worked as a tax collector for the Juigalpa town government. He doesn't have any children. He lives with his mother and helps her by paying for the domestic expenses (water, electricity, food). He is requesting his second loan in order to do some repairs on his mother's house, replacing the roof and installing support beams, since the current roof is in bad shape and leaks during the rainy season. He wants to complete the repairs before the rains begin so his mother can be more comfortable. He hopes to receive funding from Kiva for this little project, since it is only through these loans that he is able to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof

loans.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johanna del Carmen P. O. de 31 años desde hace tiempo vende  zapatos producto que comercializa de manera ambulante. Ella asegura que desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar y buscar la manera de salir adelante.  

P. viaja continuamente a Masaya para comprar su mercadería ya que parte de sus productos son nacionales debido a que son más económicos. Pero también comercializa otros tipos de zapatos más comerciales y de marca los cuales compra en el mercado Oriental.
texts.en:
Johanna del Carmen P. O. is 31 years old and she has been selling shoes for a while as a street vendor. She affirms that from a very young age she learned to work and find ways to get ahead in life. P. travels frequently to Masaya to buy her merchandise since some of her products are national products because they are more economical. She also sells other types of shoes, more marketable with brand-names which she buys at the Oriental market.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Don Fernando de 58 años es casado, tiene 3 hijos: Lester de 30 años el cual trabaja y apoya con los gastos de la casa, Fernando de 20 años con problemas de aprendisaje que requiere cuidos especiales y Yasira es la menor de 9 añitos que estudia la primaria, su esposa Virginia no trabaja se encarga del cuido de la casa y de la familia. Don Fernando trabaja para la alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 20 años en la intendencia del mercado municipal de Juigalpa. Esta solicitando su 2do crdito para repellar con fino 4 paredes y poner el piso a 42 mts cuadrados de su casa, y si el dinero lo permite instalar 7 mts de viga.  El mayor sueño de don Fernando es poder tener una casa bonita con buenas condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is 58 years old, married and has 3 children: Lester is 30 years old, who works and helps with the household expenses; Fernando is 20 years old, with learning disabilities and requires special care; and Yasira, the youngest with 9 short years and attending elementary school. His wife Virginia does not work and is responsible for the care of the household and the family. Mr. Fernando has worked in the mayor’s office of Juigalpa for 20 years, in the administrative division for the municipal market of Juigalpa. He is soliciting his second loan to plaster 4 walls and install 42 square meters of floor in his house, and if there is enough money, also install 7 meters of beam. Mr. Fernando’s biggest dream is to have a pretty house in good condition for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster his house and install flooring

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.es:
doña Maria Alejandrina D. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de Choluteca, Maria tiene una pulperia en la cual vende varios tipos de productos, Maria es muy dedicada a su negocio y a sus hijos, tiene 3 hijos que son lo mas importante para ella en la vida.
su esposo se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a trabajar y asi ganarse la vida.
entre los dos cubren con los gastos del hogar.
Maria invertira el credito en comprar mas productos y asi tener una buena variedad para sus clientes.
Maria necesita el credito para hacer crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Alejandrina D. is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Pedro in the city of Choluteca. Maria has a small convenience store where she sells various types of products; she is very dedicated to her business and her children; she has three children who are very important in her life. Her husband gets up at 5:00 in the morning to go to work and earn his livelihood; together, they cover the household expenses. Maria will invest her loan to buy more products so she can have a good variety of products for her customers. Maria needs her loan to grow her business and get ahead in life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store: beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, cereal, soups, tissue paper, soap, candles, corn flour, tortillas, drinks, juices, salt, eggs, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sinceridad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sinceridad, inicia su segundo ciclo con 18 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. cereales, carne, tubérculos, comida, abarrotes en general, madera, medicina natural y brindar servicios D. taxi y carpintería.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Maximiliana es casada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Maximiliana junto a su esposo tienen dos carpinterías una en su casa y L. otra en un local alquilado, además venD. madera. 

Mientras que Alejandra es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Alejandra tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con L. ayuda D. su hija.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 12,150 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. madera, azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, papa, cereales, carne, medicinas.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, construir el segundo piso D. su casa, tener una empresa D. carpintería y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sinceridad” (Sincerity) begins its second loan cycle with 18 members. They engage in various businesses selling grain, meat, tubers, food, groceries, wood, and natural medicines. Others proviD. services such as carpentry and transportation by taxi.

Such is the case with Sra. Maximiliana. She 60 years old, married, and has four children. Maximiliana and her husband manage two carpentry workshops, one at home and another at a rented location. They also sell wood.

Alejandra is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. Alejandra operates her store every day with the help of her daughter.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, to 1050 soles, for a grand total of 12,150 soles for the entire Communal Bank. They will use the loans to purchase wood, sugar, rice, milk, noodles, potatoes, grain, meat, and medicines.

The members have different goals which incluD. improving their businesses, building a second floor of a house, starting a carpentry business, and providing for their children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, sugar, rice, milk, noodles, potatoes, grain, meat, and medicines

loans.name: Karin Ibeth

texts.es:
la sra. Karin A. C. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Pedro de la ciudad de Choluteca, vende tortillas desde hace varios años, se levanta a las 3:00 am para empezar a fabricar las ricas tortillas, tiene hijas que le ayudan a la produccion.
Karin compra el maiz, la cal y el papel en la ciudad de choluteca y la leña la compra en
el lugar donde vive, le a tocado trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijas.
necesita el credito para tener una mayor produccion y asi tener mejores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Sra. Karin A. C. is 37 years old and lives in the San Pedro neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. She has been selling tortillas for several years. Karin wakes up at 3am to begin making her flavorful tortillas. Her daughters help with the production.

Karin buys corn, lime, and paper in the city of Choluteca and acquires firewood from a place near where she lives. She tries to take on as much work as possible so that her daughters can get ahead. She needs a loan so that she can increase production and generate better earnings. This will allow her to cover the expenses of her household and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, lime, firewood, matches, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thelma Leonor

texts.es:
Thelma Leonor A. es una señora trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable y honrrada.  Ella llego a Adim con el deseo de mejorar y aumentar el negocio lo cual a logrado poco a poco. 

En sus inicios ella  vendía ropa usada de forma ambulante, luego puso un pequeño caramanchel donde instalo una pequeña tienda de ropa usada  la cual ha mejorado. Ella desea convertir su pequeña tienda en una megaboutique.
texts.en:
Thelma Leonor A. is a woman who is hardworking, enterprising, responsible, and honorable. She came to ADIM with the desire to improve and expand her business gradually over time.

In the beginning, Thelma sold used clothing as a street vendor. She later acquired a vending post where she opened a small used clothing store, which was an improvement. Thelma wants to convert her small store into a mega-boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Ingrid Lilibeth

texts.es:
la joven Ingrid Lilibeth S. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Juan Bosco de la ciudad de Choluteca, tiene un hijo el cual tiene 1 año de edad.
Ingrid se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para preparar sus frutas y salir a venderlas a barrios cercanos de su hogar.
su madre le cuida a su hijos cuando anda vendiendo las frutas y las verduras de forma ambulante.
las naranjas las vende peladas con sal y especias, tambien las vende sin pelar por bolsas de 10 o mas naranjas.
Ingrid necesita el credito para comprar mas frutas y asi tener mas ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para mantener a su hijo, comprarle la leche y las medicinas que necesita.
texts.en:
Ingrid Lilibeth S. is a young woman who is 23 years of age. She lives in the neighborhood of San Juan Bosco in the city of Choluteca. Ingrid has a one year old child.

She wakes up at 6am every day in order to prepare fruits to sell in the neighborhoods near her home. Her mother takes care of her children when she sells fruits and vegetables as a street vendor. The oranges she sells are peeled with salt and spices. She also sells unpeeled oranges in bags containing ten or more.

Ingrid needs a loan to buy more fruit so that she can increase her sales. Her earnings are needed to support her son, and also buy the milk and medicines that he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, tangerines, cassava, and bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Juventud está formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras  que  buscan con su esfuerzo salir adelante junto a sus familias, se han convertido en grandes amigas viven todas en la urbe cuencana, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su gente amable, sus paisajes, su centro histórico, en general es una ciudad encantadora que atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

María Arévalo tiene una linda amistad con todas las socias del  banco comunal, ella tiene  42 años  vive en unión libre con su pareja  y sus cuatro hijos de  17, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad en la comunidad Conferencias en la parroquia de Quingeo,  su hijo mayor trabaja  en cualquier actividad que  se le presente para sus gastos personales  y sus  clases de música, sus hijos menores  estudian en la escuela de Santa Ana y para llegar a allá tienen que caminar 30 minutos todos los días,  su esposo no tienen trabajo fijo y labora en lo que le ofrezcan que puede ser en la agricultura o  la construcción,  su casita es propia aunque de adobe y pequeña pero acogedora.

Ella se dedica a la cría  de vacas, cerdos,  cuyes y pollos y recuerda que el primer credito recibido lo invirtió en la compra de pollos para su criadero, con el dinero que reciba esta ocasión va a  comprar pollitos, alimento y vitaminas para su crianza para incrementar su corral de aves.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan adelante en sus estudios para que lleguen a tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nueva Juventud” (New Youth) was formed by a group of determined women who look for ways for their families to get ahead. They have become good friends since they all live in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its friendly people, its landscapes, and its historical center. In general, it is a charming city that attracts both domestic and foreign tourists.

María Arévalo has a wonderful friendship with the other members of the Communal Bank. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children (ages 17, 10, 8, and 3). They live in the community of Conferencias in the Quingeo Parish. Her oldest child works in order to pay for personal expenses and music classes. The younger children attend Santa Ana School and have to walk to classes 30 minutes every day. Her husband does not have a steady job and works in agriculture or construction whenever such opportunities are made available. María and her family own their own adobe house, which is small yet comfortable.

She raises cows, pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. María recalls that the first loan she received was used to buy chickens. With this new loan that she will receive, María will buy chicks, feed, and vitamins so that she can increase the number of birds in her coop. Her dream is for her children to succeed in their studies so that they can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Pedro Basilio

texts.es: Pedro Basilio tiene 57 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de pan. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene que salir los fines de semana para ofrecer sus productos ya que además de dedicarse a esto también labora como guardia de seguridad en un empresa, ya que los ingresos que obtiene son muy pocos, el siempre busca la manera de salir adelante con su humilde medio de vida, el tiene ciertos clientes que le compran sus productos, a él le gusta mucho interactuar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pan que es su materia prima necesaria. El sueño de Pedro es seguir con esta actividad que le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro Basilia is 57 years old and sells bread in order to make a living. He has been in this business for more than five years. Pedro sells his products on the weekends because he also works at a company as a security guard, but his wages are very low. He is always looking for ways to get ahead in life since he is of modest means. Pedro has a few customers who buy his products and enjoys interacting with them.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy bread. His dream is to continue this business since it helps to improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bread to sell

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es:
En 1990 la señora Elba del Carmen U. decidió poner un negocio ella empezó con una pequeña venta la cual actualmente es una pulpería  que se encuentra bien surtida.  Ella además fabrica escobas modernas (de plástico) y tradicionales (echas de soyate y trigo que se utilizan para barrer el patio) y  cepillos de plásticos. 

En ambos negocios le va muy bien y desea seguir así.
texts.en:
In 1990, Sra. Elba del Carmen U. decided to start a business. She opened a small grocery store that is well stocked. In addition, she manufactures plastic brooms and brushes. Elba also makes traditional brooms, with bristles made of soybean and wheat stalks, used for sweeping patios.

Both businesses are doing very well, and Elba hopes her success will continue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains & other products

loans.name: Los Autenticos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Auténticos” están representados por la señora Eva y conformado por 10 miembros los cuales tienen sus negocios establecidos en la misma zona pero con una diversificación D. negocios como la costura D. prendas D. vestir, venta D. comida al paso como empanadas con refresco y tucumanas otras se dedican a la venta D. plantas, abonos, al servicio D. jardinería y al transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del mercado comercial existe un alto nivel competitivo, pero lo que marca la diferencia es que las socias del grupo ya tienen clientes fieles y ofertan productos D. buena calidad para no quedar mal con sus clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición y mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo como llantas nuevas para sus vehículos, retapizados D. asientos y para la adquisición D. mercadería para su venta. En cuanto a la experiencia varios miembros del grupo trabajaron en grupos anteriores y se unieron para seguir trabajando bajo esta modalidad y crecer en sus negocios para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group “Los Auténticos” (The Authentic Ones) is led by Sra. Eva and consists of 10 members who have established their business in the same area. However, they are engaged in a variety of activities such as sewing garments and selling food to passersby (including empanadas and soft drinks). Others sell plants and compost or proviD. services, such as gardening and public transportation. Within the commercial markets, there is a high level of competition. What makes the difference, however, is that the group members already have loyal customers and offer high quality products so that they do not lose face with them.

This loan will be used to acquire and improve their equipment needed for work, such as new tires for their vehicles and reupholstered seats. They will also purchase merchandise to sell. Regarding their previous credit experience, several members have worked before in solidarity groups. They have joined together to continue working in this manner and growing their businesses in order to proviD. their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Suyapa vive en la ciudad de comayaguela en la Colonia Kuwait, vive desde hace seis años, Suyapa observo que en dicha zona no habian pulperias y fue asi como inicio con su negocio. 
Su pulperia cuenta con una variedad de productos que son de consumo diario como ser refrescos, arroz, frijoles, azucar, café, variedad de carnes, pollo, huevos entre otros. el egocio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada por las personas que viven ahi.  Asi mismo para recibir otros ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por Catalogo ( Avon ), los cuales le hacen pedidos todos los meses.
Suyapa es muy honesta y luchadora , esta casada y tiene dos hijos , su esposo trabaja como albañil y juntos han logrado sacar adelante su familia.

su sueño es llegar a ver sus hijos graduados de la universidad y ver crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en un mercadito.
texts.en:
Doña Suyapa lives in the city of Comayaguela in the Kuwait district. She has lived there for six years. Suyapa noticed that her neighborhood did not have any grocery stores, so she decided to start her business. Her store carries a variety of everyday consumer products such as soft drinks, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, various meats, chicken, eggs, and other items. The business is located in a busy area frequented by many of the residents. At the same time, she also sells Avon products by catalog to earn extra income. She places these orders every month.

Suyapa is an honest and strong-willed woman who is married and has two children. Her husband works as a mason and together they have managed to move their family forward. Her dream is to see her children graduate from university and expand her business into a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Flor es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Flor tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas al por mayor y menor, para lo cual tiene 2 personas que le apoyan. Además Flor vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Flor necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza y cosméticos.
Flor sueña con construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccatarisum”, which means “Let’s Rise” in Quecha. She is 34 years old, single, and has two children. Flor has a store in her home where she sells beverages wholesale and retail. She has two people who assist her. In addition, Flor sells cosmetics from catalogs.

She needs a loan of 3000 soles in order to buy beer and cosmetics. Flor dreams of building a house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & cosmetics

loans.name: Ismi

texts.en:
Ismi I. is a 39-year-old poultry breeder who lives in the small village of Agsu. He is married and has three children.

Ismi started his business in 2003 with five turkeys but, step by step, he gained clients, mainly restaurant owners, and now the demand for turkey has increased by five times.

Now, Ismi requests 960 AZN to purchase more turkeys, to build a small place to keep them, and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase more turkeys, fodder, and to build a shed

loans.name: Luz Del Camino Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Luz del Camino” esta representado por la señora Rosa Rosmery  y conformado por 11 integrantes muy trabajadores, una gran parte D. los miembros son casados y con familias integradas en un promedio D. 3 miembros, son gente humilD. D. procedencia rural pero con grandes expectativas D. crecimiento como lo demuestran en sus puestos D. venta D. comida, edredones y ropa para cama, venta D. cosméticos, abarrotes, huevos, aceites, artículos para el hogar y electrodomésticos. 

Rosa Rosmery se dedica a la venta D. cobertores desD. hace 5 años, Celia Lourdes se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. hogar desD. hace 10 años atrás, Juana venD. D. edredones y tiene experiencia D. 3 años en el rubro, Salome Maria venD. comida desD. hace 1 años atrás, Frida Roxana atienD. una tienda D. ferretería desD. hace 2 años atrás Nancy Patricia se dedica a la atención D. fotocopiadora desD. hace 2 años atrás, Claudia Daniela venD. cosméticos recientemente desD. hace 1 año. Heidy Nadir atienD. su tienda D. abarrotes desD. hace 6años atrás, Zaida Emilia se dedica a la venta D. ropa para damas tiene experiencia D. 3 años, Leonor Maria atienD. su pensión donD. ofrece una variedad D. platos desD. hace 3 años, G. Rosario se dedica a la venta D. huevos y aceite tiene una experiencia D. 1 año. En su mayoría las socias D. este banco comunal se dan modos para poder luchar contra la competencia, ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus hogares. 

El destino del crédito es para incremento del capital D. sus negocios para poder invertir en la adquisición D. mercadería y materia prima para seguir creciendo y generar un mayor ingreso que permita darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida con un hogar estable y una buena educación para sus hijos. La mayoría D. los miembros del grupo ya conoce la modalidad D. grupos solidaR. gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones pero están felices D. poder trabajar con la Fundación Agrocapital que les brinda su apoyo económico y sobre todo confianza en su trabajo y en su desempeño.
texts.en:
The "Luz del Camino" ["Light in the Path"] Communal Bank is represented by Ms. Rosa Rosmery and maD. of 11 members, all very hardowrking. A big part of the members are married and have families composed, in the main, of 3 members. These are humble people of rural origins but with great expectations of growth, as they show in their stalls selling food, blankets and white linen, cosmetics, general supplies, eggs, oil, household articles and elctric household appliances. Rosa Rosmery has been selling bedcovers for the past 5 years, while Celia Lourdes has been selling household items for 10 years. Juana has been selling comforters for 3 years, Salome Maria has been selling meals for the past year, Frida Roxana has been running a hardware store for two years, Nancy Patricia has been working at a copy shop for the past 3 years, Claudia Daniela began selling cosmetics a year ago, Heidy Nadir has had her grocery store for the past 6 years, Zaida Emilia has been selling women's clothing for 3 years, Leonor Maria has been selling lunches for the past 3 years, and G. Rosario has been selling oil and eggs for the past year. Most of the members work hard to surpass the competitors because their homes' support depends upon it. The loan will be destined to increase the working capital in their businesses and invest in the purchase of raw material and merchandise to continue growing and generate a better profit that will enable them to offer their families a better quality of life, a stable home and a good education for their children. Most of the members already knew this modality of loans through Communal Banks thanks to similar loans with other microfinance institutions but they are happy to work with Fundación Agrocapital, which offers them its economic support and, more importantly, trusts in their work and performance.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Lucia es soltera, tiene 29 años y vive con su mama, Contadora de profesión y trabaja en una institución, Lucia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche.
Los sueños de Lucia son comprar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucía is a member of the Communal Bank "Ccatarisum" which means "Let's rise" in quechua. e Lucía is single, she is 29 years old and lives with her mother, an accountant by trade, who works in an institution. Lucía owns a general store where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat... She performs this activity with the help of her mother. Lucía needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk. Lucía's dreams are to buy her own home and increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo vive en la Colonia Venecia desde hace veinte años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un lugar muy transitado por los vecinos, cuenta con una variedad de productos de consumo diario como ser huevos, leche, arroz, manteca azucar, café entre otros, asi mismo se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo ( AVON ), las cuales tambien prefieren sus clientas, doña Consuelo es una mujer
muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta. Esta casada y su esposo se dedica tambien al comercio, forman una bonita familia con tres hijos los cuales han luchado para que tengan una buena educacion. Necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia avon al por mayor y conseguir precios mas bajos y con esto obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Consuelo has lived in the Colonia Venecia neighborhood for twenty years. Her business is located in a place where many neighbors pass by regularly. She offers a variety of everyday products such as eggs, milk, rice, shortening, sugar and coffee, among others. In addition, she sells Avon products by catalog, which are also popular among her customers. Consuelo is a very hard-working, responsible and honest woman. She is married, and her husband also works in the business. They have three children, forming a beautiful family, and they have struggled to provide a good education for their children. Consuelo needs a loan to purchase more wholesale Avon merchandise, so that she can pay lower prices and thus receive more income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing creams, lotions, perfumes, deodorants, makeup, nail polish, and polish remover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Delia es soltera, tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres, Delia tiene una imprenta e Internet que esta ubicado en el centro D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con L. ayuda D. 2 personas, además Delia venD. accesorios D. computadora a pedido.
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papeles.
Delia sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Communal Bank "Ccatarisum", which means "Let's rise" in Quechua. Delia is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has a business offering printing and internet services that is located in downtown Ayacucho, in a rented space. She manages this business with the help of 2 other people, and also sells computer accessories on order. Delia needs a loan of 2500 Peruvian Soles, which she will invest in the purchase of paper supplies. Her dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper supplies.

loans.name: Candela Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "Candela" esta representado por la señora Yovana y conformada por 12 amigas, socias muy unidas y activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades crediticias para confraternizar y así unirse mas como grupo. Yovana que es la presidenta se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos desD. hace 3 años atrás, Cristina venD. en una pulpería la misma que atienD. desD. hace 20 años atrás, Marleny se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y tiene una experiencia D. 3 años en este rubro, Isabel venD. sodas D. manera ambulante desD. hace 1 años atrás, Martha es tramitadora realiza diferentes tipos D. papeleos desD. hace 10 años atrás, Martha venD. masetas desD. hace 2 años, Elena atienD. en su punto internet desD. hace un año en el mismo lugar también ofrece servicios D. llamadas nacionales e internacionales, Patricia venD. D. ropa desD. hace 4 años, Elizabeth es promotora cosméticos desD. hace 10 años atrás, Carmen venD. ropa interior y tiene una experiencia D. 1 año, Dory venD. salteñas y atienD. su negocio desD. hace 20 años atrás, Adela atienD. su venta/pulpería y tiene experiencia en este negocio desD. hace 15 años atrás. Todas desarrollan sus  actividades en su propio domicilio y como ambulantes. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia D. las mismas, en caso D. que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar como ferias y mercados vecinales D. forma que puedan cumplir con sus obligaciones y con sus familias. El crédito esta destinado a surtir sus tiendas con la compra D. mercadería, material D. trabajo y la compra D. insumos en mayor cantidad para poder generar mejores ingresos que permitan darles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cumpliendo un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para mejorar más sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Candela Communal Bank is represented by Yovana and is comprised of 12 friends. The members are very united and active entrepreneurs who want to carry out credit activities to develop camaraderie and unite more as a group. Yovana is the group president, and has been selling cosmetics for the past 3 years, Cristina has been working at a paper supply store for the past 20 years, Marleny has 3 years of experience selling cosmetics, Isabel has been selling soda on the street for the past year, Martha has been selling pots for plans for the past 2 years, Elena has been working at an internet cafe that offeres local and international phone calls for the past year, Patricia has been selling clothing for the past 4 years, Elizabeth has been selling cosmetics for the past 10 years, Carmen has been selling underwear for the past year, Dory has been selling salteñas (Bolivian meat pastries) and running her business for the past 20 years, and Adela has been running her paper supply store for the past 15 years. Some do their activities in their own homes, while others are traveling merchants. As far as competition goes, we can mention that their competitors are present in the neighborhood. The members have their loyal customers who constantly generate the economic movement that is necessary to support themselves. In case it is not going well in the neighborhood, they go to other locations like fairs and neighborhood markets so they can meet their own obligations and those of their families. The loan is to stock their stores buy purchasing merchandise, work material, and supplies in greater quantities. Then they will be able to generate better earnings that will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. As far as experience goes, the members are completing their second cycle. They demonstrate responsibility, honesty, and the desire to get ahead to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Edith es soltera, tiene 23 años, Edith se dedica a la compra de palta de la ciudad de Pampas y los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Lima y de allá compra frutas que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de paltas.
El sueño de Edith son tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the “Ccatarisun” (which means “Let’s raise ourselves up” in Quechua) Communal Bank. She is 23 and single. She buys avocadoes in the city of Pampas and sells them in the wholesale food market in the city of Lima. In Lima she buys fruits that she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Edith needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy avocadoes. Edith’s dream is to have a stable store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy avacadoes

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés, es una mujer muy responsable, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 23 años, es madre de un niño (menor de edad), ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y a la venta de pescado, esta última actividad la realiza en el mercado Bellavista y la primera en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica al oficio de albañil. Inés forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de pescado.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de pollos bebes, y también alimentos balanceados para su adecuada crianza y posterior venta. La meta de Inés es tener galpones para criar más pollos y tener mayor ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Inés is a very responsible 23-year-old woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is the mother of one child (a minor) and she works in the business of raising chickens and selling fish. She performs the latter activity in the Bellavista market and the former in her own home. She relies on the support of her husband, who works as a bricklayer. Inés has been a member of the “Manos Maravillosas” Communal Bank for eight months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which was invested in the purchase of fish. Now, she needs a loan of 500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of baby chicks as well as balanced food to ensure their adequate growth and later sale. Inés' goal is to have coops to breed more chickens and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy chicks and balanced food to help them grow.

loans.name: Cañaverales Group

texts.es:
El banco  comunal "Cañaverales" esta representado por la señora Lilia y conformado por 12 miembros que van cursando su primer ciclo con la institución, ellas se conocieron antas como grupo ya que hace dos años participaron en un grupo anterior.;  hay una confianza notoria entre ellas y son alegres y divertidas las señoras tienen muchas expectativas para el futuro. 

Lilia que es la presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta de chocolate tiene una experiencia de 7 años en este rubro, Julia esta en el rubro de comercialización de empanadas desde hace 1 año atrás, Flavia se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 1 año atrás, Angélica Faviola se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 1 años atrás, Eloisa es promotora de Cosméticos desde hace 1 años atrás, Laura se dedica a la venta de gelatinas desde hace 3 años atrás, Ana Liz vende pollo y tiene una experiencia en el rubro de 5 años, Maria Luisa vende empanadas recién desde hace 1 año, Hebelia se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 1 año atrás, Marioly vende ropa también recién desde hace un año, Ruben Dario es eléctrico automotriz desde hace 1 años atrás, Raul ofrece servicios de amplificación desde hace  1 año atrás. Como se puede ver básicamente la mayoría del grupo recién desarrolla sus actividades. Todas se dedican muy conscientemente a sus negocios y saben lo importante que es  tratar bien a los clientes para que vuelvan, es la forma de combatir a la competencia que siempre esta presente. 

El destino del financiamiento es el incremento de sus capital de trabajo para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos ya que una mayoría de las socias son madres de familia y desean darles una educación profesional a sus  hijos para que tengan una mejor futuro y mas expectativas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Cañaverales Communal Bank is represented by Lilia and comprised of 12 members. They are in their first cycle with the institution. They have already known each other as a group because two years ago they participated in a previous group. The trust they have in each other is evident. They are happy and fun women who have a lot of expectations for the future. Lilia is the group president and has 7 years of experience selling chocolate, Julia has been selling empanadas (meat/cheese pastries) for the past year, Flavia has been selling clothing for the past year, Eloisa has been selling cosmetics for the past year, Laura has been selling gelatin desserts for the past 3 years, Ana Liz sells chicken and has 5 years of experience, Maria Luisa began selling empanadas a year ago, Hebelia has been selling meals for a year, Marioly has been selling clothing for the past year, Ruben Dario has been working as an automotive electrician for the past year, Raul has been offering a sound system service for the past year. As you can see, most of the group members' businesses are relatively new. All of them conscientiously devote themselves to their businesses. They know how important it is to treat the customers well so that they return. It is a way of combating the competition that is always present. The loan is to increase their work capital to buy merchandise, supplies, and work tools that will help them improve their earnings. Most of the members are mothers who want to give their children an education to become professionals. They want their children to have a better future and more prospects for a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.es:
Zosimo es socio del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Zosimo es conviviente, tiene 53 años y 6 hijos, Zosimo es artesano y realiza trabajos de orfebrería de acuerdo a los pedidos que tenga, además vende leña y comida en su casa, actividad que realiza junto a su esposa.
Zosimo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Zosimo son ampliar sus negocios, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Zosimo is a member of the Communal Bank “Ccatarisum”, which means “Let’s rise” in Quechua. Zosimo is 53 years old, lives with his common-law wife, and has 6 children. Zosimo is a craftsman who works with precious metals, creating custom items on order. He also sells firewood and food out of his house, and in this business he works alongside his wife. Zosimo needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles, which he will invest in the purchase of firewood, rice, and sugar. Zosimo's dreams are to expand his businesses and to have his children go to school and have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Luci Magdalena

texts.es:
Luci vive en la Colonia Las Torres en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, tiene seis años de vivir en ese lugar, es una mujer muy joven tiene veinte años de edad, su negocio es la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, tiene 3 años de vender tortillas, gracias a su actividad ha logrado graduarse del colegio, vive con su mama, es soltera, necesita el credito para poder comprar la materia prima al por mayor y asi poder obtener precios bajos en harina de maiz, leña, cal.
Luci vende a sus vecinos todos los dias de la semana desde las 6:00 Am. 
hasta las 5:00 Pm. Sus clientes son todos sus vecinos. 
Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Luci lives in the Las Torres Colonia in the city of Tegucigalpa. She has lived there for six years. She is a very young woman; she is 20. Her business is making and selling tortillas. She has been selling tortillas for three years. Thanks to this activity, she was able to graduate from school. She is single, and she lives with her mother. She needs the loan to be able to buy raw materials wholesale. That way she will be able to get corn flour, firewood, and quicklime at lower prices.
