loans.use: Purchase of construction material for her house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, es una mujer muy responsable, vive en el distrito D. Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre D. tres hijos, dos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y prendas D. vestir, ambas actividades la realiza en su casa, no cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo. Gloria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas”, desD. hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que fue invertido en la venta D. productos D. belleza, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 3000 soles que será invertido en la compra D. ropa. La meta D. Gloria es tener una boutique y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very responsible woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali province; she is 44 years old and mother of three children, two of whom are adults. She sells beauty products and clothing out of her home. Unfortunately, she does not have much support from her husband. Gloria has been part of the "Marvelous Hands" village bank for 5 years; she initially received a $100 loan which she used to purchase beauty products; now she needs a $1050 loan to purchase clothing. Gloria would like to eventually have a boutique and have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Andrea vive en colonia Rio Rama , todos los dias tiene que viajar en bus hacia su centro de trabajo en la Alcaldia del Coral, tiene un año de laborar como asistente de cartas de venta, tiene 3 hijos los cuales lestan estudiando ya que quiere que sean personas de bien, su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra en la Alcadia del Coral. Ella requiere este credito para construir la cocina mas grande ya es muy pequeña , ya que gracias a los credito que ella ha obtenido en otras instancias ha mejorado su vivienda y solicita este credito en AFODENIC porque el interes es muy bajo y accesible a personas de escasos recursos esconomicos, doña Andrea es  muy alegre, responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy servicial con la personas que lo necesitan y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Andrea lives in the Rio Rama neighborhood. Every day she has to take a bus to her workplace in the town of Coral. For the past year, she has worked as an assistant in an advertising company. She has three children, who are in school, since Andrea wants them to have a good foundation in life. Her husband works as a construction supervisor in the town of Coral. Andrea needs this loan to expand her kitchen, since it is very small. Thanks to the loans she has obtained on other occasions, she has been able to improve her home, and she is requesting this loan from AFODENIC because the interest rate is very low and affordable for people with few economic resources. Andrea is a very cheerful, responsible, honest and hard-working person, very helpful to people in need, and with a strong desire to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her kitchen

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León, la señora María R. se ha dedicado a atender su propia pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos comestibles tales como pan dulce, pan simple, galletas, golosinas, entre otros. Tambien vende huevos y refrescos en polvo listos para preparar. Sus productos los oferta en sus estantes y en su vitrina exhibiéndolos.
Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir a lo inmediato en los productos para la pulpería y por tal motivo es que solicita un crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, pan, entre otros para continuar comercializándolos y así obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
In the city of Telica and department of León, Sra. María R. manages her own store where she offers all types of edible products such as sweet bread, plain bread, cookies, candy, and other items. She also sells eggs and powdered drinks that are ready to prepare. Her products are arranged on the shelves and placed in a display case for viewing.

She has found it necessary to acquire more products for her store. For this reason, María is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, bread, and other products so that she can continue generating sales and obtain the income needed to maintain her modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa del Carmen S.  G. 58 años  empezó vendiendo helados de coco, nancite, de leche, de maní, de mamón etc. con el tiempo logro invertir  en cosméticos, ropa y otros productos los cuales vende por encargo.

S. es un ejemplo de que la perseverancia y el trabajo arduo tienen sus recompensas. Ella desea seguir trabajando y mejorando el negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen S. G. is 58 years old and started selling various flavors of ice cream including coconut, “nancite” (a native fruit), milk, peanut, and papaya. Over time, she began investing in cosmetics, clothing, and other products that she sold by request.

Teresa is an example that demonstrates that perseverance and hard work have their rewards. She wants to continue working and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & clothing to sell

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es: Doña Delia tiene un año de laborar como promotora social en la Alcaldia del Coral  tiene un hijo de 3 añitos de edad, su esposo trabaja como comerciante de ganado, el cual ayuda a sus esposa con los gastos basicos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos. Con este credito pretende realizar algunas mejoras de la casa comprando 3 ventanas y si el dinero lo permite repellar una pared, doña Delia es una mujer muy popular ya que el trabajo que realiza es atender a ñinos y adolecentes que necesitan ayuda y tambien para impartirles charlas, su sueño es seguir estudiando, que su hijo tenga lo basico y que su familia permanesca unida.
texts.en:
Doña Delia has been working for a year as a social coordinator for the city of El Coral. She has a three year old son. Her husband works as a cattle trader. Delia helps her husband with their basic household expenses and financial commitments. With this loan, she intends to make a few improvements to her home. She will buy three windows and, if there is money left over, plaster a wall. Doña Delia is a very popular woman since her work involves looking after children and teenagers who need assistance. She also conducts training classes. Her dream is to continue her education, provide her son with the basics, and keep her family close.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase windows & plaster a wall

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yessenia, es una mujer muy dinámica, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, esta actividad la realiza en su casa. Yessenia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Doncellas”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de dulces para vender.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza.	La meta de Yessenia es llegar  a tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Yessenia is a very dynamic woman who lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 20 years old and single; she sells beauty products out of her home. Yessenia has been part of the "The Maidens" village bank for the past year. Her first loan was for $100 and she used it to buy candies and sweets to sell. Now she needs $300 which she will invest in the purchase of additional beauty products. Yessenia would like to have a well-stocked grocery store someday.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of beauty products

loans.name: Elizabeth  Cristina

texts.es: La Joven Elizabeth Cristina  tiene 4 años de laborar como docente de primaria en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera, tiene una bebe  de 18 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja como sub director de la misma escuela en la que ella labora,  esta pequeña familia trabajan arduamente para poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda es por esta razon que estan solicitando el credito para repellar la pared de una habitacion y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que son personas asalariadas que no dependen de mas ingresos, son una familia muy unida comparten con todos los gastos familiares y sus compromisos adquiridos, son una familia muy humilde,  muy responsable, honestas y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Cristina has been working the past four years as an elementary school teacher at the Rafaela Herrera School. She has an 18 month old baby. Her husband works as the assistant director at the same school where she teaches. This young family works hard to gradually improve their home. For this reason, Elizabeth is requesting a loan to plaster a wall in her house and improve her living conditions. She and her husband are salaried workers who do not generate any other income. They are a close family and share all the family expenditures and commitments. Elizabeth is a very humble, responsible, honest, and hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster a wall in her home

loans.name: Harvin Jose

texts.es: Harvin trabaja desde hace un año como tecnico de La Alcaldia del Municipio el Coral,  el vive con sus ancianos padres el cual ayuda  a su familia con los gastos  basicos del hogar. Con este crèdito pretende comprar materiales de construcciòn para repellar dos paredes ya que no ajusta comprarlo con el salario ya es muy poco, es por esta razon es que esta solicitando este crèdito a la Instituciòn de AFODENIC, su mayor sueño es seguir estudiando, tener un trabajo digno que alcance para sobrevivir y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Harvin has worked for a year as a technician at City Hall for the City of El Coral. He lives with his elderly parents and helps them with basic household expenses. This loan will be used to buy building materials so that he can apply stucco to two walls. Harvin is not able to purchase these items because he earns very little money. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from AFODENIC.

His greatest dream is to continue his education so that he can have a decent job, earn enough money to survive, and gradually make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to stucco two walls

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es: El negocio de las señora Rosario de Fátima R. B. consiste en mercadería por encargo ella vende desde ropa, joyas, adornos, zapatos  entre otros productos. Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad  de productos que los clientes demandan e invertir en nuevos rubros.
texts.en:
The business of Sra. Rosario de Fátima R. B. consists of selling commissioned merchandise such as clothing, jewelry, ornaments, shoes, and other products. She will use this loan to buy more products so that she can meet her customers’ demands and invest in new items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as clothing, jewelry, ornaments, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Hermenegildo Josiel

texts.es: Hermenegildo tiene un año de laborar com tecnico de Catastro en la Alcaldia del Coral, el vive con sus padres ya todavia no ha formado su propio hogar el es un hijo muy responsable con sus padres el cual lo ayuda con sus gastos familiares del hogar,  está solicitando su primer crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda y realizar compra de material, él requiere hacer un repello de la pared de su casa,   él es un hombre con alto espitud de superación, es un hombre responsable en su labores que desarrolla su sueño  es de mejorar sus condiciones del hogar  y obtener mejor desarrollo en la comunidad, tiene capacidad y voluntada de pago.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo has been working for a year as a survey technician for the city of El Coral. He lives with his parents because he still has not established his own household. Hermenegildo is a responsible son to his parents and helps with his family’s living expenses.

He is requesting a home improvement loan in order to buy materials to plaster a wall in his house. Hermenegildo is man of high spirits who looks to improve himself. In addition, he is responsible in the work that he does. His dream is to improve his living conditions and continue developing in the community. He is willing and has the capacity to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to plaster a wall

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: Jose David tiene un año de laborar como tecnico operador de la Alcaldia del Coral, recientemente acaba de contraer matriminio, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar a pesar que no tienen hijos ellos siempre estan al pendiente de sus padres, este  crédito lo requiere para  invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construir los servicios Higienicos), se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable, servicial, honesto y muy trabajador es un hombre con alto espiritud de superación personal y laboral, que ama su trabajo, su sueño es tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  bonita.
texts.en:
Jose David has been working for a year as a technical operator for the city of El Coral. He recently got married and his wife is in charge of the household chores. Even though they do not have children, they have always been inclined to become parents. This loan will be used to pay for a home improvement (construction of a lavatory). Jose David is known as a responsible, helpful, honest, and hardworking man who is always in high spirits and looks to improve personally and professionally. He enjoys his work and dreams of having stability, health, and a beautiful home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a lavatory

loans.name: Leidis Mariela

texts.es: La joven Leidis labora como administradora  de la alcaldia el coral desde hace un año, tiene un  bebe de 2 añitos de edad, a pesar que ella  vive con sus padres el padre del niño le pasa una pensiòn alimenticia para el niño, la abuelita del bebe cuida del niño cuando ella esta trabajando ya que son una familia bien unida. Con este credito pretende  hecharle el piso a  a la hibitaciòn ya que es de tierra para tener  mejor comodidad para ella y su hijo, su sueño es seguir estudiando para ser en el futro una excelente profesional y que su familia tenga mucha salud.
texts.en:
Leidis has been working for one year as an administrative assistant for the city of El Coral. She has a two year old baby. Even though she lives with her parents, the child’s father provides financial support. The child’s grandmother takes care of him while Leidis is working since her family is very close.

With this loan, she will install a floor in her house since she already has the land on which she and her son can live comfortably. Her dreams are to continue her education so that she will have a bright professional future and for her family to have good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a floor in her home

loans.name: Roberto Etanislado

texts.es: Don Roberto tiene un año de laborar como guarda de seguridad de la Alcaldia de el Coral Chontales,  tiene tre hijos que dependen economicamente de el, todos estudian en colegio de ese municipio, es   habitante del Barrio Nueva Jerusalen, su esposa se encarga de l cuido de sus hijos y de los quehaceres de hogar, en sus dias libre trabaja como agricultor, es un hombre bien trabajador que ha luchado para que sus hijos no les falte nada. Este crédito que esta solicitando a la institución de AFODENIC para invertirlo en construccion de los servicios higienicos, de esta forma tener mejores  de higiene  y asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia .su sueño es seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus familia y de su casa.
texts.en:
Don Roberto has been working for a year as a security guard for the City of El Coral Chontales. He has three dependent children who all attend the municipal high school. Roberto is a resident of the “Nueva Jerusalen” (New Jerusalem) neighborhood. His wife looks after children and takes care of the household chores during her days off as a farm laborer.

Don Roberto is known as a hard worker who fights for his children so that they lack nothing. With the loan requested from AFODENIC, he will purchase construction materials needed to install a lavatory so that his family can experience improved hygiene and better living conditions. His dream is to continue making these types of improvements for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to install a lavatory

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna Maria tiene 12 meses de laborar para la Alcaldia de  coral Chontales como responsable de Emacol. Ella todavia no se ha casado, no tiene hijos vive con sus padres la cual los apoya con  gastos basicos del hogar, tambien cuando sus padres se encuentran enfermos ella cuida de ellos ya que son una familia bien unida. Esta  solicitando su primer credito a la intitución de AFODENIC,  el cual lo requiere para  construir una habitacion de concreto para asi tener privacidad,   es una mujer trabajadora , responsable con buenas relaciones en  el municipio.
texts.en:
Reyna Maria has worked for 12 months for la Alcaldia de Coral Chontales, responsible for Emacol. She hasn't married yet, and doesn't have children, and lives with her parents whom she supports with basic household costs. Also, when her parents get sick, she looks after them as they are a very united family. She is seeking her first loan from the institution AFODENIC, which is required to construct a concrete room so she can have privacy. She is a very hard-working woman, responsible, and has good relationships with others in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Argentina Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora  Argentina del Rosario Pérez  G., Labora como  Analista de Recursos Laborales en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de  materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines para terminar de cambiar el techo de su casa.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Argentina    dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Argentina del Rosario Pérez G. works as a Labour Resource Analyst in the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua Institute. She has 2 children in her care, both school-age, and is married. She has had loans with CEPRODEL for 4 years. In this period of time she has invested the 4 loans in the improvement of her house, thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL. The loan sought is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc and parts to finish changing the roof on her house, with the objective of giving her children more security and a better standard of living. Argentina said thank you for the loans bestowed by Ceprodel that have arrived, improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Lucerito De Jose Galvez Group

texts.es:
Lucerito D. José Galvez

Siguen trabajando muy duro los diez integrantes D. esta alcancía comunal Lucerito D. José Galvez, en esta oportunidad conoceremos un poco más a este grupo. Yulissa y Bárbara nos cuentan sus experiencias como microempresarias.
Yulissa es una mujer D. 30 años, el trabajar día a día como vendedora D. panes, kekes donas, galletas ha sido difícil ya que las ganancias que dejaba estas ventas eran pocas, pues la mayoría D. sus productos lo fiaba y las personas se demoraban en pagarle, lo que la impulsó a optar en preparar platos ceviche y chicha morada en una esquina cerca a su casa algo que lo hace muy bien trayendo consigo ganancias que no pensaba alcanzar, esto se debe además D. su sazón la no competencia cerca a su zona. Actualmente trabaja en una carreta que compró con los préstamos que recibió además renovó sus utensilios, baldes, ollas, y compró una vitrina, Piensa mejorar aún más su negocio pues tiene en mente terminar D. comprar un kiosco móvil D. segunda para mejor comodidad D. ella y a sus clientes, para ello requiere el préstamo quiere refaccionarlo, pintarlo darle algunos arreglos. Sus ganancias que obtiene son para apoyar a su pareja en la crianza a sus hijos menores D. edad, pues el sueño D. ella es brindarle lo mejor D. acuerdo a sus posibilidades.

Bárbara a sus 57 años trabaja muy contenta vendiendo anticuchos y picarones en un parque, con este negocio le fue posible darle educación escolar y mantener a sus dos hijos. El vender D. esta manera lo hizo porque quedó viuda y hasta ese entonces no tenía la necesidad D. trabajar. Antes del negocio D. anticuchos estuvo vendiendo útiles escolares pero no resultó. Decidió ayudar a su mamá en el negocio D. la venta D. anticuchos, que es un plato típico peruano, el crédito será para la compra D. insumos insumos como: corazón D. res, especierías, rachi, choncholí, pancita, palitos. Su último hijo estudia técnico en farmacia, es su hermano D. Bárbara quien lo ayuda en sus estudios porque las ganancias que obtiene ella es para la alimentación y gastos D. la casa.
texts.en:
Jose Galvez Shining Star The 10 members of the Jose Galvez Shining Star village bank continue to work very hard. Now, let's get to know this group a little better. Yulissa and Barbara will share their stories as small businessmen. Yulissa is 30 years old; working everyday seling bread, cakes, and cookies was difficult since she didn't earn much money. She sold many of her goods on credit and her customers took a while to pay her. These difficulties motivated her to change professions and to sell ceviche and chica morada (a local drink) on the corner by her home; this has gone much better for her and she has earned more than she initially thought she would thanks to her good cooking and the fact that there is little competition where she sells. Currently, she works from a cart that she purchased with loans; she was also able to purchase new utensils, buckets, pots and a display case. She would like to continue to improve her business by purchasing a mobile kiosk to more easily serve her customers. She needs a loan to buy it, fix it up, and paint it. Her earnings help to pay the costs of raising her children as she would like to proviD. for them the best she can. Barabara is 57 years old and sells anticuchos (cow heart kebabs) and picarones (fried pork) in a local park. She has been able to pay for the education of her two children through her business. She was forced to work when her husband passed away; before that, she had no need to work. Before she started selling anitcuchos, she sold school supplies but she didn't make much money. She decided to help her mother selling anticuchos (a Peruvian delicacy). She will use the loan to buy ingredients like: cow hearts, spices, cow stomach, skewers, etc. Her youngest son is studying to be a pharmacist; Barbara's brother supports him in his studies because her earnings are only enough to cover his food and their home expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Angela Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Angela Isabel López  labora arduamente en un Instituto en Managua, ella tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y  dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera y ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido seis créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado actualmente es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento y arena, para la construcción de  un muro en la parte trasera del patio de su casa.

Ella realiza dicho crédito con el objetivo de brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan porque dependen de ella.
texts.en:
Señora Ángela Isabel López B. works as the Registry and Certification Assitant at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua Institute. She has 3 children in her care, 2 of them school-age. She is a single mother and has worked with loans from Ceprodel for 6 years. In this time she has invested 6 loans in the improvement of her house, thanks to the loans granted by Ceprodel. The loan she is seeking is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as stone, cemente and sand, for the construction of a wall at the back of her patio, with the objective of giving her children more security and better living conditions. Ángela said thank you for the Ceprodel loans, that have allowed her to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Nelsa Dith's Group

texts.en:
Nelsa Dith E. is from the village of Minsubong in Tangub City. She is 32 years old. Nelsa Dith is the leader of a 4-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nelsa Dith is single. To make a living, Nelsa Dith sells "uling" (charcoal) in the local community. Nelsa Dith has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nelsa Dith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Nelsa Dith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Nelsa Dith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to buy more charcoal to sell. This will be Nelsa Dith's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys del Socorro G., Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y  este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento y arena, para la construcción de un un muro en la parte delantera de su vivienda. 

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Gladys dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys del Socorro G. works as the caretaker at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua Institute. She is married and has one child in her care, who is of school-age. She has worked with Ceprodel loans for 3 years, and during this time has invested the 3 loans granted by Ceprodel in the improvement of her house. The loan she is seeking is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as stone, cement and sand, for the construction of a wall at the front part of her house - with the objective of giving more security and a better standard of living to her children. Gladys said thank you for the loans granted by Ceprodel, that have allowed her to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan M. se ha destacado por tener su propia pulpería en su casa de habitacion en Masaya. Actualmente solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para la pulpería con el fin de mejorar el negocio y tenerlo mas surtido ya que sus clientes le demandan más productos y así debe de tener un mejor servicio.
El señor Juan tiene dos años de tener la pulpería y ha salido adelante gracias a él y al apoyo de su esposa la cual tienen de casados siete años y esperan pronto tener un bebé. El crédito le beneficiará mucho porque logrará comprar los productos para la pulpería y así ofertarlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Juan M. has a juice bar in his house. He will use this loan to improve his business and have more stock, now that his customers demand more products, and in this way provide a better service. Juan has had the business for nearly 2 years, and has had 2 loans from Ceprodel. He attends to the business with his wife, whom he has been married to for 7 years. During this time they haven't been able to have the baby that they both long for. They say that the loans have benefitted them greatly, as they can now create savings to put towards a treatment to be able to have the baby they so greatly desire.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, beans, toilet paper and soft drinks

loans.name: Lisbeth Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora  Lisbeth Carolina P. Rodríguez, Labora como Analista de Recursos Laborales en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y  dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido uns créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de  materiales de construcción como: cemento y arena para terminar de embaldosar la casa donde ella vive ya que antes era de tierra.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Lisbeth   dijo que gracias a este préstamos  otorgado por ceprodel va poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lisbeth Carolina P. Rodríguez works as a Labor Resource Analyst at the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She has three children, two of whom are school-age, and she is a single mother. She has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for six years and in this time-period she has invested these loans in bettering her living conditions thanks to the financing given by CEPRODEL. The loan she is requesting will be invested in buying construction materials such as cement and sand to finish tiling her house, which before was made of earth. She hopes this will provide greater security and better living conditions for her children. Lisbeth said thank you for this loan granted by CEPRODEL which will improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her housing and addition

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Molicay in Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth operates a motorcycle transportation service. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to repair her motorcycle so she can provide better service. This will be Elizabeth's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Heberto Antonio

texts.es:
El  Señor Heberto Antonio P. M., Labora como Técnico de Computación A en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, el tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y  dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento y arena, para la construcción de  dos paredes de un cuarto para sus dos hijos pequeños. 

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Heberto dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Heberto Antonio P. Medrana, works as a computer technician in the Manuel Olivares Rodriguez Institute of Managua. He is married and has three children, 2 still in school. He has received three loans from CEPRODEL for the last three years, and thanks to these loans offered by CEPRODEL, during this time he has invested the money in improving his home. The loan he is asking for is to buy construction materials such as: stone, cement, and sand-to be used in building two walls of a room for his two youngest children. Thanks to the loans that he has been granted by CEPRODEL, Heberto is able to offer a better and safer living standard for his children and to improve his home

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his home

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo T. is from the village of Poblacion 2 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 53 years old. Rodolfo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo operates a "habal-habal" motorcycle transportation service in the local community. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from his business.

In 2010, Rodolfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to repair one a motorcycle that he uses in his business. This will be Rodolfo first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Leonor del Carmen López Hernández, Labora como Supervisora Técnica de Computación en el Instituto Manuel Olivares de Managua, ella tiene un  hijos a su cargo, y  este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  ella es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines, para reparar parte del techo de su casa de habitación por lo que el anterior se encontraba en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Leonor dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leonor del Carmen López Hernández works as a Technical Supervisor of Computing at the Manuel Olivares Institute in Managua. She has school-age children and is married. She has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for the past year and in this time period she has invested the loans in improving her housing, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL. She is an excellent client. The loan she is requesting is to invest in buying construction materials such as zinc and metallic pieces to repair part of the roof of her house, which has been in bad condition. This will provide greater security and better living conditions for her children. Leonor said thank you for the financing from CEPRODEL which has enabled her to improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve her housing and addition

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin A. is from the village of Kinangay Norte. He is 56 years old and married, with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Valentin operates a family member's business, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Valentin has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Valentin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Valentin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Valentin is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Valentin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is located in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.en:
Leopolda S. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married, with one school-aged child.  To make a living,  Leopolda owns and operates a pedicab transport (sikad-sikad) business.  She has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Leopolda joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 10000 PHP, to repair her existing vehicle for better service.  Leopolda plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is located in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her pedicab

loans.name: Douglas

texts.es: El señor Douglas tiene una pulpería la cual esta ubicada en su casa, el crédito lo invertirá en su negocio para incrementarlo mas ya que sus cliente quieren variedad en el negocio y el les podrá brindar una mejor atención esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos para su familia ha tenido dos créditos con CEPRODEL  y dos años el negocio, el señor dice que estos créditos le han beneficiado bastante ya que su negocio a crecido mas y ha podido ayudar a sus padres con lo gastos de la familia y además con sus estudios universitario ya que  el es soltero todavía.
texts.en:
Señor Douglas has a small grocery store that is located in his house. He will invest his loan in his business to supply it more since his customers want more variety. He will be able to offer them better service, which will help him improve his income for his family. He has had two loans with Ceprodel in the two years he has had his business. He says that these loans have benefited him a lot and that his business has grown more. He has been able to help his parents with their family's expenses and also with the costs of his college education since he is still a bachelor.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, rice, oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba C. is from the city of Maloro Tangub City. She is 28 years old and single. To make a living, Melba provides motor transport services in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month..

Melba joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melba is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP. loans.name: Kim Thị's Group

texts.en:
"V. Kim Thị (0) is a 32 year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông anh - Hà nội. V. is the leader of a two-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mạch Tràng (1). V. is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, V. operates a family member's general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. V. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA that she used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.450.000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. This will be V.'s 5th loan from SEDA. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: Đào Thị P. (10102140030) is a 35 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.450.000 VND loan to support her recycling business.

 

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

 

 

V. Kim Thị (0) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông anh - Hà nội. V. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Mạch Tràng (1). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa P.. V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2007, V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. V. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.028.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đào Thị P. (10102140030) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.450.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1. Chử Thị T. (10105030027) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


2. Nguyễn Thị D. (10105030028) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business selling home products.


3. Đào Thị Thúy L. (10105030030) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


4. Nguyễn Thị H. (10105030029) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her retail store.


5. Vũ Thị T. (10105030026) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


A. Phạm Thị (10105030025) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông A. - Hà nội. A. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Hội Phụ (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doA. nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. A. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, A. kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2006, A. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy. A. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.028.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên L. thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

3. Đào Thị Thúy L. (10105030030) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. sản xuất.


4. Nguyễn Thị H. (10105030029) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun L., age 30, is married and lives with her three school-aged children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. L. stays at home to do the household chores and take care of her children while her husband, who is a construction foreman, works in town, earning an income of USD $7.00 per day to help their family. L. and her family members try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses and to reduce their daily expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of US $1200 from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase construction equipment to help her husband’s business. With the remainder, she wants to buy rice for her family. This is her third loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and rice for the family's use

loans.name: Vai

texts.en:
Vai H., age 32, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. H. stays at home to look after the household, do chores and care for her children while her husband works. Her husband is a skilled fisherman who fishes in his village near the great lake of Cambodia, earning an income of USD $5.00 per day to help the family. H. and her family members try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses and to reduce daily expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of US $400 from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transport her fish so her husband can sell it at the market. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fish to market

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda A. is from the village of Miputak. She is 55 years old. Alfreda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Alfreda owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Alfreda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2006, Alfreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase of livestock feeds and supplies for her pig-raising business. 

Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her grocery store and to use as working capital. This will be Alfreda's fifth loan from PMPC and her second loan on Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em H., 40, is married and lives with her five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Em H. raises chickens and pigs, earning US $3 per day to help support the family. The family is also supported by her husband who helps her raise the animals at home, earning US $3 per day.

They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as cover the necessary daily expenses. Em H. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. loans.name: Ider

texts.en: Ider lives with his wife, two daughters and son in a house that he describes as "not being able to hold heat well". He decided to replace his stove with an energy-efficient one in hopes of keeping his family warmer. Additionally he hoped that the new stove would not produce as much smoke inside the house as the old did. So far, he has noticed that the stove has kept his family much warmer and he also believes that the stove, through being more efficient, will help with the city’s pollution. He has since recommended the product to his neighbors. Ider used to live in Khovd province but moved to Ulaanbaatar seven years ago to find more work as an electrician and to allow his kids to grow up and be educated in the city. About XacBank Eco Products Program Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 degrees Celsius. Sixty percent of the city's population live in tents called gers with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the ger districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. During the heating season, 60% of the pollution in the city is attributed to coal burned in the ger districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels. XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy-efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To fund an energy-efficient heating stove

texts.en:
Carolina S. is 35 years old, single, and has no children. She is a very strict and hardworking lady. For the last two years, she has been running a general store where she sells products such as soft drinks, bread, sugar, rice and hair extensions. She sells her products to local people, schools and colleges. Her business is located at Khayega in Kakamega, in a busy market along a busy road. In addition to her general store, she also provides computer services.
Carolina works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure her business' success in a market where there are many other traders engaging in the same kind of business as hers. Her major challenge is lack of funds, and that is why she is requesting a loan to increase her stock in order to grow her business. Carolina is also using her loan to start up a car wash to generate extra income. Her hope is to improve her living standards and build a beautiful house for herself. She also dreams of becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks, rice and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario A. is from the village of Malintubuan. She is 46 years old. Rosario is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. 

Rosario is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which again will be used to invest in her business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.en:

She has to travel to many places in her province to provide her cooking services. She is able to generate an income of USD 8 per day to assist the family.  Rourm has been in this business since 1996. Her husband (pictured here) helps his wife in the business, and when he is available, operates his motorbike as a driver, earning USD 5 per day. 

Rourm and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as meet the daily living expenses. As a result, Rourm T. is requesting a loan of US $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to rent a food stand at a local market to sell food. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

In order to improve her family living, Mrs. RY K. decided to apply for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr Snar Panh is a house builder who makes a small income which supports his family. Mrs. RY K. is a mother of two children who are attending in local school. The members of the loan group are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
Dolgormaa is a teacher who lives in Mongolia with her two children and husband (pictured). She moved to her current residence 12 to 13 years ago. She had recently seen an Eco Products advertisement and decided to buy an energy efficient stove.  So far she has noticed that stove has helped her save money on fuel and that it keeps her yurt warmer for a longer time then her old stove. Based on her recommendation, her brother, and a friend’s mother have also bought similiar stoves.  She adds, “There is too much air pollution and smoke in Ulaanbaatar and I’m willing to take action against it.” 

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy an energy efficient heating stove

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert C. N. is 23 years old, single, and has no children. His business is located at Gikomba in Nairobi. He sells electronics such as mobile phone chargers, iron boxes, radios and water heaters. Gikomba is an open-air market where there are many other people with small-scale businesses in the same kind of business, but Robert works very hard to have a competitive edge. He has been engaged in his business for three years and sees himself becoming the leading wholesaler of electronics in Nairobi. He is using his loan to increase his stock with a view to growing his business. He is very hardworking and handsome.

loans.use: To buy iron boxes, chargers, radios, padlocks and water heaters

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a chef and lives with her six-year-old daughter. She has lived in the city for the past ten years. Together with her parents, she took out a loan for several tons of sawdust briquettes – a cleaner and more efficient fuel then traditional lignite coal. So far, Nina has been really satisfied with the fuel because it produces so much more energy than usual briquettes. As a result, both her and her parents have experienced savings in their fuel costs. In addition, she feels that the eco-fuel produces less smoke and smell. Consequently, she has recommended the product to her neighbors and co-workers.

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty per cent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty per cent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as forty per cent of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.
XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To purchase clean, energy-efficient heating fuel

loans.name: Rolande

texts.fr: A. Rolande est née le 13 Mai 1981 et est mariée à AGOSSOU Claude un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Rolande mène comme activité, la vente d’habits, de chaussures dames, de tissus et de sacs à main de façon ambulante, et aussi à son domicile. Rolande s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Rolande a obtenu déjà deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Très sollicitée par sa clientèle, Rolande ambitionne renforcer son capital et élargir son champ d’activité, afin de mieux faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante des clients. C’est la raison pour laquelle Rolande sollicite un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Rolande A. was born May 13, 1981, and is married to Claude AGOSSOU, a mechanic. The couple has three children, all attending school. The family lives in the Zogbo neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple share support for the family. To meet her various needs, Rolande sells clothing, ladies’ shoes, fabric and handbags, both from her home or as an itinerant retailer. Rolande gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo, a country neighbouring Benin. Rolande has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been fully reimbursed. She is in high demand, and wants to increase her working capital and diversify her business, so that she can better respond to her customers’ ever-increasing needs. For this reason she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, shoes and fabric
